placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Theresienbad is a typical Viennese bathing beach located next to Schonbrunn, offering a blend of old-world tradition and beautiful surroundings in the 13th district. It provides a surreal summer and holiday experience without interruptions. The swimming pool caters to beginners with shallow areas for children, while still allowing space for longer swims. The sauna area is well-maintained and easily accessible, with friendly and attentive staff who are constantly engaged in cleaning and assisting visitors.

reviews.reviewText: This is the best public spa I have been to, timeless, cosy and functional with a small price tag of €16 for 3 hours.

As a couple without kids, we tried to get there during mid august, middle of the work week but it was extremely overcrowded. Only half a lane is kept somewhat clear for swimmers who try to get a workout in, but its hard when its next to the jumping board. Kids and teens can jump from the sides as you try to swim in the lane kept up for swimmers, they don't get whistled at. Often the lifeguards would just whistle then look the other way, nobody knowing why they whistled or what a person did wrong. Yet they would focus in on a few youngsters just floating by the edge, not doing anything, not blocking the way but they would get picked at. At the buffet they have 3 different langos, but if you are hungarian you can forget about sour cream and cheese. Despite that the staff at the buffet was friendly, the cashiers at the entrance were dismissive and rude.

Has a well maintained large green area, with plenty of old trees and first class lawn. A real oasis in Meidling.
recommendable for families with small kids as it has a separate shallow pool and large playground next to it.
one star down as there is only one outdoor pool suitable for swimming, which can get rather crowded on weekends. still, it is a modern, nice one, made out of steel - water is pristine.

Slightly old world swimming hall in easy reach.  Friday at 09:00 hrs not too many people. Meaning perfect for swimming as many lengths as wanted. Haven't tried the outdoor facilities. Very recommended

Great place for Summer, have everything, inside pool for big and small children, two outside pools also to enjoy the sun, and a big green area to rest and laid down as a lizard.. recommend with children!.. Sauna available also.

This is the 4th swimming pool that I’ve visited in Vienna. It easily has the friendliest staff

Was much more relaxed than the others

Lots of people here enjoying themselves and not taking their swimming super seriously

Admission was very reasonable - Four Euro

Friendly and clean
Family friendly large swimming pool with outdoor and indoor area. There is a restaurant, playground, free sunbeds
Overall it is a good experience every time I'm there , laying down, swimming and just enjoy the weather..

sources.snippet: The bathing spots within the National Park Lobau are a well-kept secret cherished by nature enthusiasts. Stretching east of Vienna, and north of the Danube all the way to the Slovakian border, the Lobau boasts a stunning landscape of water, forests, and meadows. This hidden gem serves as a true paradise for nature lovers seeking an authentic experience.
sources.shortName: Where to go swimming

sources.snippet: If you’re a nature lover looking for a peaceful beach getaway, head to Lobau. As a natural reserve located on the outskirts of Vienna, Lobau is a tranquil oasis that offers a unique experience away from the crowds.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Vienna Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

placeMetadata.name: Albertina

sources.snippet: The Albertina Museum is another cultural highlight, featuring works by some of the greatest names in art history. This autumn, the museum is hosting exhibitions from artists such as Picasso and Monet. The building itself is an architectural marvel, and visitors can enjoy views of Vienna’s city center from its terrace.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches to Visit in Mallorca This Summer

placeMetadata.description: 19th-century Habsburg palace with staterooms & collections of old master prints & 20th-century art.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Albertina is a 19th-century Habsburg palace located in the largest of the Habsburg dynasty's residential palaces. It houses an extensive collection of old master prints, 20th-century art, over 65,000 watercolors and drawings, and about 70,000 photographs. The museum features works by renowned artists such as Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Raphael, Rembrandt and others.

reviews.reviewText:
Magnificent museum worth spending a whole day in. Once a residential palace , later transfomed into an art museum by Maria Christine ( daughter of Queen Maria Theresa)and her husban Albert, hence the name - Alberina.
Great collection of modern and contemporary art.  Albrecht Dürer famous Hare , Modigliani Female Semi Nude, some Picasso, Klimt are just a few highlights of the collection.
I was lucky to see Matthew Wong exhibition here. What a wonderful discovery! I enjoyed every painting of it.
Don't miss the terrace featured in the movie  The Tabacconist.
Loved my visit and would come back to enjoy more next time I'm in Vienna.

Visited Albertina museum this afternoon. What a treat to anyone who loves art. Top floor of Albertina museum hosts an amazing collection entitled From Monet To Picasso that is a home to many pieces by Monet, Renoir, Kandinsky, Kokoshka, and Picasso. Admission is reasonable: as of July 2025, children under 19 get in free, and my adult ticket was 19 euros. Audioguides are free for children and 5 euros for adults, those are available in all major languages. The museum building itself is absolutely georgeous.
Great museum with stunning Impressionist works and elegant historic staterooms. Not too crowded, easy to enjoy. A must-visit in Vienna!

What a delightful experience! I came for a visit on a Friday afternoon as the museum is open until 9 with less people.
I have to say paying the extra 5 euro for the audio guide you download on your phone was worth every penny. It gave me such a deeper understanding of the collections and paintings. The narrator connects big part of the paintings from the exhibitions with history, background and interesting tidbits of information about the artists. I felt totally immersed in one world at a time for each part I visited.
I started with the Matthew Wong (a Canadian artist I didn’t know about but was totally mesmerized by his art) and Van Gogh, this was such a moving exhibition especially when you learn about the life and struggles of both and connect this to their paintings.
The Monet to Picasso exhibit spanned many painters and touched on my favourite Impressionism.
Then I saw the fascinating exhibition on drawings on coloured backgrounds Leonardo -Durer, so interesting!
2.5 hours went by so quickly and that wasn’t even all of the museum. I hope to be able to return and see more exhibition at this beautiful place.
In summary, this is lovely place if you love art and it is well organized and presented. Get the audio guide and prepare to be absolutely immersed in a different world. Superb!

This is a great museum with famous colections, including some modern art. Small rooms, but spacious, seating benches, some parts include stairs, not crowded, but busy. We spent 2-3 hrs inside and It was worth it.

Good contemporary museum with regular changing expositions. Have visited the exhibition "From Monet to Picasso" exhibition this weekend, enjoyed contemplating quite a few fabulous pieces of art by impressionist and post-impressionists

My favourite museum, feels like you have visited 3 or more. You can get lost inside for hours... Magnificent interior, tons of famous pictures, beautifully arranged and curated. Definitely must visit while in Vienna! There's a great online "combo" ticket so you can explore this one and Albertina Modern. Not that the price is relevant for this experience...

In my opinion the best museum in Vienna.

It is a great example of a combination of classic and modern architecture both outside and inside. The cloakroom, lockers and the toilet are located before ticketing. Cloakroom costs some euro (can’t remember if it’s 1€ or 2€, only cash) but if you don’t have any money for it, the staff will give you token for the lockers - that’s really useful, thank you so much!

I recommend buying ticket online but it’s not a big deal cause queue was minimal (at least on Monday 12PM). After the ticket office area, you enter the exhibition, cafe and shop place. The staff is giving u some sort of sticker and if you want to came back to lockers or something they would know that you already bought a ticket.

The most impressive collection is the one located on level 2 - MONET TO PICASSO. The Batliner Collection. It’s a a comprehensive exhibition of the most important art of the XIX and XX centuries (names such as: Monet, Degas, Signac, Klimt, Matisse, die Brücke artists i.e. Ernst Ludwig Kirchner, Karl Schmidt Rottluff, Munch, Kandinsky, Klee, Kupka, Magritte, Miró, Picasso). Don’t know why there wasn’t Francis Bacon and Marc Chagall on display.

On the first floor there are also quite charming rooms - Prunkräume, which could be interesting to people fond of this period - however everyone should see in the last of rooms works by Albrecht Dürer.

Prices in shop btw:
Magnet - 4,90€,
Postcards - 1,5-2€,
Monet to Picasso exhibition book - 19,90€.

placeMetadata.name: Belvedere Palace

sources.snippet: Belvedere Palace is another must-visit location in Vienna, especially in autumn. Its grand baroque gardens, with their intricate sculptures and fountains, are framed by the brilliant hues of fall foliage. The Upper Belvedere houses one of Austria’s most important art collections, including Gustav Klimt’s masterpiece, The Kiss.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches to Visit in Mallorca This Summer

placeMetadata.description: Baroque, 18th-century palaces housing art from Middle Ages to today, with notable Klimt collection.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Belvedere Palace is a stunning example of Baroque architecture located in Vienna's Landstrasse district. It consists of two grand palaces separated by a beautiful French-style garden. Originally built as a summer residence for Prince Eugene of Savoy in the 18th century, it now houses an impressive art collection spanning from the Middle Ages to contemporary works, including a notable collection of Klimt paintings.

reviews.reviewText:
This is a must if you're in Vienna.
The inside of the palace (upper side) is very beautiful and it offers not only Austrian art but also contemporary art. In the lower side you can find a different exhibition, this time they had different close ups of the most important works of art they had in the museum.

Visiting Belvedere Palace in Vienna is a feast for the eyes, particularly if you appreciate grand architecture and historic structures. The palace itself is stunning, with intricate interiors and elegant layouts that make wandering through its halls a visual delight. Even with parts of the building under restoration, the charm and grandeur of the palace remain impressive.

The exhibition, however, is less remarkable. While it has its moments, it doesn’t quite match the awe-inspiring atmosphere created by the palace and its architecture. Art lovers may enjoy it, but for those primarily seeking a “wow” factor, it may feel underwhelming.

A practical note: the queues can be long, especially on weekends. Even if you buy tickets online, you may have to wait for a later slot; when we arrived, our online tickets only allowed entry three hours later. Planning ahead and booking well in advance is highly recommended.

The gardens are fantastic and free to explore. Locals often jog, run, or just relax there, and it's lovely to see artists drawing or people chilling. Overall, the views and grounds make it worth avisit!

Overall, Belvedere Palace is worth visiting for its architecture and historical appeal, but don’t set your expectations too high for the exhibitions.

The castle was awesome.  Likes the gardens as well . Should spend more time there but we had only 1 hour as . Too many things to see here in Vienna for sure .
Like the way everything is put .
Gardens are not fully blooming as of now

Excellent collection of paintings. Beautiful garden and view from Upper Belvedere to Lower Belvedere. Not to forget about the Famous Painting of Gutav Klimt, "The Kiss". Easy access via local public transport. If you brought ticket go directly to the main entrance.

Belvedere Palace was incredibly stunning! It is worth coming here while you are in Vienna. The grounds and palace are beautiful as you would expect. Where it really shines though is the inside. The art collection is absolutely incredible and is something you should not miss in Vienna. It is so amazing to come here and admire works of art and to learn about the history of that art, and the artists behind it. The kiss is the main draw of the Belvedere for many, it is much more beautiful in person than what you would expect. I would definitely recommend buying tickets in advance and coming in the morning is the way to go here because of the crowds.

Went to Belvedere Palace mainly to see Gustav Klimt’s The Kiss, and it was absolutely worth it. The painting is even more breathtaking in person..the colors, the details, and the atmosphere around it make the experience unforgettable.

The palace itself is beautiful, with lovely gardens and stunning architecture, but my highlight was definitely standing in front of The Kiss. If you’re an art lover, this is a must-see in Vienna.

p.s: In my case, i only went inside the main building, which is why it greatly influences my review of the place....
(words cannot seem enough for me to describe how great this place was and how it made me feel..)
I remember the first time i walked past the gates of this magical place...
I was stunned.
The Lower Belvedere (the smaller building to your right when you walk through the main gate) was just a great glimse reflecting the grace, delicacy and beauty of the main thing which was just above your view.
Making your way up, walking through the gardens, the power of the sphinxs making itself known around your every step ; finally reaching your end where you stood just in front of the building and getting sad that your eye cannot capture the whole view in just a gaze.
This was about the back of the palace, you get curious and start looking around until you get to the front of the building.
I can describe looking at the details of the scene was like looking at a perfectly decorated piece of cake you dreamed of getting for your birthday.
The inside is just a whole another story written and built on it's own.
A fairytale coming to life, bringing its glory to your step and senses....
The carved stone making you not feel alone, the painted walls feeling like home and the pieces of art having your breath taken away for seconds....
Visiting the palace overrall was such a fulfilling and calming experience for me and everytime i make my way back to the city of Vienna, this place will be always waiting for my next visit.

Personally only visited the gardens and coffee shop both of which were lovely. The palace is gorgeous from the outside and if you've visited the other palaces in vienna and are not massively into art then I think that is enough for Belvedere.

placeMetadata.name: Krapfenwaldlbad

sources.snippet: Krapfenwaldlbad: This public swimming pool complex is located on the hills of Vienna, offering stunning views of the city. It has several pools, a grassy sunbathing area, and a restaurant.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches Near Vienna

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Perched atop the hills of Dobling, Krapfenwaldlbad, affectionately known as Krawa, offers a breathtaking view of Vienna and has become increasingly popular in recent years. This outdoor swimming area in the woods provides a refreshing escape from the city center, attracting both locals and visitors seeking relaxation and family fun. While it can get crowded, the stunning panoramic views make it worth a visit.

reviews.reviewText:
Discover Krapfenwaldlbad - Freibad der Stadt Wien Vienna, the ultimate outdoor haven for relaxation and family fun! 🌞🏊‍♂️

🕒 Opening Hours:
Monday to Friday: 9 AM to 7:30 PM
Saturday, Sunday, and Holidays: 8 AM to 7:30 PM
Ticket Sales End: Half an hour before closing time
Facility Closes: Half an hour after closing time
In case of bad weather, pools might close early (Strandbad Gänsehäufel at 5 PM)

💲 Admission Prices:
- Infants (2017 to 2023): Free
- Kids (2009 to 2016): €2.40
- Teens (2005 to 2008): €3.90
- Adults (2004 and below): €7
- Reduced Adults: €5.20
- Family Ticket (1 Adult and 1 Child): €8.30
- Afternoon Ticket from 1 PM: €5.50
- Afternoon Ticket from 4 PM: €4.20
- Cabin Upgrade: €3.10

🏊‍♂️ Features:
- Multipurpose Pool
- Teaching Pool
- Kids' Pool
- Adventure Pool with Massage Jets
- Sunbathing Areas
- Beach Volleyball Court
- Soccer Field
- Street Basketball
- Children's Playground
- Kiddie Slide
- Trampoline Area
- Restaurant & Buffet
- Massage Services
- Bike Parking
- Accessible Facilities

🚽 Amenities:
- Restrooms
- Showers

Unwind, soak up the sun, and enjoy a refreshing dip in the pools at Krapfenwaldlbad. Whether you're here for a leisurely swim or quality family time, this Freibad offers a range of activities and relaxation options. Make the most of your summer days in Vienna with this exceptional outdoor experience! 🌴🏖️

Visiting Viennese friends is the reason we were able to spend the day at this public pool. It was incredible to see the gathering of locals in this public pool building that's been fully restored. The water was a brisk 25 degrees Celsius. Plenty of huge trees and grass to lounge. Besides the huge main, there are 2 others for kids.

Super lovely public pool! We had a great day here and enjoyed the sun beds and the huge area to lay in. There are spaces in the shade and also in the sun. The pools are very clean and have different heights. Only missing some slides and things to jump off in our opinion! Besides that perfect and a great view over Vienna.

Krapfenwaldlbad – Best Views, Chill Vibes, but Bring Snacks. Super busy on weekends.

Krapfenwaldlbad is hands down one of the most beautiful pools in Vienna. The views from the swimming pools over the city are incredible, and there are plenty of grassy spots to relax, tan, or just enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.

However, be aware that the restaurant prices have become pretty ridiculous in recent years—definitely not budget-friendly. I’d recommend bringing a cooler bag with your own food and drinks if you're planning to stay for a while.

That said, their French fries are surprisingly great, so maybe worth a small splurge if you’re craving a snack.

Second time here, both on Saturday. Loving this place. Think it's one of the most atmospheric pool complex in Vienna. The view and the pine trees make it all so much special. Several pools, large complex. There is a pool just for adults and a pool with a hydromassage . Entrance fee is 7 euros. There are free parking lots, those are small though.

Extremely busy over the weekend, if you come after 10am good luck finding shade or a sun-bed.
The view was nice.
Beautiful pools and park, lovely view of the city!
Pool(s) with a very nice view over Vienna. Can get crowded on hot days, particularly in the afternoon. Popular with annoying instagrammers. Pretty large pine trees.

placeMetadata.name: Strandbar Herrmann

sources.snippet: Strandbar Herrmann: This is a popular beach bar located on the Danube Canal. While not a beach for swimming, it does offer a beach-like atmosphere with sand, deck chairs, and refreshing cocktails. It's a great place to relax, people-watch, and enjoy the summer weather.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Beaches Near Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Open-air bar with sand, hammocks, deckchairs, DJ sessions & global food including weekend brunches.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Strandbar Herrmann is a lively open-air bar located on the Danube Canal in Vienna, offering a beach-like atmosphere with sand, hammocks, and deck chairs. This popular spot attracts locals and visitors alike who come to relax, enjoy refreshing cocktails, and listen to DJ sessions. The bar is known for its weekend brunches and happy hour from 5pm to 6pm. Despite being far from the sea, it exudes a holiday vibe that draws crowds during the summer months.

reviews.reviewText:
If you read this then I’m glad to tell you that you must have to visit this place while you in Vienna.
Very good atmosphere,nice view,nice people
Cold beer what else you want next to the Danube canal .
Just go there you won’t regret
☮️😎🙏🤞👌

Relaxing atmosphere with nice beach set-up and good cocktails.
Can get quite hot when temperatures are high and you aren't lucky enough to get a shady place.
Place offers good cocktails for a fair price, it's spacious (and outdoors) and self-service at the different bars.
Service is quick and friendly, payments by cards are possible.

You can only make reservations for 10+ people so it's "come first" with the best tables / places to sit.

Perfect for a drink with friends, afterwork, or just chilling over the weekend!
Amazing!
You can't make a reservation, so if it's sunny and the weekend, you should come early to get a seat !

Unique location in the city, they have managed to create a great atmosphere. We went there on busy moments, but there was always some place for us, and waiting times at the bar were minimal. Bar personnel was great. Food is quite expensive though
I discovered this place 3 year ago and I offered 5 stars back then. I came back to Wien this year and still, 5 stars. The most unique atmosphere here. Love this place!
Limited food but quick and tasty. Self serve food and drinks. We spent couple of hours there with a friend.

Great place to just sit enjoy the sun and the sunset. They usually have a DJ and some chill vibe music playing great atmosphere for sure. The food option as Asian fusion so fried rice, noodle, spring rolls. They also have chicken wings and nugget and fries. Great drinks cocktails, soft drinks and beer. The drinks prices are reasonable but food prices are a on the high end. Overall if you just want to chill great place!
Amazing artificial beach, really popular!

placeMetadata.name: Badeschiff Wien

sources.snippet: The Badeschiff (english: Bathing Ship) is a "swimming swimming pool" right on a boat floating in the danube canal, right in the city center!. What already sounds cool gets even better when finding out there is a bar as well as a restaurant attached to it, serving you with cool drinks and delicious mediterranean food. There are also plenty of beach chairs all across the deck for you to chill and sunbath on.
sources.shortName: Where to go swimming

placeMetadata.description: Trendy venue on a boat, with bar, restaurant, sun deck & swimming pool, plus DJs & live music.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Badeschiff Wien is a unique venue located on a boat anchored in the Donaukanal between Schwedenplatz and Urania. It features an outdoor swimming pool, a sundeck, and a craft ale bar and restaurant that incorporates beer into its dishes. The ship has a shabby chic vibe and is popular among hipsters.

reviews.reviewText: Fun place to drop in , beautiful sunset pic , couple of drinks , was a little cold but worth the visit , will definitely return

Eating on a barge, very popular place with the younger generation. Self-service. Drink and food prices are reasonable but found it rather funny that once we ordered food at the bar, we were told to then go down to the kitchen in 10 minutes to collect it. Rather heavy but we got it back to our table safely and it was very enjoyable.

The pool is the best in town (no competition because there is no such other outdoor pool in downtown), and the best opening hours! In summer you can swim until 22.00 which is super nice for working people, who can NEVER make it into a pool/bath because they close at 19.00 latest. Thats an absolute rarity here and I m happy about it. I hope others would follow their model. In plus, you can eat and drink something as,well. No service though, only self service. The atmosphere there is very casual and relaxed. Freedom in city! Super, when it is hot.

Great views of the canal and the northern part of the city. A nice place to catch the sunset. The barge is pretty rustic but has a nice atmosphere. Staff were very friendly. There’s no signage on how things work until you go way up to the middle deck but after that it’s all good. Well worth a stop in.

I don't know about food, showers etc i did not buy pool ticket, just small cocktails, they were only 5-7 EUR, served nice and cold! Chilling on deck upstairs especially at evening was great, romantic views. A place to visit both daytime and night! They have a dancefloor for parties downstairs too.

The only good things that can be said are the location is nice and there’s a good atmosphere at the top for music and a few drinks.

Unfortunately the barman served me the worst poured beer I have ever seen. With about 40% foam and the beer itself tasted funky, something was off. Very poor service. Don’t order beer from the tap here.

Won’t be returning for a drink. Maybe a swim.
Waiter was very aggressive he doesn’t know how to treat humans, probably he doesn’t even have friends. Also without any bias but their tacos are the worst I ever had and very over-priced
Pretty cool spot , good vibe . People , staff/customers  were friendly.

placeMetadata.name: Adria

sources.snippet: Laying aside the Donau Canal this is another important place for Vienna people and the Porsche tourists to spend a nice evening meal time with an exotic beach view. The sunny evening, relaxed vibes, and Aperol, near the Danube provides this Vienna’s beach one of the best terrace views in Vienna, with a great selection of drinks in the nearby restaurants to offer. Address: Obere Donaustraße 77, 1020 Wien, Austria
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 10 Beaches in Vienna

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: A cozy and warm cafe with a view of the canal, Adria is perfect for a relaxing evening. The menu features burgers and pasta dishes, and there is parking available nearby.

reviews.reviewText: So nice place! Sunny evening, relax and aperol, Danube near. We sit not long, may be 1,5 hours. People walked. We took big sandwich and it was great! Just sit, drink, observe the world around!

Great place! Really cosy and warm with a fantastic view out onto the canal. We visited in January with snow on the ground just as they were closing. The owner kept the place open for us and came over for a chat. Would give 6 stars if I could! :)

My experience on a Friday afternoon was not so good. The staff atbthe cashier was a bit rude. We ordered a verlängerter and a cafe latte and both were not good at all. The prices however are ok. The location is really good and they also have a cool indoor area. Its definitely one was the nice places to see but unfortunately I did not have a good experience.

A very nice place facing the river, but the preparation of the cocktail I had decided to take, a gin and tonic was not well calibrated ... maybe he had forgotten to pour the gin. I do not recommend it.

Usually crowded when it’s nice weather, and for good reason - a great place to be in Vienna in Spring, you’ll get a surprising amount of beer and wine and other alcoholic and nonalcoholic beverages at this bar right at the Danube. Lately there’s even a food stand available.

Prices are on par for the Donaukanal area, you won’t have to wait too long to get a drink and there’s many seating options available - even inside, for when the weather’s not playing nice for once.

Really nice spot to sit alongside the Donaukanal. The only canal "beach bar" to stay open most of the cold months. Large deck outside, covered and glassed-in areas for when it rains. Serves beer, wine, etc., as well as (J. "Charcoal" Hornig) coffee and some simple foods. Sometimes food carts set up here in the summer. Gets really busy on nice summer days from about 5 pm till just after sundown.

Excellent place to chillax and relax. It opens in April till the end of summer. It serves good 🍺 beers and small food and even 🍔 burgers. It's on the sunny side of the Donau channel, so the sun is shinning on most part of the day. They have sandy beach like an ambience, with beach chairs, where you can sit and enjoy the small ferries that sail by😃
Really great place to sit and drink coffee, cocktail by the river. The downside is that you cannot pay with the card.

placeMetadata.name: Seestadt

sources.snippet: My personal “Caribbean” in Vienna involves a longer metro ride, but it’s totally worth it!. The Seestadt is a rather new housing/living development in the “fields” of Vienna and while the project slowly comes to life, the artificial lake draws the most attention on a hot summer day. Shade is somewhat limited but the pebble beaches are usually not overcrowded and the clear, turquoise water is even more inviting!
sources.shortName: The best places to swim in Vienna in summer

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Seestadt, located in Vienna, has undergone a remarkable transformation over the years. It's easily accessible via the U2 line, with stations like Museumsquartier and Volkstheater providing convenient access. This area offers a peaceful escape from the bustling city center, featuring modern architecture and a serene lake perfect for relaxation and leisurely activities. Designed with families in mind, Seestadt boasts ample open spaces, public parks, and bicycle-friendly pathways.

reviews.reviewText: The Seestadt is the new town in Vienna and probably the best in the city. The town is designed to meet the perfect need for the people particularly families which require open space and public parks. The whole town is bicycle friendly. The lake gives it a best area to live in. Clean water for swimming. And many more
Strange place.  Visited as I had heard it was a nice lake to swim in.   Loads of better places in Vienna to visit.   Very residential with a small lake (that looks more like a large pond)
A must-see place in Austria, especially during the summer months.
Super

Nice place if you want to escape from the crowded places of Vienna. It is a quite place to relax, walk around or just read a book next to the water, you can have a beautiful view. In contrast to the city center where you can find a mixture of architecture representing many periods and styles, like Baroque, in Seestadt you can find the modern style of buildings. You can reach this place with U2, direction Seestadt.
Well .. patience! Sometimes u have to wait little longer. I always have to take 88B , and i should wait more than 20 min sometimes. But it's away from the city, so it's understandable.
The tallest wood building in Europe, 84 meters tall.
Great neighborhood, wide streets, a lot of shops and services around. And it also has a self-driving bus! Auto.bus Seestadt! 😀

placeMetadata.name: New Danube

sources.snippet: You can go open water swimming almost anywhere in the New Danube. But we especially like the area around the Vienna City Beach Club,even if this Danube side arm offers many other possibilities for swimming.
sources.shortName: Open water swimming - The most beautiful places in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Artificial waterway parallel to the River Danube & separated by an island, popular for swimming.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: New Danube is an artificial waterway that runs parallel to the River Danube, separated by an island. It's a popular spot for open water swimming, with Vienna City Beach Club being a particularly favored area. The banks of New Danube offer wide and open areas with reeded sections as it flows into the large Danube floodplain. This calm and family-friendly place is perfect for picnics, cycling, and morning walks.

reviews.reviewText:
Such a cool and calm place to spend a day with family.
Please bring along the food and beverage as the place doesn't have much shops nearby.
Very nice place for swimming and picnics
It's dangerous there. Police came yesterday to punish criminals. There are elswhere no lights, really bad.
Calm, quiet, relaxing, good for a morning walk, for cycling and picnic too, a family friendly area
We all need a rest while traveling, it is one of the most important places to relax and enjoy a beautiful scenery
I love this place!! Many times we have been here with friends))
Love
A great place to walk and enjoy the river views and relax in a place easily reached from the city centre.

sources.snippet: One is the Panozzalacke – perfectly suited for children, because the water is quite shallow, while the wide sunbathing lawn offers plenty of space to relax and let off steam.
sources.shortName: Vienna - great beaches, 500 km away from the sea

reviews.reviewText: Suuper FKK Badepplatz,

Before you go to this place, you should know why.
If you go for birdwatching, dragonfly and admiring nature, it's nice.
If you want to go for a swim, turn around and go to Donau.
Beautiful lake with abundance of waterlylies and big fish

(Translated by Google) beautiful swimming pond ❤ and always worth a trip.

(Original)
wunderschöner Badeteich ❤ und immer einen Ausflug wert.

(Translated by Google) For years it has been an ideal “stage destination” on Lobau tours by bike or on foot.  Pure nature and Lobau at its best including beach and feel-good places...

(Original)
Seit Jahren (m)ein ideales "Etappenziel" auf Lobaurunden per Rad oder zu Fuß.  Natur pur und Lobau vom Feinsten inklusive Strand- und Wohlfühl-Platzerln...

(Translated by Google) The Panozzolacke is a wonderful excursion destination for the whole family. The water is clear, clean and not too cold. Unfortunately, there are few places to lie down directly on the lake. There are some benches and there are green areas a few meters from the water. Just around the corner is the Knusperhäuschen, where you can quench your thirst and hunger. You can only park on Raffineriestrasse, from where it's about a 10-minute walk to the lake. The former parking lot is no longer accessible via the Lobgrundstrasse entrance; there is now a barrier there.
Overall a very pleasant place where you can relax and swim.

(Original)
Die Panozzolacke ist ein wunderschöner Ausflugsort für die ganze Familie. Das Wasser ist klar, sauber und auch nicht zu kalt. Liegemöglichten gibt es leider wenige direkt am See. Es sind einige Sitzbänke vorhanden und paar Meter vom Wasser entfernt, sind Grünflächen. Gleich ums Eck ist das Knusperhäuschen, wo man den Durst und Hunger stillen kann. Parken kann man nur mehr auf der Raffineriestraße von wo man ca. 10. Gehminuten zum See hat. Den ehemaligen Parkplatz gibt es nicht mehr über die Zufahrt Lobgrundstraße, dort befindet sich jetzt ein Schranken.
Im großen und ganzen ein sehr angenehmer Ort, wo man schön entspannen und schwimmen kann.

(Translated by Google) Nice little pond, ideal for children and dogs.

(Original)
Netter kleiner Teich, ideal für Kinder und Hunde.

(Translated by Google) Open space for everyone to swim. Adults, children and dogs. There is also a swan. Big fish and toads, but they live hidden. And the most important thing. Well-stocked canteen right next to it.

(Original)
Freifläche zum Baden für alle. Erwachsene, Kinder und Hunde. Auch ein Schwan ist vorhanden. Große Fische und Kröten, welche aber versteckt leben. Und das wichtigste. Gut sortierte Kantine gleich daneben.

placeMetadata.name: Strombad Kritzendorf

sources.snippet: Often dubbed the Riviera on the Danube, this legendary beach becomes a lively scene come weekends. When it opened as a holiday area and bathing facility, it was one of the first open-air baths in Austria and grew extremely popular in the early and mid-20th century. The holiday area element is no longer in operation, and the banks and water are today open to all.
sources.shortName: 5 outdoor spots for a dip in Vienna | EasyJet

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: This outdoor bath is popular with Viennese as it is old fashioned and peaceful. It has a relaxing atmosphere and easy access to the banks of the Danube.

reviews.reviewText: Very nice area if you want to lay in the sun or just relax in the shadow. Only problem: people cannot/don't want to read the signs around and take their dogs to areas where people come with their towels thinking grass must be clean.

Rude and terrible treatment from the daughter of the owner! She kicked us out because we were having 2 tables (3 families and 6 kids) and one more family we were waiting. That was incredible experince 😂. Never again there of course!
Beautiful nature and serene atmosphere.
15 min from Vienna by train only. No entrance. Cute little snack shop, good infrastructure and restaurants. Biggest plus: The Danube is always refreshing.
Always lovely here. Its appeal is that it's old fashioned and thus quiet and relaxing. No arcades, no fancy stuff, just simple and relaxing.
Much like the twilight zone. Fascinating place to visit but lucky to escape with our lives. Cold beer
Lovely place to swim in Danube. Very 1960/70 atmosphere
All good here. There is a Restaurant as well :) lets get a radler

placeMetadata.name: Vienna City Beach Club

sources.snippet: For those seeking a lively and trendy beach experience, the Vienna City Beach Club is the place to be. Situated along the banks of the Danube, this beach club is a hub of entertainment and social activity. Its chic and modern ambiance attracts a diverse crowd looking to experience Vienna's nightlife from a unique perspective.
sources.shortName: Discover the Best Beaches in Vienna, Austria – A Unique Urban Oasis

placeMetadata.description: Bar plus outdoor area with loungers & volleyball, global snacks, cocktails & evening DJ sessions.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled along the picturesque banks of the Danube River, the Vienna City Beach Club offers a delightful escape from urban life, even in a landlocked city. This vibrant beach club is perfect for sunbathing and swimming while enjoying an array of recreational activities like sand volleyball. With its chic atmosphere, it attracts a diverse crowd eager to soak up the sun by day and dance to lively DJ sessions by night.

reviews.reviewText: This place is AMAZING. You can order and sit wherever you want with an amazing view on the Donau (I'd suggest to go at sunset time). The staff is so nice and happy, it feels so good to be there :) good for an happy hour too!

Absolutely loved my time at Vienna City Beach Club!

The location is fantastic with stunning views over the Danube — the perfect backdrop for a relaxing day out.

The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived. The food was delicious, fresh, and beautifully presented.

Whether you're there to unwind, enjoy a drink, or have a great meal, this place has it all.

Highly recommended!

Great mix of drinks, music, beach. Gives the feels of being on vacation. Celebrated a birthday party there, Max and his team were very accommodating. Simply a nice place to spend a summer day and evening
Taste of Ibiza, riviera romagnola, Mykonos. Unexpected, very nice experience

Terrible experience!
The atmosphere was tense, and it became clear why: the so-called owner, Max, was extremely rude and arrogant. He even mocked guests by mimicking them, which was not only unprofessional but downright disrespectful.
The staff looked miserable and were just as unfriendly — no surprise when working under someone like him. Service was incredibly slow, and there was zero sense of hospitality.

The food was awful! Poorly made and tasteless. The only remotely decent thing we had was the soda, which was literally just mineral water and lemon juice.

This is not a place to relax or enjoy yourself. I would strongly recommend staying away.
Nice for party or evening chill out

The atmosphere is great for a warm summer night with sand under your feet. You can get some flatbread, but you are really there to take a cocktail in hand and dance until you leave a hole in the sand. If you rather sit and relax, there is plenty of chairs to honker down and listen.
It is a pleasant establishment, the staff is usually quite friendly, and the music is enjoyable, making it a wonderful place to visit during the summer

placeMetadata.name: Naschmarkt

sources.snippet: Vienna’s famous Naschmarkt is the city’s most popular food market, and in autumn, it takes on a special charm. With over 100 market stalls, visitors can sample seasonal produce, from fresh pumpkins to artisanal cheeses. The market is open from Monday to Saturday, with its busiest days typically being Fridays and Saturdays.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Beaches to Visit in Mallorca This Summer

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Naschmarkt is a bustling open-air market with two distinct lanes. One side is filled with casual dining spots, while the other offers high-quality produce and gourmet products favored by renowned chefs for their culinary creations.

placeMetadata.name: Strombucht

sources.snippet: The grassy banks of the Strombucht sunbathing lawn / Image © PID / Christian Fürthner. With a small rocky beach and 6,000 square metres of sunbathing lawn, the Strombucht peninsula is the perfect place for soaking up some rays on summer days. If you fancy a dip during the transitional months, though, you won't freeze, as the water is warm – relatively warm, that is.
sources.shortName: 5 outdoor spots for a dip in Vienna | EasyJet

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Strombucht peninsula is a beautiful and peaceful place to spend a summer day. There's a small rocky beach and a 6,000-square-meter sunbathing lawn, perfect for soaking up some rays. If you're looking for some cool water in the colder months, be sure to bring your swimsuit!

reviews.reviewText: Awesome minimalist beach!

Nice quiet place, the water is lovely, at the summertime the surface gets warm as the water is still.
The trees give plenty of shadow, but there are options for sunbathing too.
One star of because the toilet now is not for free sadly, and it takes a bit too long to get to the place by public transport

Nice. Clean. Quiet. Small.

The water is fairly clear (I would estimate that you can see 1.5 meters deep), and not too cold. Just right for a hot day (it is 30 degrees centigrade now and getting hotter). Some ducks and small fish are swimming around, so I think the water must be at least somewhat healthy.

There is a small number people (I came late Friday morning in the middle of July); therefore, it is quiet. Everyone here appears to be local (except yours truly).

Facilities include picnic tables, trash cans, portable toilets, and some trees for shade. There are no snack kiosks, lockers, or any services like that. Nobody works here; everyone is here to enjoy themselves.

There is a grassy area (see the satellite photos). There are two small sandy areas where you can access the water, as well as a ladder leading up to a concrete landing.

The slope in the water is very gradual, making it very comfortable to wade in, even for a nervous swimmers, like myself.

The parts of the lake floor that I went to had small round rocks, which were reasonably comfortable to walk on. Some areas have silt, which is also fairly comfortable, but unstable, and clouds the water when you walk in it.

I visited on a Sunday morning in summer, naturally it became crowded but people were civilized, not noisy and maintaining the necessary distance.
Water seemed reasonably clean and good for swimming.
This comes up as a search result for dogs swimming which is nonsense. Dogs are not allowed here.

Very quiet and set back location. The water is quiet too, clean and good water quality. I was able to see the ground. It's easily deep enough to swim, but still somewhat shallow.
Good entry to the water, clean grass area to chill and dry after a swim. I suggest going there by bike, and to bring some snacks and drinks :)
Cool quiet place for the rest and for surfing on the sub board 👍

The water is still a little bit cool at the beginning of May but wonderfully clear and refreshing. Come and take a dip!
(They have dug up the ground during winter and the grass is coming back slowly.)

placeMetadata.name: Strandbad Angelibad

sources.snippet: If you prefer a more monitored and family-friendly environment with lockers, playgrounds and cafeterias – the public “beaches” Angelibad and Gansehaufel (day-ticket for about 6 EUR) are great choices.
sources.shortName: A Local’s Guide to “Beaches” in Vienna, Vienna, Austria

placeMetadata.description: Summer hangout with a dedicated swimming area, floating dock, kids’ play equipment & sport courts.
placeMetadata.address: Birnersteig, An der Oberen Alten Donau 1, 1210 Wien, Austria

reviews.reviewText: Nice, clean and not to crowded beach, lots of shade. Trees are giving good protection from western winds. For a small entrance fee one gets an addl swimming pool for kids, clean toilets w/o waiting in line, showers…

Love here. It’s such a great place for family with small kids! Water is clean, beach/pool are shallow for little ones, also have so many slides for fun. Not that clouded as the other Strandbad around Alte Donau so you can get foods from the beach bar only for 10-20 minutes.

A lovely beach on the Danube river! Big, with plenty of natural shade, equiped with warderobes, toilets and showers. The river is calm in this area so it was perfect for a swim. Public transport is close, easely accesible and very frequent, so no need for a car. Very nice indeed!

Love this place. 🥰 🏊‍♀️We have a little 1.5 year old, and this bathing area is amazing - lots of shadows, a small pool for little kids, easy entry to the danube, and playgrounds. Can we also appreciate th retro vibes of the interior 👌

Highly recommend Angelibad for families with young children. There is a fenced pool for babies (30-40 cm deep) with a slide, a vast shady area for picnic and rest and a really lovely playground area at the bank, suitable for children of any age. Adults and older children should however swim in the cannal, no other pools available. The water area is clearly marked for swimmers / non-swimmers and there are several floating decks for jumping and playing. One of our most favourite beaches along the Danube.
Cash only in cafes! In 2025 many people don't even know what they look like! It's time to switch to electronic ones
Great place for kids! We loved it!
Lovely bathing place for children. They have a separated place just for the small ones which is nice. There is also playgrounds and a small clubhouse place were you sit and draw.

placeMetadata.name: Familienbadestrand Neue Donau

sources.snippet: This beach on the left bank of the New Danube is called Familienbadestrand – 'Family Beach' – thanks to its clean, shallow waters that don't get deeper than around one metre, and gradually slope into the river, making it ideal for young children. Sliced off from the mighty main river by Danube Island, it's a safe and pleasant spot for a dip. Arbeiterstrandbadstraße 7Metro: Neue Donau
sources.shortName: 5 outdoor spots for a dip in Vienna | EasyJet

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The outdoor swimming pool Wien, Neue Donau and Familienbadestrand are all located on the left bank of the New Danube and are great for young children thanks to their shallow waters.

reviews.reviewText: Very nice place in the island of Donao especially for children, Pik nik and Playing football 😉
Great idea to relax out of the city, easy to reach and relatively quiet. During the summer the waters of the river are warm enough to swim

Parks are not clean. There is a chaos. The water is very green and warm. No toilets or changing rooms.
Easy transportation is the only good thing about here.

It is always good in here but the problem
is that it is toooooo much croud to many people and to many nationality and diferent mindes for example when girsl are swiming with bikinis some other nationality like …… from old time people they are forginers when they see some girl like this with bikinis they take a sit near them and watching them and … that is so roooootttt 🤮 thats way i dont like this place bcoz they close they wifes and than they look to other wifes 🤷‍♂️ thats discusting but any way i dont like this place just about that ( they act like a pedofile like they see a +18 movie bcoz they never see a girl with bikinis live 😂 good luck girls in there i hope that they dont do smth wrong near you and making you wet 😂😂😂😂👎
Good place to hang out and swim!
Good for swimming in the river and picnics
It might be cold in the winter but I think you won't go for a swim in winter. It's a very nice place for the Sommer. But be aware it is kina cold.
I love this place, is so relax. They have a place for kids, voleibol, ice etc.

sources.snippet: Another one of the best beaches in Vienna, with its sandy shores, picnic areas, and designated family spaces set it apart from alternatives on the opposite side of the river. Unlike areas requiring an abrupt entry, here you can wade in or relax along the coastline. Though farther afield, those seeking a genuine beach experience will appreciate the distinct ambiance and amenities unique to this scenic riverside retreat.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Beaches near Vienna 2024 With

reviews.reviewText: Nice sand beach, good place for swimming

It's great to have a beach in the city, the water is quite clean and one can swim with pleasure. But the beach itself is poorly equipped - too few benches and places for rest, no places to change clothes, dirty toilets
Best beach 🏖️
So pretty i enjoyed so much with my son omg it was so magical and feels like a little real beach

Sandy beach on the Donauinsel. Whoever planned it definitely had humour. Officially forbidden for dogs (a big "yay" in my books), but your typical Austrian tekno kid won't really care. Pretty crowded in the high season, but nonetheless good vibes! Make sure your speakers (AND taste of music) are better than everyone else's.
I was told there would be Ron, he wasn't here so I was very upset. The sand polar bears were very friendly though. 5 star nice.
Quite, quite lonesome, natural.
Nice Beach & nice People!

sources.snippet: The other one is the Dechantlacke – a small lake hidden in a dense forest. The lake has a small island in the middle and is particularly popular with nudists, as it is very secluded.
sources.shortName: Vienna - great beaches, 500 km away from the sea

reviews.reviewText: If you're into skinny dipping and nature, then this is the place to go. Nudity all around and a very nice and clean lake to cool in.

Naturist lake near Vienna:

Very easy access from center of Vienna city.
I can’t believe that this natural park is just 1hr by public transport from heart of city (uber might take only 30 min)

North/Northeast side of this lake have a lot of area for nudist.
There are plenty of bin around lake area so don’t worry about bring waste back.
Prepare your own food, water, mat, sunblock and mosquito repellent.
Water is very clear and good for swim!
Was fantastic having the all day spent in this beautiful place❤️❤️😘😘
Nice location, but limited beach space and the surrounding vegetation is very dense giving it a slightly claustrophobic feel
Great place for a summer swim.
Nice place to get energy from the nature
A bit difficult to reach and very popular, so it can be hard to find a good spot. Very lush and beautiful. Shallow, so the water can get warm. Nudity is customary, but not required.
Loved my walk there, and got loved back!

placeMetadata.name: Kuchelauer Hafen

sources.snippet: If you’re seeking a peaceful escape from the crowds, Kuchelau is the perfect beach for you. Nestled along the Danube River, this hidden gem boasts serene surroundings and scenic views.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Vienna Beaches: A Comprehensive Guide

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kuchelauer Hafen is a serene oasis along the banks of the Danube River, perfect for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of city life. This hidden gem offers stunning views and a peaceful atmosphere where you can unwind under the sun. The area features a narrow strip that invites relaxation, with clear waters ideal for swimming—nudists often enjoy this tranquil spot as well. Visitors appreciate its unique charm, from scenic walks over pedestrian bridges to enjoying local delicacies at nearby buffets.

ops.insert: Long, narrow island along the Danube featuring wooded recreation areas, restaurants & bars.
Waterfront city park overlooked by bars & restaurants with lidos & jetties for swimmers & boat hire.
Public swimming complex open May to September with lap, kids' & wave pools, a beach, slides & sauna.
Riverside recreation area with a sandy beach, bars & restaurants, a skate park & summer swimming.
Large park with old-time amusements, including a landmark giant wheel dating from 1897.
World-famous opera house offering major productions, original decor & multilingual guided tours.
Vibrant park featuring a beach & lake for swimming & other recreation, plus a pier & green space.
Outdoor pools with a thrill slide, soccer field & volleyball courts, plus a snack bar & city views.
18th-century summer palace with tours of lavish rococo ceremonial rooms, plus gardens with a maze.
A popular escape from the city, this 1588 ft. hill offers a variety of walking trails & city views.

Donaustadt, the 22nd District, is a residential area and a popular hub for outdoor recreation. Picnicking families and cyclists converge on the long, narrow Danube Island, and the calm waters of the Old Danube draw swimmers and sailors. The Lobau, a wetland reserve, is laced with hiking trails. Two towers – the ultramodern DC Tower, near UN headquarters in Donau City, and the Danube Tower – offer panoramic views.
Baroque, 18th-century palaces housing art from Middle Ages to today, with notable Klimt collection.
19th-century Habsburg palace with staterooms & collections of old master prints & 20th-century art.
Open-air bar with sand, hammocks, deckchairs, DJ sessions & global food including weekend brunches.
Bar plus outdoor area with loungers & volleyball, global snacks, cocktails & evening DJ sessions.
Trendy venue on a boat, with bar, restaurant, sun deck & swimming pool, plus DJs & live music.
Summer hangout with a dedicated swimming area, floating dock, kids’ play equipment & sport courts.
Artificial waterway parallel to the River Danube & separated by an island, popular for swimming.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
When you think of Vienna, you might picture grand palaces, historic architecture, and vibrant cultural scenes. But did you know that this beautiful city also boasts some fantastic beaches? From the serene shores of the Old Danube to lively public swimming complexes, Vienna offers a refreshing escape from the urban hustle. Whether you're looking to soak up the sun, take a dip in the water, or enjoy a leisurely picnic, the city's beaches provide the perfect backdrop for a summer day.

As the Wanderlog team loves to explore unique spots, we’re excited to share some of the best beach destinations in and around Vienna. Picture yourself lounging at the popular Gänsehäufel, where you can enjoy stunning views of the skyline, or discovering hidden gems like Schönbrunner Bad, nestled in the lush Schönbrunn park. With a mix of well-known favorites and lesser-known treasures, there's something for everyone to enjoy. So grab your sunscreen and get ready to dive into Vienna's beach scene!
