I absolutely loved the Gunda Gruber exhib that I went to see here. 1 museum, 2 locations, different exhibs at both, both worth visiting and close to each other. The other location is only 5 mins walk and a lift. You can hike up if you're feeling very energetic. Your ticket works for both and I think you can use it up to a week (Double check this at the desk). So you don't have to over-do it. The work was excellent and the museum isn't massive, so you can get a nice, bite-sized chuck of well displayed, good quality modern art in the beautiful city of Salzburg. Well worth a visit!
We had a couple of hours before our train to Munich and went in this museum. It is nice and has some stuff from Salzburg s 19 th century on wards. I am not sure it was worth the €14 ticket though.

Fantastic unmissable modern art gallery in Stuttgart. It's split into 2 parts - one in the city centre and one newer and larger part perched on top of a cliff with magnificent views over the city. The clifftop part is accessed by a pedestrian lift. The entrance cost and the lift cost is included in the Salzburg card. The photos show both items from the permanent collection as well as from the social exhibitions on in December 2019.
I love art, but art should inspire to something more than making me think 'the emperor has a complete new wardrobe'. It is a sin that taxpayers work to finance this silliness. But the view is good.

placeMetadata.name: Salzburg Airport

sources.snippet: The best way to get to Salzburg, Austria by plane is to fly into Salzburg Airport (SZG). There are several airlines that offer direct flights to Salzburg from major European cities.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

placeMetadata.description: Airport serving the city & ski areas for domestic or international flights, plus bus & train links.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Salzburg Airport is the main gateway for domestic and international flights, conveniently connecting travelers to the city and nearby ski areas. Visitors from EEA or Swiss countries can live in Salzburg without a visa, while non-EEA expatriates can apply for a Red-White-Red card for settlement. The charming city of Salzburg offers a compact, walkable historic center with rich cultural experiences and breathtaking mountain views.

reviews.reviewText:
Beautifully airport with snow topped mountains in the distance.
Small but well functioning airport.
Very friendly staff.
Fun to see some in carnival costumes today.
The Little bee was very friendly 🐝
Food & drinks a bit expensive.
Quick boarding. Very professional staff.
They were filming in the sunglasses department not sure who the lady was but people seemed very interested in her.
Lovely airport to fly to & from

Airport Salzburg is a small nice Airport. You get easily an oversight. It has 2 terminals, while Terminal 2 (Amadeus) is just in winter active. Its a very safe place and there are also small bistro where you can grab some food and drinks.

A small airport surrounded by stunning mountain views, offering a peaceful and convenient travel experience. The basic facilities are well-maintained, and there's a small duty-free shop for last-minute purchases. Clean and tidy restrooms add to the comfort of the journey.

My only concern was the lack of a water refill station. While bottled water is available for purchase, I would have appreciated a place to refill my own bottle.

It’s a small airport but have all necessary things for an airport. It’s well connected with public transport (bus). There is an open view point outside the airport. You can easily see landing and take off of planes closely. There are few food and other shops there. But only one food outlet after security gate.

Small but functional airport. I used it for both arrival & departure during he first week of December and the experience on both occasion were smooth.
The station for the bus that takes you to the city centre is just under 100 meter from the arrival hall.

Salzburg Airport is a fantastic example of how smaller airports can be the best. Its compact size makes it incredibly easy to navigate, so you can get from the entrance to your gate in no time, without the stress and long walks of a massive terminal. Access to and from the city is quick and straightforward. The staff are consistently friendly, helpful, and efficient, which makes the whole travel experience much more pleasant. A wonderfully hassle-free airport!
Great location and fast service! It is a great regional airport only minutes from downtown Szaltsberg
Love this airport. Small but efficient with loads of places to watch the planes and beautiful surrounding scenery.

placeMetadata.name: Jazzit

sources.snippet: Jazzit, Salzburg’s most legendary music venue, is a fantastic place for a night out and it also offers many free gigs. The club hosts regular ‘electro swing’ parties as well as various blues and jazz concerts that showcase local and international talent. Furthermore, the outdoor garden and the bar—both available to enter without purchasing a ticket—is a nice to relax and have a drink or two.
sources.shortName: 11 Free And Cheap Date Ideas To Try In Salzburg

placeMetadata.description: Late-night venue featuring an eclectic selection of live jazz musicians & shows for kids.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Jazzit is a late-night venue in Salzburg that offers live jazz performances and shows suitable for kids. The city also boasts other entertainment options such as rock houses, festivals, gin bars, cocktail bars, beer gardens, wine taverns, Irish pubs, and discos. Art lovers can enjoy numerous art galleries with diverse programs featuring established and emerging artists.

reviews.reviewText: One of my favourite JazzClub in Europe

I visited Jazzit for a clubbing night, and unfortunately, my experience was disappointing. The venue presents itself as an inclusive space, mindful of important social issues, and at first, the atmosphere seemed positive. However, the way I was treated by the staff was completely unacceptable.

After paying €20 for entry, I was on the dance floor when I made eye contact with a girl who seemed a bit serious. In a totally normal and respectful way, I lightly touched her shoulder and asked if she was okay. Anyone with some clubbing experience knows that interactions like this are part of a normal, social night out.

A few minutes later, as I was moving to another room, two staff members approached me and told me not to touch people, implying that several different people had complained about my behavior. This happened without them talking to me first, without knowing what had actually occurred, and without giving me a chance to explain myself.

I felt discriminated against and humiliated, and my night was completely ruined. I decided to leave after only an hour and a half.

What struck me the most was how quickly they judged me. I wonder if I would have been treated the same way if I weren’t a foreigner. I had the clear impression that the staff acted with prejudice, making assumptions about me without any effort to hear my side of the story.

It’s ironic that a club that claims to be modern and inclusive has such a rigid and unfair approach, passing judgment without dialogue. If inclusion means feeling watched and treated like a problem for a completely respectful interaction, then something is seriously wrong.

Tl;dr - Go for the jazz, not the drinks or atmosphere. I saw an amazing live jazz act (Emmeluth's Amoeba) and was absolutely blown away by the talent on display and the quality of the sound. However, I found the atmosphere a little sterile and serious for jazz (lecture-style seating, dead silent audience) and my negroni was passable at best. With a little more attention to ambience and drinks, Jazzit could easily get the fifth star!

Instead of letting me know the bar was closing shortly, some guy sat next to me, who claimed to be the owner, and yelled at me to finish my beer, then started counting down from 30. When I finished it in 10 seconds (not what I'd prefer to do to finish my evening and leave) and turned to my friends next to me to get us together to leave, a bouncer grabbed my arm and tried to physically drag me off my stool. A five minute warning would have absolutely been on me, I've never had to aggressively tell a bouncer not to touch me to be able to walk out of a bar before, especially while being the one person trying to get my group moving to go. Despite a fun night, I can't recommend ever giving this place your business.

If you look at recent reviews, seems to have gone downhill quite a bit.
Nice environment and concert was cool 😎

We went to a techno party on Saturday, and my friend approached a girl, simply asking, "How's it going?" while lightly placing a hand on her shoulder. The girl reacted as if she had been seriously harassed and immediately ran away.

Without even speaking to us or trying to understand what had actually happened, the club staff came over and asked my friend to leave. This is completely unacceptable. While we understand that some people might have personal traumas or social anxiety, it would be more appropriate for them to avoid crowded places where people naturally interact.

As for the staff, they should have taken the time to listen to both sides instead of making rushed judgments. It felt unfair and discriminatory—whether because we are men or foreigners, we don’t know, but the way we were treated was far from inclusive. Since that we left and we paid 20 euro each of us to stay only 2 hours. We both live abroad and travel frequently, yet this is the first time we have experienced something like this.

Very disappointing.
Great spot to spend an evening. Really great music and atmosphere. Highly recommend!
I had 3 days straight jazz nights in Prague, Innsbruck but here, it was an awesome, and beautiful experience. Highly recommend this place and I’m very glad that I’ve been here :))

placeMetadata.name: Zum Zirkelwirt

sources.snippet: The Zirkelwirt is a traditional house in a quiet location a little away from the center at Papagenoplatz and belongs to the culinary Salzburg tips in this list.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

placeMetadata.description: Informal haunt for beers, wines & homestyle Austrian dishes in a rustic setting with a terrace.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Salzburg, Zum Zirkelwirt is a charming haunt offering a blend of tradition and quirkiness. The rustic setting with fur-lined seats and wooden decor gives it the feel of a mountain lodge. The menu may be limited, but each dish is freshly prepared and delicious. The waitstaff, dressed in traditional attire, adds to the lively atmosphere by welcoming guests with yodels.

reviews.reviewText:
Excellent restaurant! Nice and cozy place. If you want to have a delicious Austrian food experience, this is the place to go!
Super tasty, home-made food and great service! You enjoy delicious Austrian food together with the kindness and joy of the Austrians.
Sasha, thank you for the great service and the special liqueur!
Simply tasty and wonderful food. Service was great and quick. We ordered, and food came out no more than 10 minutes later. The goulash was tasty, and my partner was impressed with the schnitzel.

Wiener Schnitzel: A Crispy, Golden Delight

I finally tried an authentic Wiener Schnitzel—and wow. It’s everything people say it is and more. The veal was perfectly tender, the breading light and crisp without being greasy, and that simple squeeze of lemon brought it all to life. Paired with a warm potato salad and a cold Austrian beer, it was comfort food at its finest. You can tell when a dish has history behind it—and this one tastes like tradition, care, and old-world flavor. Absolutely delicious. A must-try
Perfect spot to eat at while walking through the city. I loved the potatoes, they were cooked to perfection! Cold beer served in a cool stein as well!

Very tasty food and the kindest staff. I had my best goulash here and I have tried so many places from Prague to Vienna. Definitely go with the spinach dumplings. The place is very cozy with a real local feeling to it.

Had several meals here while visiting Salzburg. A very nice old place, full of character and atmosphere, very popular among the locals, so better always get a reservation for dinner! Food is very tasty, service quick and friendly! I highly recommend this restaurant!
Cute atmosphere, amazing service, and very good food. Definitely would recommend this place and come again! They have vegetarian options as well.

Fully booked but they had room for me outside. Quick service with tasty food. Would recommend.
I tried my best German but they spoke back in English haha

placeMetadata.name: Café Sacher Salzburg

sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A 3 day romantic trip to Salzburg, Austria

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Cafe Sacher, located at the Hotel Sacher Salzburg, offers a classic Viennese cafe experience with a touch of elegance and history. Situated by the Salzach River, this charming cafe is part of the renowned Hotel Sacher known for its cultural heritage and luxurious atmosphere. The highlight of a visit to Cafe Sacher is indulging in a slice of the famous Sacher-Torte, which has gained worldwide acclaim.

reviews.reviewText: We enjoyed all parts of our visit to this beautiful cafe which has an amazing atmosphere. I wasn't expecting a high quality as I used to have this feeling that tourist attracting restaurants have a very standard taste. I'm happy to be wrong this time. I really liked the sofas with red cushions, which made us feel comfortable in an atmosphere with a historical importance. The classical music, at a level that didn't hinder our conversation, created a peaceful atmosphere. We really wished to read or study as we enjoyed our coffees. The Sachertorte we had was really fresh and delicious. I was thinking that so much chocolate could make the taste heavy, but it was nice to balance it with the sugar-free cream. I found the coffee Wiener Melange with cream rather delicious even though black coffee is my usual choice with desserts. A detail that I'd like to mention is that it's nice to see some water to be served along with the dessert and coffee, which, in my opinion, indicates that the place shows respect towards the customers. The service was very nice and people were helpful as well. It's definitely worth visiting in Salzburg.

I can't think of many cafes or restaurants around the globe where the name on its own is instantly recognized without adding an additional hint.  That is brand recognition at its best and maintained over time.  I was lucky enough as a kid that my auntie took me to Cafe Sacher.  Certainly I didn't have much appreciation for the beautiful interior at that time but I recall my fondness of their hot chocolate and slice of chocolate cake
Fast forward, giving this place a new try.  It's like stepping back in time, an epoch of grandness and to this day  time stands still. The lush interior, the spot on service with the just right level of friendliness and efficiency.
The coffee with its whipped cream. The chocolate cake, with a hint of nuts, is neither dry nor moist, it's neither sweet nor bland.  This perfect balance, makes this cake so unique.

Sit back and let the time roll back and take it all in..  This piece of cake can make the outlook on life so much better, bite by bite.

The atmosphere was wonderful, the servers were very friendly, and all the food—including the schnitzel—was delicious. Unlike the Vienna location, we were able to get in without any waiting, which made the experience even better.

If you're in Salzburg, you'll probably hear about Café Sacher Salzburg – home of the original Sacher-Torte.
This place is seriously elegant, a real old-world magnificent cafe that just oozes charm. We stopped in to try the famous Sacher-Torte and a cappuccino. Now, don't get me wrong, you can definitely taste the quality in everything, but honestly? For me, the Sacher-Torte and cappuccino were just... okay. Nothing to really cheer about, and to be perfectly honest, the price was quite exorbitant.
So, here's my take: it's worth a visit just to say you've experienced the original Sacher-Torte in its birthplace, soak in that grand atmosphere, and tick it off your Salzburg list. But for the taste and the price, once is probably enough!

Place was a bit calm on a Sunday. Many tourist trying the famous Sacher Cake for the gram. Def nice cake but you won’t get the OMG Good moment. The whipped cream was a bit watery.

Def worth a try tho

I had eggs Royale which were ok, but I’d skip it for the cakes. Sacher was good, but the Esterhazy cake was delicious! The coffee and tea were also very good. Service was excellent, very friendly staff.

Café Sacher Salzburg is the definition of elegance—cozy, refined, and timeless. While enjoying your coffee, you can admire the beautiful view of the river and the bridge, which creates an atmosphere of calm and charm. Of course, the famous Sacher Torte here is simply the best in the German-speaking world—an absolute must-try.

The guests, the staff, and the overall setting all exude elegance, making you feel truly special the moment you walk in. Its location is also perfect, right next to many of Salzburg’s highlights. I’d say it’s the best place to begin your journey in Salzburg—class, taste, and history all in one.

Wonderful café with excellent service and desserts! We stopped by for the Sacher-torte, which is a beautifully decadent cake paired with a whipped cream. This Sacher-torte slice was quite good, but slightly drier than the one we had and preferred in Wien. I LOVED the Salzburger Nockerl, which by far was the best one I had out of a number of restaurants in Salzburg and left me wishing I could stay longer in the city to go back to Café Sacher and enjoy more times. Servers were kind and careful when it came to food allergies. The café is also beautifully decorated!

placeMetadata.name: Café Tomaselli

sources.shortName: 11 Free And Cheap Date Ideas To Try In Salzburg

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Café Tomaselli is a delightful gem nestled in the heart of Salzburg's old town, steeped in rich history since its establishment in 1703. This iconic coffeehouse beautifully embodies Austria's café culture, where delectable food and warm company are cherished equally. As you step inside, you're greeted by an enchanting atmosphere featuring dark-wood paneling, elegant marble tables, and vintage decor adorned with crystal chandeliers and baroque paintings.

reviews.reviewText: To start with, this cafe opens at 7 am which is amazing if you need to have breakfast early in the morning. The place is beautiful inside and outside, service is top notch, the food and presentation of it - classy. I was going there every day and was never disappointed. Definitely worth checking it out!

After our Sound of Music tour, we were so happy to find Café Tomaselli right in the middle of St. Stephen’s Square. This place is charming and filled with energy, and we found a balcony seat on the second floor — perfect for people-watching!

We had kombucha tea, passion fruit soda, and apple strudel, all light and refreshing. Service was friendly, though there’s no AC, so it can get warm on hot days. Still, a great spot to recharge and soak in Salzburg’s historic vibe.

Great location at a beautiful, historic cafe. Our group enjoyed a traditional breakfast of eggs, pastries, and coffee. Wish the service was friendlier. We ordered three omelets with cheese (no ham) and one plain omelet. When server arrived with two omelets that had ham, getting two of our orders wrong, he tried to argue with us over the error.

A truly charming café with a rich history! It’s fascinating to see that the staff still wear traditional old-time outfits, which really adds to the atmosphere and makes you feel like you’re stepping back in time. The place has a cozy, welcoming vibe that makes it perfect for a relaxed break.

The lunch I had was delicious – fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The hot chocolate was also amazing – rich and comforting, just what you need on a cold day.

The waiters were incredibly friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. There’s also more than enough space to sit comfortably, so you can really enjoy the experience without feeling crowded.

If you’re looking for a historic spot with excellent food, drinks, and a unique atmosphere, Café Tomaselli is a must-visit! Highly recommend it for anyone in the area.

Atmosphere was great. Very historic.

Unfortunately we had to tell our waiter to clean the table after we had sat. Other than that service was fast.

The tiramisu cake was delicious and so was the coffee.

We had an amazing breakfast at terrace upstairs.
Sachertorte was so so, egg/ sausages was quite simple. Fresh chocolate cream cake with cherry inside and white sausage were so good. Boiled egg was cooked perfectly.
Almond chocolate milk was nice but preferred coffee.

Tomaselli Café in Salzburg is a charming and historic spot.
The outdoor seating, with its green and white striped umbrellas and geraniums, creates a visually delightful setting.
The coffee is aromatic, the pastries are crispy, and the apricot jam is delicious.
The ham and cheese omelet also had a unique and memorable flavor.
Highly recommended!

Had really yummy apple strudel, cakes and sachetorte here. Yummy hot chocolate. Service was amazing and Mohammed was really helpful introducing us to their signature cakes and also gave us recommendations on where to go in Salzburg. So far the friendliest and best service I have had in F&B in Salzburg

placeMetadata.name: Hotel Rosenvilla

sources.snippet: A traditional flower clad building with contemporary interiors. Romantic rooms and suites have four poster beds, lots of natural light, wooden floors and all the mod cons. Fabulous breakfast room and garden.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

placeMetadata.description: Laid-back venue offering contemporary lodging, a relaxed restaurant & a furnished patio.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hotel Rosenvilla offers a contemporary and relaxed lodging experience, with a laid-back restaurant and furnished patio. Nestled among gardens in the exclusive residential district of Aigen, it's just a short walk from Salzburg's historic city center. The hotel provides tastefully furnished rooms with luxurious bathrooms, some featuring four-poster beds and wooden floors. Free WiFi is available in public areas and most units.

reviews.reviewText: This hotel gives a warm welkom. The room is tip top. The people are so kind and helpful. The breakfast buffet: It just didn’t end. Compliments to you all. You have made my stay in Salzburg magnificent!

We stayed for 3 nights in a first floor room with balcony.

Staff very pleasant and friendly, always welcoming and the hotel is open to 9:30 after which you use your key to get in.

Bed was comfy, I love the Austrian 2x single duvet option on a double bed, it's ingenious. Slept well in comfort (caveat - I travel with facemask and earplugs) Room was spacious. The bathroom has a toilet separated with a slide door from the rest of the bathroom rather than an all in one like you can see sometimes. Shower had good pressure and pleasant temperature. We didn't use the balcony much due to the weather but it would be nice in the evening in a warmer evening with a couple of chairs, lounger and shade. The room also had a couple of reading chairs and a desk to offer flexibility and a good size TV in line with the bed.

Staff really have attention to detail, we got some wine from a supermarket when out and left it in the room and they brought us glasses without asking.

The bath had a jacuzzi option but we didn't use it.

My only negative thoughts on the room:

I would suggest to the hotel that a bar or non-slip mat might be useful as you're stepping out the bath onto a tiled floor and only have the towel rail on your left or the bath to grab if you do wobble as the only other option is the glass splash protector

Options on pillows would be useful (maybe a question on booking?) - we didn't ask so maybe it was an option but I like a firm pillow, the 2 provided were pretty soft and floppy

I would like a kettle in the room but the machine downstairs is always available - just means you have to get showered or at least dressed to get any, I prefer to get out of bed and have some coffee before going down.

Breakfast

Plenty of options - bread and bagels, cakes and sweets plus cold meats, cheese etc + fruit, freshly poured smoothie and juice, cereals. We had maybe 20 minutes each day there, taking time and enjoying the food

There was only one coffee machine but breakfast was never that busy when we were there so wasn't a major issue

My only complaints were that there was no hot buffet, only the offer of eggs (which I don't like) - some sausage or bacon to be offered, would be something to consider?

Hotel is incredibly easy to get to on the bus from the station (160 I think), about 10 stops, free if you get the Salzburg card which I would recommend anyway due to the free access to so many things

The room had a low ceiling and I banged my head three times but the room itself was beautiful. This is why 5 stars for the room. The staff are amazing and make you feel at home. It’s a boutique hotel, not a large scale commercial operation. You can help yourself to coffee and tea anytime of the day and sit in their courtyard to relax. It is about 20 minutes walk from the tourist areas but there is also local bus available. I would stay here again.

Stayed for just one night but regretted not extending the trip instantly. Every aspect of the hotel is beautiful (including the very friendly staff) and the breakfast buffet is wonderful. I would definitely return here and for a longer stay.

We stayed at a suite unit on the 2nd floor.  Very pleased with our stay.  The room seems to be renovated recently within the last a couple of years.  I can tell the owner paid a lot of attention to details that would please travelers.  Breakfast was very nice with a lot of selections.  No elevator but stuff were very friendly and offered to take our luggages to our room.  In a very quiet neighborhood that is about 10 min away from a bus ride to the city center.

The owners were very cheerful and friendly in their service. They helped carry our luggage and explained how to get to the main tourist attractions. They also issued a free public transportation QR pass for us online.

Above all, the breakfast was the most satisfying part. During this trip through Eastern Europe, including Austria, the Czech Republic, and Croatia, I tried breakfast at several hotels, but the breakfast at Rosenvilla was by far the best.

Our stay was very pleasant, made even better by the lovely and friendly staff. This was our first time in Rosenvilla and by far the best, on our three week Europe stint. The room albeit small but was very thoughtfully designed. The welcome drink was much appreciated. Overall an experience we would repeat if we came back to Salzburg.

Lovely and very modern rooms, shower and a large terrace.  The morning breakfast was lovely and the service was warm and pleasant.  Highly looking forward to stay here when we visit Salzburg the next time.

placeMetadata.name: Hotel Schloss Mönchstein

sources.snippet: Romantic hilltop castle in an extensive park and gardens, with fine views over Salzburg. Gourmet dining and a top spa. Rooms are luxuriously finished, with priceless antiques and marble bathrooms.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

placeMetadata.description: Elegant hotel in a castlelike hilltop building, plus a refined restaurant, a spa & an infinity pool.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hotel Schloss Mönchstein is a luxurious boutique hotel located in a 13th-century castle atop Monchstein Hill, offering breathtaking views of Salzburg, including the iconic Mirabell Palace and the majestic Alps. Guests are treated to personalized service and exclusivity, with amenities such as an infinity pool, outdoor hot tub, and welcome drink.

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful rooms and facilities, great location, and impeccable service. What a gem of a place ! It was like a dream. The breakfast included is 10/10 delicious and the restaurant for dinner was possibly a bit experimental for some but still very well done. I hope to be back one day !

We had a really wonderful stay. The hotel is beautiful. The location is really fantastic. The Tower Room was incredibly clean and comfortable. The staff is exceptional, friendly, and very attentive. We would absolutely stay here again without a second thought.

We had the best time staying here. The location is dreamy and the staff treats you like royalty. The hotel sits high up on a hill and provides the most incredible views from the garden. Luckily there is an elevator to take you to the city below.

Fantastic staff. Concierges both, Samantha and Felix are stand outs.
They are both great problem solvers even when the challenges are not involving the hotel, such as car rental or concert tickets…
Whatever you require to make your stay relaxed and unencumbered they will volunteer their capable assistance.
Lovely and relaxing place to hang your hat when in Salzburg.

A beautiful experience. The hotel was exquisite. The views were breathtaking. The grounds were a perfect setting for all your photos. It has an elevator from the top of the mountain down to the heart of Salzburg, where we experienced the running of the Krampus, the hot tub and spa were a perfect ending to a beautiful day.

This hotel treats you like royalty from the moment you walk in the door, from skipping the traditional check-in and giving you a glass of champagne and a sit down in their lovely bar while they do the work, to giving you the most friendly welcome from all staff.

We had the privilege of being upgraded to the castle suite free of charge, which was abundant in size, with the most beautiful antique character and sky high ceilings. A beautiful double size bathroom with full walk in closet and ice cold air conditioning. Not to mention the property has the most beautiful gardens and color.

Access to town by foot is easy with the museum elevator to the lower level (free with card provided by hotel). The hotel restaurant food is 10/10.

This was one of the higher cost hotels we stayed during our honeymoon but we found it was worth the cost 100% compared to the others due to the level of treatment and service. If you plan to splurge on a hotel in Salzburg this is the one you must visit.

Cannot wait to come back!

We loveeeeed this hotel! We went to Salzburg in early June for a few days and this hotel was great. The room was very spacious and they upgraded us to a bigger suite upon arrival. The pool was nice and was not crowded at all. Our breakfast was included and was great — it had lots of options and the service was quick. The hotel gave us tickets to a lift, which is a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. The lift will take you to the main shopping / food area in Salzburg. It was super convenient to get around so we only needed an Uber a few times. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to go back!!!
I can’t imagine a better place to stay! So close to everything but also so romantic up on top of the hill. Amazing service.

placeMetadata.name: Café Bazar

sources.snippet: And in Salzburg it is probably best to drink it in the historic Café Bazar. Celebrities such as Marlene Dietrich, Romy Schneider and Tomas Mann have been guests here.
sources.shortName: Salzburg tips: The Top 10 highlights for your romantic weekend

placeMetadata.description: Iconic coffeehouse serving traditional dishes, drinks & desserts in a charming space with a terrace.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Café Bazar is an iconic coffeehouse located in the Liefering district of Salzburg, offering a charming space with a terrace where guests can enjoy traditional dishes, drinks, and desserts. Hosted by Evelyn Brandstatter and her enthusiastic team, the café boasts a perfect synergy with Restaurant Brandstatter, known for its award-winning cuisine.

reviews.reviewText: Absolutely gorgeous cafe. On a warm and sunny late morning, I sat here and watched passerby’s walk along the river while enjoying a wonderful cappuccino and omelette. The ingredients are very fresh, the service is very kind, and the atmosphere is classy and pleasant.

It is a cafe with prices a little bit on the higher side. However, once you enter the cafe it feels like you are in the old style Viennese coffee houses.
The waiters are busy but they are very nice and polite.
Service is fast. Coffee is good. The desserts are great. We had a chocolate mousse which was very nice. For me the highlight was apfelstrudel with vanilla sauce. It was the best I have had in a long time in Austria. It was very fresh, and flaky and the vanilla sauce was mild, light and complicated the strudel very well.

super classical vibe, amazing service that's very friendly and understanding to the point of having an english menu too.
food was great and coffee was even better.
definitely worth a stop just to take it in
Beautiful cafe. Delicious cappuccino, eggs and bacon, yogurt and croissant. Great service, reasonable prices

Go for the best Topfen and Apple Strudels in Salzburg, ask for vanilla sauce on the side. Charming cafe for breakfast or an afternoon break along the river, and one of Salzburg’s oldest establishments. Must visit.
The ambiance and food taste delightful, the view of the river and the people watching make me want to come back. Small menu, great wine, great service
Be patient if there's a queue for the terrace, it's worth the wait for the toasted sandwiches and fruity ice cream. It has a literary history too.
Classy breakfast location. Terrace wasn't open at breakfast but was packed later in the day when we passed by. Food was simple but lively with top service. Highly enjoyable.

placeMetadata.name: Pension Bloberger Hof

sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

placeMetadata.description: Cozy, relaxed rooms in a quaint hotel offering a restaurant & complimentary parking.
placeMetadata.address: Pension Bloberger Hof ***, Hammerauer Str. 4, 5020 Salzburg, Austria

reviews.reviewText:
We loved everything about this hotel!

The room was clean and beautiful. The beds were extremely comfortable.

The hotel was dog friendly , although we kept our dog in the room for breakfast and dinner upon request which we were happy with.

The view from our room was spectacular and a lovely way to wake up each day.

The breakfast was excellent and couldn’t wish for a better start to the morning. There was a wide selection. I believe the dining room has been recently renovated and it was beautiful.

We ate dinner at the hotel and it was such a very tasty and relaxing experience that we chose to return the following evening for dinner also. We would recommend a price list for daily specials.

We would love to return to the hotel again in a different season. We imagine it would also be a great experience.

The bus stop is 2 minutes walk and it is around 15-20 minutes to get to the centre of Salzburg. Around 40 minutes to the HBF with one bus change. We also bought a 24hr bus ticket from the hotel reception.

The family owners are very friendly. Thank you.

Our stay at Pension Blobergerhof was absolutely wonderful from beginning to end. Located in a peaceful, scenic area just outside the city, this charming family-owned guesthouse offered everything we hoped for and more.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and very comfortable, with beautiful mountain views from the balcony. We loved relaxing by the lovely pool.

A real highlight of our stay was having access to bikes. Riding through the forests and quiet country paths to the palace was one of our favorite activities.

The breakfasts were fresh and delicious, with a great variety of choices, and the dinner we had was some of the best food we had in Austria.

The bus stop is just a short walk from the pension, making it very easy to get to the center of Salzburg.

We were sad to go when our stay ended, and hope to return someday soon.

Beautiful building, with what looks like a recently renovated breakfast room. The room itself was massive, with a nice bathroom and the view from our window was perfect!

The staff are so friendly, you can pay at reception for daily bus tickets into Salzburg, which was really easy and only took 15 minutes to get into the centre.

Breakfast was delicious and a really good thorough spread with plenty of options for vegetarians too.

The room was a little hot but it's been exceptionally hot in Austria all week, so not the fault of the hotel.

Can't rate highly enough, will definitely be coming back! ☺️
Beautiful and convenient location. Family run and they make you feel at home. Lodging, food, atmosphere  and wonderful people.

We loved Bloberger hof! It was so hard to leave. Truly a little haven just a short bus ride to Salzburg. We wanted to stay somewhere peaceful and we couldn't have picked a better spot. The views were beautiful, the rooms were cozy and clean. The breakfast and dinner was delicious. The little details everywhere was beautiful and truly appreciated. She even gave us warm tea while we waited for our bus to leave. A lovely family and a wonderful experience.

Lovely hotel, clean room with lovely bathroom, free parking and good breakfast (although this is an optional extra).

Would visit again, however the rooms can get warm if the temperature is high as no air conditioning.

My husband and I had the most amazing experience staying at this first class run hotel.  Sylvia and her family could not have done more to make our stay so special. Should be a 5 Star hotel!!  It was the perfect location to celebrate my 60th Birthday.

Another phenomenal stay!  We have been visiting the Blobergerhof since 2014 and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

This family-run slice of paradise is wonderful.  The rooms are always spotless and clean.  The breakfast is the best anywhere and the dinner selections are amazing.

The availability of easy parking and close proximity of the city bus stop to the property provides stress-free access to Salzburg.

Sylvia and the family are delightful and pleasant and know how to do the little things to make the overall experience fulfilling and rewarding.

They are continuously doing meticulous maintenance to the building and rooms to keep everything looking brand new.  The opening of the outdoor pool really made a few very hot days so much nicer!

We can't wait to visit again!

placeMetadata.name: Hotel Goldener Hirsch, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Salzburg

sources.snippet:
This ancient though luxurious hotel oozes history, offering sophisticated service in a traditional Austrian setting. Authentic antiques, delicious cuisine and a cosy ambience make this the top choice for a luxury stay in Salzburg. from 
$252
for 1 room, 1 nightincluding taxes & fees
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Salzburg, Austria (2025)

placeMetadata.description: Elegant hotel in a centuries-old inn, offering 2 refined restaurants & a rustic bar.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hotel Goldener Hirsch, a Luxury Collection Hotel in Salzburg, is an elegant establishment housed in a centuries-old inn. The hotel offers two refined restaurants and a rustic bar. It has been welcoming guests for over 600 years and exudes the style of an Austrian countryside manor with its white walls, exposed brick, and signature gold stag motif. The seventy guestrooms are individually styled with many featuring antique furnishings for an elegant ambiance.

reviews.reviewText: Our first trip to Salzburg was made even more special by the incredible hospitality and beautiful room at the Hotel Goldener Hirsch.  The staff were possibly the best, most genuinely warm and gracious of any hotel we have stayed at.  The decor is traditional Austrian with a luxurious bent.  Our room had all of the amenities we needed to settle in and relax (including AC!).  You feel comfortable and home immediately.  Throughout our stay, from check-in, until check-out we felt so well-cared for by everyone in the hotel.  Our dinner in the restaurant was exquisite and delicious.  It was a joy to stay here, and we will definitely return on our next trip to Salzburg.

Oh my gosh, what a magnificent place this is! This hotel has been around for centuries, and it oozes history in every pore. We were upgraded to a lovely suite. The staff was very open and friendly, and we had no problem communicating with one another one would expect in most German speaking countries.  They even put up with my bad German. Our breakfast was tremendous, and I can’t complain about a single thing during our visit. If you love good service and a good hotel in the absolute heart of town this is the place for you.

We recently stayed 3 nights in the King One Bedroom Suite. The details and decor of this hotel are unmatched. The traditional Austrian touches add to the charm of being in the heart of the Altstadt. We ate breakfast every morning in the hotel and loved the variety and service. While lacking in certain amenities; sauna, gym, etc, the hotel lends to a bygone era of service and class.

This hotel is truly world class! We had originally booked the Grand Sheraton, but due to a leak, Marriott moved us to the goldener hirsch. They upgraded us to a junior suite, which was incredible. The service was exquisite and the location couldn’t have been any better. This hotel is worth the splurge and made our Salzburg experience that much better!

This hotel made our stay in Salzburg the best. I can’t speak more highly of the service we received, the food we ate, or the accommodations! Amazing location - the heart of old town. We would strongly recommend staying here!

Very elegant hotel, beautiful rooms, central location.
Breakfast was amazing.
Close your curtains during the day in the summer, as air conditioners in Europe are not as powerful as in America.

One of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The staff was incredible. For example, I left my airpods in my room, and the staff offered to ship them back to me in the US, and did so promptly. My 2 young kids were greeted with toys and warm smiles at check in and throughout the stay.  The morning breakfast staff went above and beyond accomodating my little kids and the "fun" they had at each meal with no issues of the mess they made and foods they asked for from the kitchen.  We will definitely be back. thank you to the team/staff.

I’ve been visiting Salzburg since 1995, and with our daughter now living here, we’ve stayed in many different places over the years. But none have felt like home the way Hotel Goldener Hirsch does.

The hospitality is exceptional. Warm, attentive and genuine. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel not just welcomed, but cared for. Our room was beautifully appointed, with a view overlooking the Pferdeschwemme. It was comfortable in that rare way that makes you want to unpack, settle in and stay a while.
Breakfast service delivered to our room each morning allowed us to ease into the day with quiet and comfort. In the evenings, we found ourselves at the hotel bar both before and after dinner, drawn in by the atmosphere and the incredibly welcoming bartender. I wish I had gotten his name. His professionalism, beautiful cocktails and way of making everyone feel like a regular added a layer of warmth that made those evenings feel special.

I'm going to return. Hotel Goldener Hirsch is more than a luxury property. It’s where we’ll return, again and again, because it feels like coming home.

placeMetadata.name: Salzach Cruise

sources.snippet: Taking a slow cruise along the Salzach River is another popular thing to do in Salzburg for tourists. It gives you a great opportunity to view the city from a different perspective, but also to rest your legs and enjoy the scenery in comfort. Although there are various cruises available – romantic cruises, for example, or those including visits to particular attractions – a regular boat tour is free with the Salzburg Card.
sources.shortName: 17 BEST Places to See & Things to Do in Salzburg, Austria (+Map & Tips)

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Embarking on a leisurely Salzach Cruise is a popular activity for visitors to Salzburg. This experience offers a unique perspective of the city and allows travelers to relax while taking in the picturesque scenery. While there are different cruise options available, including romantic tours and themed excursions, a standard boat tour is complimentary with the Salzburg Card. The informative commentary provided during the cruise gives insight into the area's history in both German and English.

reviews.reviewText:
The trip was nice, with beautiful views.
1 route is free with the Salzburg card, but need to come to the kiosk to register and get tickets first.
The trip was around 40 minutes.
On the board was a bar, but no toilet, so use it before boarding.

It was a pleasure! The pretty captain lady was so amazing! She was very enthusiastic, apparently loves her job, the stories of her about the ship and the city was very interesting. With Salzburg card, the trip was free of charge. Definitely worth it!

The Salzburg Cruise, included with the Salzburg Card, offers a delightful experience. Sit on the starboard side for the best views as the ship goes upriver, passing by homes and mansions you'd never see while walking around Salzburg. If the 45-minute cruise hadn’t been included with the Salzburg Card, we probably wouldn’t have purchased the ticket separately.
Recommend this short trip up the river to learn about the history of the city. Staff are great and make the trip a little more fun than expected.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ A must-do in Salzburg!

The Salzach Cruise was one of the highlights of our trip! Cruising along the river with stunning views of Salzburg’s old town, the fortress, and the surrounding mountains is simply unforgettable. The boat is modern, very comfortable, and offers a smooth ride.

The crew was friendly, professional, and gave just the right amount of interesting information without overloading it. We especially loved the relaxing atmosphere – you can just sit back, enjoy the scenery, and see Salzburg from a completely new perspective.

It’s the perfect activity for families, couples, or anyone who wants to experience the city from the water. Highly recommended – we would definitely do it again!

We took Tour 1 and it was great. It was about 45 minutes long and the captian was commenting all the way in German, English and Italian. Views along the river are nice. They served drinks on board and in the end there was really nice "boat waltz" 🛥💃
Fantastic cruise and lovely company! We messed up our ticket booking for a group of ten. And they went out of their way to solve it for us! What stars! Cannot recommend highly enough!

The cruise ride was very pleasant, the caption talks about the history of the place and gives valuable information in both German and English.

It’s also included in the Salzburg card, it allows you to take cable car in untersbergbahn, fortress and cruise. The trick is to be very quick. Recommend you to start with the bahn and then cruise and fortress.

Keep in mind everything closes at 5 in Salzburg and cruise is a must do.

placeMetadata.name: Verein Salzburger Christkindlmarkt

sources.shortName: 11 Free And Cheap Date Ideas To Try In Salzburg

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Verein Salzburger Christkindlmarkt is a heartwarming and homely market that attracts visitors from all over, even during the turn of the year. It's described as a fantastic city with a Christmas market worth visiting. Visitors express their happiness and love for this charming market, making it a must-visit destination during the holiday season.

reviews.reviewText:
(Translated by Google) Great atmosphere, full stalls and crowds of tourists...

(Original)
Krasno vzdušje, polne stojnice in gneče turistov...
Beautiful market with lots of options for presents, mulled wine and wieners

(Translated by Google) Previously I would have given it 5 stars. There was always a great selection, hardly any decoration is as beautiful as in Salzburg. The city is romantic and unique with its narrow streets and exclusive shops. Unfortunately, word got around over the years because we were shocked by the huge crowds. For us it was hardly possible to enjoy the festival without crowds, lack of visibility or shops so full that there was no room to stand and turn. Actually, it's a shame. This was always my favorite Christmas market

(Original)
Früher hätte ich glatte 5 Sterne gegeben. Es gab immer eine tolle Auswahl, kaum eine Dekoration ist so schön wie in Salzburg. Die Stadt ist mit ihren engen Gassen und exklusiven Läden romantisch und einzigartig. Leider hat sich das wohl über die Jahre herum gesprochen, denn wir waren geschockt über die riesigen Menschenmassen. Für uns war es kaum möglich das fest zu genießen ohne Gedränge, fehlende Sicht oder Läden so voll dass man keinen Platz zum stehen und drehen hatte. Eigentlich sehr schade. Das war immer mein Lieblingsweihnachtsmarkt

(Translated by Google) Simply unique, ambience, old town, atmosphere, ..
TOP
Probably the most beautiful Christmas market in the most beautiful old town!

Einfach einzigartig, Ambiente, Altstadt, Stimmung, ..
TOP
Der wohl schönste Christkindlmarkt in der schönsten Altstadt!

(Translated by Google) Honestly, it's a pretty solid Christmas market. It has everything you need at a Christmas market. The stand operators can all speak reasonable English and are helpful. It's a big market so be prepared to go far.

Honestly, it's a solid Christmas market. It has everything that one could possibly need in a Christmas market. The stall owners can all halfway speak English and are really quite helpful. It is quite a large market so be ready to walk quite a while to see everything.

Ganz ehrlich, es ist ein ehe solider Christkindlmarkt. Es hat alles, dass man bei einem Christkindlmarkt so braucht. Die Standbetreiber können alle einigermaßen English reden und sind hilfsbereit. Es ist ein großer Markt also sei bereit weit zu gehen.

Honestly, it's a solid Christmas market. It has everything that one could possibly need in a Christmas market. The stall owners can all halfway speak English and are really quite helpful. It is quite a large market so be ready to walk quite a while to see everything.

(Translated by Google) Terrible for locals who just don't want to have to constantly drag themselves through crowds to buy food.
From pickpocketing to street begging, it's actually torture.
You're constantly being spoken to, jostled and the employees there are drunk stallholders who have been selling the same junk for years.

placeMetadata.name: Kapuzinerberg

sources.snippet: For those of you willing to put in a little legwork (and I do mean “legwork”), a detour up to Kapuzinerberg Hill is well worth the hike. The views over Salzburg are so incredible that they practically demand an appreciative sigh. At the top, you can reward yourselves with a stop at the Franziskischlössl restaurant—because nothing brings people closer together than trying to pronounce “Franziskischlössl” after a couple of glasses of wine.
sources.shortName: Romantic Escapes in Salzburg, Austria

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: If you're up for a bit of adventure, a hike to Kapuzinerberg Hill is an absolute must during your visit to Salzburg. This picturesque hill offers breathtaking panoramic views that will leave you in awe of the city below. As you ascend, you'll find yourself surrounded by nature and tranquility, making it a perfect escape from the bustling crowds.

placeMetadata.name: Glanspitzpark-Park

sources.snippet: Talk a stroll through the streets of the recently renovated area of Glanspitz, now kitted out with a lovely landscape garden and rivers, a football pitch, water gardens, fruit trees, and picnic grounds. Public BBQs are allowed, so grab a portable grill and serve up some sausages on a warm summer’s day.
sources.shortName: 11 Free And Cheap Date Ideas To Try In Salzburg

placeMetadata.description: Natural spot by the Salzach River with a playground & stream, plus grassy areas for picnics & sport.

reviews.reviewText: About what you'd expect from a park. It's got a swing set, a seesaw and a slackline thingie. Also you're not allowed to grill there, so keep that in mind when you go there.

Glanspitz-Park, located in Salzburg, Austria, is a tranquil green space ideal for relaxation and outdoor activities. Nestled at the confluence of the Salzach and Glan rivers, the park offers scenic views, well-maintained walking paths, and open spaces for picnics. It’s a favorite spot for locals to unwind, jog, or enjoy nature. Its peaceful ambiance and proximity to the city make it a perfect escape from urban life, blending natural beauty with accessibility.
Nice little park, very well maintained.
Nice park. Not overcrowded. Like to chill there.
Calm park and still gorgeous even in gloomy weather
Excellent View!

(Translated by Google) Large park where the glan flows into the Salzach. Lots of benches, playground. Large meadow. Nice river design.

(Original)
Grosser Park wo die glan in die Salzach fließt. Viele Sitzbänke, Spielplatz. Grosse Wiese. Nette Flussgestaltung.

(Translated by Google) It's always nice to be near the Salzach River. The playground is nicely designed. It's easily accessible by bike along the Salzach or by trolleybus lines 1, 7, and 8.

Es ist immer wieder schön in der Nähe von der Salzach. Der Spielplatz ist nett gestaltet. Gut erreichbar mit Fahrrad an der Salzach oder mit Obus der Linie 1, 7 und 8.

placeMetadata.name: Mozartplatz

sources.shortName: Salzburg for Lovers : Magazine

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Mozartplatz is a charming square in close proximity to Residenzplatz and the birthplace of Mozart. The focal point of this square is a statue of the legendary composer, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. It's definitely worth a visit for music enthusiasts and history buffs alike.

placeMetadata.name: Red Bull Hangar-7
placeMetadata.description: Futuristic building, home to the Flying Bulls display team, plus art shows, restaurants & bars.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Red Bull Hangar-7 is a futuristic building located next to the main Salzburg Airport. It houses the Flying Bulls display team and features various aeronautical artifacts, including airplanes, motorbikes, rally cars, and Formula 1 exhibits. The hangar also boasts several bars, a cafe, and a Michelin Star restaurant. Its unique architecture with a hydrofoil dome makes it an exciting place to visit.

reviews.reviewText:
Bucket-list experience – highly recommended!

Red Bull Hangar-7 was an unforgettable stop during my trip to Salzburg. The combination of aviation, motorsport, and cutting-edge architecture is unlike anything I’ve seen before. The displays — from historic planes to Red Bull’s Formula 1 beasts — are absolutely stunning. You can really feel the passion for speed, precision, and innovation in every corner of the space.

I’ve uploaded some photos I took during my visit — but honestly, they don’t do it justice. You have to experience it in person to really appreciate the scale and atmosphere.

The best part? Entry is free! There’s also a Michelin-star restaurant and a stylish bar inside, which adds to the overall premium feel of the place.

Whether you’re a motorsport fan, an aviation enthusiast, or just someone who appreciates world-class design — Hangar-7 is a must-see.

10/10 would visit again.

The building has incredible architecture. Impressive. Admission is free. Inside there is a neat exhibition of contemporary artists, which makes the place even more interesting. We visited it early on Thursday, but unfortunately the planes were taking them out of the hangar to participate in flights and we couldn't look at them. Fortunately, the cars and motors were there and we're able to look at them at least. The fan shop is not very big, but you can find your favorite Red Bull item.

A wonderful museum to visit if you love airplanes and cars for sure!!! The admission is free and you can simply just walk in! The ice cream place near the entrance is also very delicious. And I’d like to mention the best for last in my opinion; the restrooms. PLEASE go visit them, they’re absolutely BEAUTIFUL AND VERY SANITARY. It felt like luxury treatment in there haha! I went to this museum with my father, but I would love to visit this place again with my friends next time I travel to Switzerland! ♥️♥️♥️

Stumbled on this by chance,was recommended by the person who's apartment we book for our holidays.
It's free to enter which is awesome,has a small collection from bikes to F1 cars to planes and helicopters.
Loved seeing the F1 cars up close as a massive fan.
Doesn't take long to look around though so don't expect to be in there anymore than an hour.(But that's my opinion)
Overall pretty good and worth a visit.
Beautifully presented hangar/tech-museum. Was expecting something a little bigger than it was, but still a cool place to check out. Parking was spacious and free, as was the entry to the museum.

Visiting Red Bull Hangar-7 was an incredible experience! ✈️🚁 The unique architecture of the building itself is already impressive, but the real magic happens inside. The exhibition of historic airplanes, Formula 1 cars, and helicopters is simply breathtaking. Everything is perfectly arranged, and you can really feel the spirit of innovation and passion for speed. The place combines history, technology, and art in such a fascinating way.

The atmosphere is modern and inspiring, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. It’s a must-see in Salzburg not only for motorsport or aviation fans, but for anyone who enjoys extraordinary places. Highly recommended! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

An amazing collection you have here! I was amazed by the amount of aircraft and automoviles inside the hangar, all very well placed, in perfect harmony. Definitely a place to visit in Salzburg for Engineering enthusiasts.

Red Bull Complex - Anger 7 - Salzburg.

A large complex that includes a display of the company's aircraft from all years, special racing cars, motorcycles and engines and more. Very nice, very beautiful, special, impressive. In addition, the adjacent runway where you can see the sights.

There is a cafe and ice cream. There is an exhibition of the company and a gift shop.

ops.insert: Huge 11th-century fortress complex on a hilltop with views over city to the Alps, plus museums.
Rocky plateau above Salzburg with woods, meadows, castles & a modern art museum, reached by a lift.
Twin spires top this baroque-style 17th-century cathedral, with a museum housing sacred treasures.
Iconic, 17th-century palace with ornamental gardens, plus classical concerts in the lavish ballroom.
Creative dishes & drinks are served in the elegant ambience of reputedly Europe's oldest restaurant.
A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this expansive Baroque complex offers art & cultural history tours.
Woodsy, old-world inn known for fried chicken, bread dumplings & beer, plus an outdoor terrace.
Catholic church & monastery dating to the 7th century, featuring a cemetery, catacombs & a museum.
Family-friendly zoo with animals from Africa, Eurasia, Australia & the Americas, plus dining.
Narrow medieval street, birthplace of the "Silent Night" poet & home to past & current brothels.
Informal haunt for beers, wines & homestyle Austrian dishes in a rustic setting with a terrace.
Picturesque cemetery with baroque tombs of nobility as well as 12th-century catacombs & chapels.
Iconic coffeehouse serving traditional dishes, drinks & desserts in a charming space with a terrace.
21st century bridge for pedestrians & cyclists, the 3rd of its name, after painter Hans Makart.
Cozy, relaxed rooms in a quaint hotel offering a restaurant & complimentary parking.
Baroque-style museum with a courtyard, showcasing graphics & photographs by modern Austrian artists.
Late-night venue featuring an eclectic selection of live jazz musicians & shows for kids.
Airport serving the city & ski areas for domestic or international flights, plus bus & train links.
Elegant hotel in a castlelike hilltop building, plus a refined restaurant, a spa & an infinity pool.

place.name: Hotel Goldener Hirsch, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Salzburg

ops.insert: Elegant hotel in a centuries-old inn, offering 2 refined restaurants & a rustic bar.
Laid-back venue offering contemporary lodging, a relaxed restaurant & a furnished patio.
Natural spot by the Salzach River with a playground & stream, plus grassy areas for picnics & sport.
Venerable conservatory & dramatic-arts school with 2 concert halls, a student orchestra & choir.
Futuristic building, home to the Flying Bulls display team, plus art shows, restaurants & bars.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Nestled in the heart of Austria, Salzburg is a city that exudes romance at every turn. With its stunning baroque architecture, winding cobblestone streets, and breathtaking views of the Alps, it’s no wonder that couples flock to this enchanting destination. Imagine strolling hand-in-hand through the picturesque Old Town, where the melodies of Mozart fill the air and the aroma of freshly baked pastries wafts from charming cafés. From the majestic Fortress Hohensalzburg overlooking the city to the serene Mönchsberg, Salzburg offers countless spots that are perfect for creating unforgettable memories with your loved one.

As you explore this romantic city, you’ll discover a delightful mix of well-known landmarks and hidden gems. Picture a leisurely afternoon spent in the beautifully manicured gardens of Mirabell Palace, or a cozy dinner at St. Peter Stiftskulinarium, where traditional Austrian cuisine is served in an elegant setting. Whether you’re enjoying a coffee at Café Tomaselli or taking a peaceful walk across the Marko-Feingold-Steg with the sunset casting a golden glow over the Salzach River, Salzburg invites you to embrace its charm and romance. So pack your bags and get ready to explore the most romantic corners of this captivating city!
