placeMetadata.name: Karl-Franzens-Universität Botanical Garden

sources.shortName: 21 Instagrammable places in Graz

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Karl-Franzens-Universität Botanical Garden, operated by the Institute of Botany at the University of Graz, offers a diverse collection of plants from four different climatic zones within its three greenhouses. Visitors can explore tropical rainforest flora, desert plants, and more. The unique armadillo shell-shaped glasshouses provide an immersive experience as they recreate these distinct climate zones. The garden also features guided tours for children and special exhibitions.

reviews.reviewText: Free, friendly and knowledgeable staff and amazing plants. I also bought some delicious chilli jam made on site and at a super fair price. Love it!

Diverse collection of plants, beautiful all. The architecture of buildings and green houses is also in harmony. Many walkable paths in the outside gardens allow to get very close to the different labelled species. Highly enjoyable!

The Botanical Garden is a peaceful green oasis in the heart of the city, perfect for a relaxing stroll among a diverse array of plants. A true highlight is the tropical house, where warm, humid air and lush vegetation create an immersive jungle-like experience. Other areas, such as the rock garden and collections of native plants, are thoughtfully designed and well-labeled. With free admission, the garden is an ideal destination for nature lovers and anyone looking to unwind in beautiful surroundings.
Beautiful gardens and greenhouses where you can easily spend few hours enjoying the nature. The entrance is free and there’s a nice shop as well where you can buy a lots of fun stuff.

Very close to the tram line, easy to access. The garden is well organized and the entrance is free. I think this is a must-see destination if you are interested in plants. The diversity is amazing. It is a heaven for macro photographers, I spent more than 2 hours inside.

Visited this absolutely gorgeous botanical garden in May 2024. It's has a great variety of stunning flowers, plants and trees.
Karl-Franzens-Universität Botanical Garden is officially my favorite place in Graz city. Loved every second spent here!
The main greenhouse is designed beautifully, it's like you've entered a fairytale. I especially loved the bridges. You might want to take a couple of photos here, it's magical!
Be ready to spend more than two hours here, it's worth it.
Also, there is a little aquarium in one of the greenhouses.
The entrance is free, no ticket is needed. You can donate whatever amount you want to.
I love this place. It's free entry. You can buy something in a small shop after. For example small plants, perfumed eating salt, or rosé sugar, or pine vinegar
It's worth spending time in this place @ Graz.

placeMetadata.name: Folk Life Museum

sources.shortName: 39+ Best Things to Do & See in Graz (by a Local)

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: If you're eager to dive deep into the rich tapestry of a country's history, the Folk Life Museum in Graz is an essential stop on your journey. Nestled within a former Capuchin monastery at Paulustor, this museum showcases an impressive array of exhibits that span from ancient times to contemporary cultural phenomena. Here, you can explore traditional attire and intricate handicrafts while gaining insights into prehistoric life and societal evolution.

reviews.reviewText: There are exhibitions, there is a church and a library(was closed when I visited). I can clearly suggest this museum, if you are interested in the local culture and history. I spent almost two hours in the museum.

A very underrated museum about the Styrian culture and life from the past till now told through several themes like transportation or communication. The museum gets you to think about how things were like. There was a real wealth of information - we spent 1hour and think it's not enough despite it being a small museum. Student tickets available. Only suggestion is to give more context to what they have written and tell it more like a story. And also there was nothing on colonialism besides something on chickens in ghana. Even the holocaust was only very briefly touched upon. There are english descriptions which we appreciated.

This museum has an interesting concept of telling a story about Graz and Styria in an unusual manner (mostly) without expensive artifacts. Howevere, many of the items displayed have a story behind them. The pearls are the "smoke room", a wooden bicycle and replicas of historic clothes. It takes 1 - 2 hours to experience the museum properly. It's surely worth of a visit.
Good effort museum clearly updated content! Wish there was free wifi to use my translation app for the German information

Rather small museum. The highlights are the the small peasant house that was moved to the site a century ago and the collection of traditional clothing. The costumes are in an adjoining building which is connected through a passage with an automatic door.

Cool place to visit and walk when almost everything else is closed (typical Sunday in Austria). Parking is free on Sundays, which is a bonus :)

View is amazing. Do not use elevator. Stairs are way to go. You will figure out why :)

I will go again. Recomended.

A small museum about people and cultures of Gratz and Styria. The costume exhibition is wonderful. The others are very interesting, but surrounded by strange modern exhibitions. The link between them isn't easy to understand.

The impression really depends on what you are interested in. Museum is quite good if you wanna know more about Austrian history (how people lived in villages and so), not so interesting if you are not too much into that. Overally a nice museum to see.

placeMetadata.name: New Gallery Graz

sources.shortName: 39+ Best Things to Do & See in Graz (by a Local)

placeMetadata.description: Museum in a 15th-century building with modern accents containing sections for natural history & art.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Joanneumsviertell is an art museum located in Graz that showcases paintings and sculptures from the late 1800s to the present day, with an emphasis on Austrian artists. It also has a number of other exhibits including a natural history section containing fossils. The Neue Galerie (the New Gallery) is located in the Old Town, so it's easy to get to.

reviews.reviewText: Great museum. Nice collection

The first part about this museum is it has a lot of rocks. If you are a gemologist its heaven for you.
I feel like there wasnt enough other storys, tales and artifacts for anything else. I feel there could really be much more.
I do think the museum needs a bit of creativity not only plane seeds and couple rooms of animals.
The price is quite big as well.

Educational for kids. Personel issues, need to be educated in respectful interaction and beeing not in your face while watching over exibiton. Not good for forigners as there is no English transelation in 70% of exibits.
The new exhibition is really well organized and great to walk through.

i wasn't really convinced of the a t they had there exhibitions but that is personal taste i guess. otherwise wonderfully done and well presented. i loved some pieces a lot. and the Mal teller. spent hours there with the kids. even got a coffee and the staff was very helpful!

We met a very helpful staff that willing to help us change our ticket after realised that we didn’t purchase the tix package for museums
Very nice and well-preserved exhibition
Library is cozy
Really hope to visit here again !

This museum is ridiculous: 1) I  wanted to get two tickets for my wife and me to enter the art museum, and they printed me one entrance ticket with 2 adults' access.   We got inside and visited different rooms as we have different interests and pace. The entrance ticket was kept all along in my pocket. When the guard asked my wife to show her ticket, she explained to him that the ticket is with her husband. The guard dismissed that and asked her to leave. She felt very upset about this though she was able to stay since I had just passed by the door without noticing what was happening. I was later told about the whole story, though. 2) Most of the displayed information (permanent collection) is in German with no English translation. To us, the experience in this museum was very unpleasant. Our advice is don't waste your money and time in this museum.
The natural museum is just wonderful, unfortunately, the fungi austellung is closed.

placeMetadata.name: Hauptplatz der Stadt Graz

sources.snippet: Graz Hauptplatz is the main square and at the same time the center of the old town, and certainly the most beautiful square in the state capital. Already laid out in 1160, this historic place still enchants with an extra portion of charm and the many beautiful attractions, such as the Archduke Johann Fountain Monument and the magnificent City Hall. Really cool are also the traditional Graz market stalls, where hearty sausages and delicious organic juices are offered.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Amazing Things to Do in Graz (Austria)

placeMetadata.description: Historical town square surrounded by medieval buildings & featuring a bronze statue of a punk.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Graz, the Hauptplatz der Stadt Graz is a vibrant historical town square that beautifully encapsulates the essence of this charming city. Surrounded by stunning medieval architecture, it features a striking bronze statue that adds character to the scene. The square buzzes with life as locals and visitors alike gather for various events, from lively hip-hop performances to picturesque wedding celebrations where brides make their grand entrance against the backdrop of the magnificent town hall.

reviews.reviewText:
This is certainly worth a visit for rail enthusiasts or for that matter, folks with an interest in local rail history. There's not much to see in the town itself on weekends however.
The displays are first class and very well done. The engines and equipment in the old roundhouse are outstanding. A tip of the hat to the folks who made it happen.

The Main Square of Graz is one of the most charming places I’ve visited in Europe. It’s full of history and atmosphere, surrounded by beautifully preserved medieval buildings that make you feel like you've stepped into another century. The architecture is stunning from every angle, especially if you take time to look up at the details on the facades.

The square has a lively but relaxed vibe, with cafes, street performers, and people just sitting around enjoying the moment. Right in the middle, there’s a striking bronze statue that at first glance feels traditional, but if you look closely, it has this unexpected punk element—like a subtle twist that adds humor to the history around it. It really makes the whole place feel unique.

It’s a great spot to start exploring Graz—everything important seems to branch out from here. Whether you’re into photography, architecture, or just people-watching with a coffee, this square has something for you. I ended up spending more time here than I expected, just taking in the energy. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the city.
Love From India ❤️

A nice way to chill myself during the trip. There are a lot of ways spreading from here, so you can arrive at the major spots of the city quickly and conveniently. When I was there, there was a Coca-Cola corp-backed public festival with decent music.

The Graz Main Square is the heart of Graz. It is a popular meeting point, it is surrounded by beautiful architecture and there are numerous fast food shops. When visiting Graz one should take at least one day or a whole weekend to really get into the city. The city vibe is great, lively but not aggressive. Strolling through the alleys and passages, visiting the 16th Century bakery and getting up to Schlossberg should be on the tourist to do-list :)
We visited during the Easter holiday and were disappointed—Hauptplatz was filled with unused tents that blocked the view. Instead of a festive Easter fair, it felt empty and unorganized.

Main Square, on the left bank of the River Mur. Here, is a fine statue of Archduke Johann. Also there is the Town Hall (Rathaus), built in 1893, and the 17th-century Haus am Luegg, with its attractive arcaded and stucco-decorated facade.
It's just a shame that they put various stalls and kiosks in this gorgeous place that prevent you from enjoying the beauty of the place, especially the bad smell emanating is terrible, sacrilegious
Nice buildings around the place. Lots of cyclists, tramway station, not really a pleasant place to go. Just for walk around.
I am sure, those people which have built this place, wouldn't do it if they knew what it will become in 20th century.

placeMetadata.name: Stadtpark Graz

sources.snippet: For a touch of greenery, the Stadtpark, filled with lush landscapes and sculptures, adds a serene atmosphere to your photography.
sources.shortName: Graz: Capture the Most Photogenic Spots With a Local

placeMetadata.description: Leafy oasis with a children's playground & landscaped walkways through planted flower beds.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Stadtpark Graz is a leafy oasis located near the city center, offering a serene escape from urban hustle. The park boasts landscaped walkways, planted flower beds, and a children's playground where kids can have a wonderful time. Visitors can relax under enormous chestnut trees or on comfy benches while watching squirrels and enjoying the company of locals.

reviews.reviewText: Great experience even if it was closing time, lovely weather. Beautiful places around to chill and enjoy a good drink! 🥰🥰🥰

I was very pleased to find this large park, right in the heart of Graz. It's the perfect choice for taking a stroll, unwind and see the world go by.

During spring time, you'll see a lot of green trees, colorful flowers and those splendid magnolias.

I also liked the fact that it's a great area to practice sports. Definitely worth a visit while you find yourself in Graz.

A large park next to the old city centre and ancient city walls. There are many large old trees giving shade and large lawn areas. It has a view of the "Ententeich" duck pond and there are many benches to relax. It's very popular with groups and families.  There is a cafe in the middle but also 2 more outlets for food and drinks in the eastern part I visited. There are special areas where kids can play and skate etc. I'll go there again.
Really peaceful and cozy. Many people piknik here. A one quite enjoyable park for sure!!
One of my favourite spots in Graz. There's a bit of everything here: sports fields, open space for picnics and group hangouts, monuments, gardens...

You can enter into the park for free.
Nice park with many green area what is good for resting place.
Trees, many benches, fountains... Public transport is not so far. In the south side it has a big garage for cars. Many people use the park to relax, but it is not overcrowded.
Great urban park, so near to the city centre and to some of the universities in Graz, no wonder it was full of students when we were there.
Definitely one of my favorite places in Graz. I used to come here with my squad when I was there for my Erasmus. I will miss this place a lot. I hope I can come back one day.

placeMetadata.name: Schlossbergbahn

sources.snippet: Graz has its own funicular railway that allows for easy access to the top area of Schlossberg. It has been running for 100 years and is a very quick and photogenic journey. Schlossberg also has its own lift.
sources.shortName: 23 Fantastic Things to do in Graz Austria You'll Love

placeMetadata.description: Panoramic city views from a steep funicular railway carrying passengers up the Schlossberg hill.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Schlossbergbahn, also known as the Castle Hill Funicular, is a popular attraction in Graz, Austria. This steep funicular railway offers a convenient and scenic ride from Schlossbergplatz to the top of the forested 123-meter-high Schlossberg hill. The journey provides panoramic city views and takes only 2-3 minutes. Visitors can enjoy a walk around, visit museums, or relax at a beer bar and restaurant at the hilltop.

reviews.reviewText: Free to ride on Saturdays during advent.  Most if the lines are to go up. No lines going down so you can easily get front seat.

This is by far the best route to get to the top of the Schlossberg. It's the most scenic too, as you see the beauty of the city unfold in front of you. The funicular is modern and quick, taking only two minutes to go up or down.

The price is also very cheap and we had the whole vehicle to ourselves. Compared to other funiculars in Europe, this one is perfect. The staff was also very polite.

Highly recommend for a quick ride to the top (or bottom!) It's convenient and fairly priced.  Consider a day pass for easy and price friendly way to ride the city's busses, trams, and the funicular!

A must do on your trip to Graz!
Much cheaper alternative to the elevator. If walking is not an option for you, and you already have a city public transport ticket (approximately 6€ for 24h), this is a good choice. It's fun too.
Convinient, but more importantly, the cost for 24 hours is not only not that higher than a single ride, but includes the public transport for the whole city.
Fun way to go up or down the mountain. Prices felt reasonable.

Great way to get an unique view of the city. Quite a quick ride, with departures scheduled every 15 minutes.
The ticket is included in the public transport ticket, which is great!
The 260 steps up are worth every drop of sweat on your forehead!

placeMetadata.name: Burggarten

sources.snippet: Der Burggarten in Graz grenzt an den Stadtpark und ist bei freiem Eintritt täglich zwischen 8 und 19 Uhr geöffnet. Der Zugang ist über den Burghof möglich, ein weiterer Zugang befindet sich neben dem Café Promenade. Dieser Fotospot ist im Herbst, wenn sich die Blätter der Bäume bunt färben, besonders schön zu fotografieren.
sources.siteName: Graz - Das Stadtmagazin mit tollen Fotos und aktuellen Infos
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Graz: Die schönsten Foto Hot-Spots für Instagram Pics in Graz

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Burggarten is a tranquil and charming park located in the city center, offering a peaceful retreat from the bustling urban environment. Tucked behind the Styrian State government, it provides a serene atmosphere with its lush green spaces, leafy trees, and captivating water ponds. The park's discreet pathways and considerate seating areas make it an ideal spot for unwinding. Visitors can enjoy the mesmerizing natural scenery while taking a leisurely stroll or spending quality time with family.

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful space right next to Stadtpark
Hidden place for tourist but beautiful and calm place to relax
Peaceful place on a rainy day
We had a great time celebrating the birthday of a very special friend.
Very peaceful and beautifully landscaped park. Not always open to public though, as far as I know it is closed during winter and nighttime.
Lovely and tranquil place to sit or stroll through. Gardens are well kept and beautiful
Nice place to relax
The Burggarten is beautiful. Like, 5-stars beautiful. Mind the park is closed in winter.

placeMetadata.name: Area 5

sources.snippet: Feel like you are on top of the world and take the typical rooftop picture of yourself to show that you were in Graz. For other rooftop locations, check out my previous post. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: The most instagrammable spots in Graz

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Area 5, located on the top floor of Steirerhof at Jakominiplatz, offers a unique culinary experience. It is one of the 'build-your-own' concept restaurants in Graz where you can customize your burgers, pizzas, salads, and more. This makes it an ideal place to break the ice and enjoy a meal while taking in the view over Jakominiplatz.

reviews.reviewText:
Area 5 is a fantastic spot with a great selection of food 🍽️, and I loved the freedom to customize what I wanted on my meal. They offer plenty of vegetarian options too, which is a huge plus for anyone looking for meat-free choices 🌱. The service was really friendly and attentive, and the view over Jakominiplatz in Graz was a nice bonus, especially with their open-air seating section 🌞🌆.

Overall, a great place with good food and a relaxed vibe. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area! 👌🍔🌿
Ordered waffles with strawberry sauce, I can tell the waffle wasn’t made fresh. The strawberry sauce had crystal of sugars, I couldn’t complete it. The coffee came in cold
Good food. Good service. They accept payments with card.

Unlike what other reviews said, the service was slow and we had to wait quite a while to get our lunch; also the table was quite dirty. The concept of making up your own lunch on a slip of paper is nice and innovative and the food was ok and cheap. The ambience is young and quite crowded.

There can’t be many better places in Graz for a beer at the end of a sunny day. Wonderful views, great service, a decent selection of draft and bottled beer, and sensible prices!

They also do food with a sort of ‘build your own’ selection of pizzas, rostis, pastas etc. We didn’t have the chance to try these, but they looked good!

Was it just me or this place is just the best place in all of the Graz!
As soon as we arrived, staff came up to us and with SUPER friendly approach they helped us with with our order. Considering that we don't know a lot of German and there were a lot of other costumers, the waitress stayed with us to show us the menu.

After we ordered our pizzas, not much time passed until it arrived. And oh boy!! This guys really know what they are doing!! I couldn't believe that an costum order pizza could taste better than any other I had before! The doe was crispy, not dry at all and just with a mild taste so it can compliment all the toppings.

Go crazy with your order. I'm interested what you will find in your imagination ;)
A good place to unwind in the evening. Food was fine - tick a few boxes and you're done. I had the Spätzle with cheese which was very filling.
Nice place to have lunch/dinner, better in summer in the terrace. Usually it's crowded so you have to wait for your order. Better make a reservation before.  The view is nice too.

placeMetadata.name: Ginko

sources.snippet: This quaint little vegan café has beautiful floor tiles and cosy ambience. Perfect for a rest and some instagram portraits. Check out their instagram for inspiration: https://www.instagram.com/welovegreenhouse/
sources.shortName: The most instagrammable spots in Graz

placeMetadata.description: Hip, modern cafeteria offering a daily self-service buffet of international vegetarian fare.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Ginko is a modern cafeteria located in a small old town passage near the main square. It's an offshoot of the Ginko restaurant and offers a daily self-service buffet with international vegetarian dishes. The cafe serves the Greenhouse Blend, made from directly traded coffee beans from Brazil and El Salvador. The menu features a variety of dishes, including Indian vegetable pan, Styrian salad, curries, and rice dishes.

reviews.reviewText: great vegan buffet, a very large selection of vegan dishes, the food is very tasty and fresh, fast service, large space, good coffee and cakes. great place 😍😍😍

As far as vegan buffets go, the variety of ingredients is more than sufficient. The flavours tend to pull in direction of Indian cuisine(curries etc), but there are also enough other choices. The meals are tasty. Whatever you put on your plate, make sure that you do not skip the chutney (excellent if you are keen on slightly spicier add on to your dishes). The plates go in a scale and you pay per mass.

The food was delicious and the menu was varied. We were greeted by the young ladies who immediately made us feel at ease. Another plus was the warm welcome they gave our dog, Lulù. We absolutely must return.👍🏻👍🏻😁😁

As an adventurous food-lover who follows the beat of the world’s best bites, discovering Ginko in the heart of Graz is like stumbling upon a vibrant oasis of vegan culinary creativity. Open, airy, and welcoming, the café floods with natural light, inviting you to explore its colorful, self-service buffet island—from crisp, seasonal salads to thoughtfully prepared warm dishes, all made with conscious care and priced by weight.

I delighted in mixing and matching a plate of beautifully fresh salads, hearty mains, and a fragrant soup—each bite felt honest and thoughtfully composed. Later, the pastry counter captured my heart: vegan cakes and tarts so luscious and delicious, each slice a testament to their in-house bakery’s gentle care and artisan craft. The minimalist décor and friendly staff only added to the cozy yet modern vibe.

True, the price-per-gram approach means your experience is as personal as your plate—but seeing how lovingly each dish is prepared, it’s a small price for such mindful indulgence. Ginko isn’t just a meal—it’s a celebration of vegan cuisine done with soul, style, and sincerity. A must-visit in Graz for conscious diners and anyone craving food that feels both good and great.

overrated and overpriced.
i like that everything is vegan, but 18€/kg?? that's the price of an all you can eat buffet. i paid 22€ for the first picture and it was not even that good. all the salads were just sourly seasoned. the only thing i was impressed of was the wok in picture 2.
i would've given 2 stars if the waitress who cleaned, hadn't given my dog a bowl to drink from. no one guided us, nor greeted us, if you didn't know how their system worked, you would be confused.
Amazing vegan food. Very tasty. Loved it.

May 2022. Great spot for all likings (and dietary requirements). Kids & dogs welcome.
Ginko is an all-vegan buffet-organized restaurant, most of the dishes are gluten free.
They have a broad range of cold and warm dishes one can choose from. The different salads and main courses cover eastern-mediteranean/Levante, adriatic-mediteranean as well as Austrian home cuisine and include, for example, oven roasted veggies, quinoa, dahls and curries or stews such as ratatouille.
The menu varies daily, all dishes are prepared on site and produce is sourced locally and of organic quality.
The prize is by weight of the plate, in general it is on the higher side, but worth every penny!
I highly recommend this place.
One of the best vegan restaurants I’ve been to. Food absolutely delicious! And correct prices.

placeMetadata.name: Omas Teekanne Cafe - Brunch - Frühstück - Kuchen

sources.snippet: Check out their instagram for inspiration: https://www.instagram.com/omas_teekanne/. If you liked this article, check out my previous article on what to do in Graz.
sources.shortName: The most instagrammable spots in Graz

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Graz, Omas Teekanne Cafe is a delightful haven for food lovers and those seeking a cozy atmosphere. This charming spot offers an array of breakfast options that cater to all tastes, including vegetarian and vegan selections. Indulge in their signature Omas Frühstück, featuring a delightful mix of cheese, jam, spreads, fresh fruit, muesli, bread, and baked goods—perfect for starting your day on a high note.

reviews.reviewText:
If you’re wondering whether to spend money on a hotel buffet breakfast or eat in town, go to Omas Teekanne :)

I came by this morning to have a filling breakfast that would last me a few hours - which is exactly what I got. I had the scrambled eggs with pumpkin seed oil and fresh bread. The bread was crispy and warmed up and the portion was bigger than I expected for the price (also, you can pay with card there)! The employees were delightful and energetic :) I honestly can’t find anything bad to write about this place. Come here for great atmosphere and food.
Such a cosy and cute cafe! We really enjoyed our tea, coffee and cake! The cafe itself is decorated with so much love! Really worth a visit!

I went here for breakfast twice. I had the same thing both times - a large cappuccino and a croissant. The first time time was great. The coffee was hot and the croissant was fresh. The next day the coffee was lukewarm and the croissant was reheated suggesting it was not fresh. The atmosphere is cute

This cafe had great homemade breakfast. i ordered a pie with apple crumble - it's a huge portion! i ordered a handcraft grain cappuccino - the milk they put smells awesome. Priced at €3.5-4.8 a coffee - friendly price!!
Waitresses were lively. Their kindness made the experience super nice!
Became my favourite place for breakfast and lunch and snack time. The food portions are huge! Prices are justified! And the taste makes me miss a time I was not even born in!

One of the best services I experienced in Graz! The staff is super friendly and welcoming! The chocolate cake was delicious and the coffee too! Highly recommend especially for the great atmosphere, the interior design is super cute!

We got one Piece of cheesecake that was the size of 2 normal ones. One slice of Carrot Cake and one piece of brownie.

All of them were delicious. The carrot cake had an oriental flavour profile, the cheese cake was of a solide san Sebastian taste.

And all of that for a 17:30 o clock toogoodtogo for 4 €.
Though we had to pay 50ct on top for packaging
Really lovely café with super friendly service, original food and good drinks 😊 will definitely be back!

placeMetadata.name: Hauptplatz

sources.snippet: The Hauptplatz or main Square is characterised by the architecture of the staggered row of houses in the west of Hauptplatz, interrupted by narrow alleys, reminiscent of the Middle Ages. The original town hall structure was also incidentally a prison. Replaced by a newer classical style building in the 19th-20th century, wide empty area in front of the town hall offers room for various events, promoting public life in the square.
sources.shortName: Places To Visit In Graz, Austria, For The Travelling Architect - RTF

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Hauptplatz, the vibrant main square of the city, is a delightful blend of history and modernity. Its architecture features a charming row of staggered houses that harken back to medieval times, interspersed with narrow alleys that invite exploration. The original town hall, which once served as a prison, has been replaced by an elegant classical building from the 19th-20th century.

placeMetadata.name: Turtle Island

sources.shortName: The Instagrammable Places of Graz with a Local in Graz

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Turtle Island is a sanctuary dedicated to the well-being of turtles, where visitors can experience a strong sense of love and mindfulness towards these creatures. The organization behind Turtle Island is committed to conservation and research efforts for turtles. It's a place where the ethos of 'live and let live' is deeply felt, making it an ideal destination for those who appreciate wildlife and nature.

reviews.reviewText:
(Translated by Google) Since we are interested in adopting a Greek tortoise, we contacted Turtle Island to learn about the care and rehoming process from the animal shelter.

Both Ms. Pfeffinger and Ms. Sukic were very kind and helpful – Ms. Sukic, as a volunteer, took a lot of time to advise us over the phone and even visited us on her day off to choose the ideal location for the enclosure. Their dedication is tremendous, and we are grateful for the wonderful support. You can tell that the people there truly care about the animals. Thank you!

(Original)
Da wir uns für die Übernahme einer griechischen Landschildkröte interessieren, kontaktieren wir Turtle Island um uns über die Haltung und Vergabe aus dem Tierhelm zu informieren.

Frau Pfeffinger wie auch Frau Sukic waren sehr nett und bemüht - Frau Sukic nahm sich als Freiwillige viel Zeit, um uns am Telefon zu beraten und schaut sogar an ihrem freien Tag bei uns daheim vorbei, um den idealen Standort für das Gehege auszusuchen. Das Engagement ist riesengroß und wir freuen uns über die tolle Unterstützung. Man merkt,  dass den Menschen dort die Tiere wirklich am Herzen liegen. Dankeschön!

(Translated by Google) Currently closed due to renovation.

(Original)
Aktuálně z důvodu rekonstrukce uzavřeno.

(Translated by Google) An oasis for Schildi's... You can feel the love and mindfulness at Turtle Island - live & let live!!!!

(Original)
Eine Oase für Schildi's... Man spürt die Liebe u Achtsamkeit bei Turtle Island - Leben & leben lassen!!!!

(Translated by Google) Simply great 👍👍👍🐢🐢

(Original)
Einfach toll 👍👍👍🐢🐢

sources.snippet: Jedes Jahr im Frühling gibt es ein besonderes Schauspiel der Natur. Am Rosenhain blühen die Kirschbäume in wundervollem Rosa. Der Fotospot kurz unter dem Café Rosenhain bietet sich besonders an, um dieses Foto zu schießen.
sources.siteName: Graz - Das Stadtmagazin mit tollen Fotos und aktuellen Infos
sources.shortName: Instagrammable Graz: Die schönsten Foto Hot-Spots für Instagram Pics in Graz

reviews.reviewText: There is something like a motoric park,would say the kids are quite entertained,then there is this Rosenhain Café up on the hill-great service and tasty cakes, additionaly a small walk in the woods could also bei possible...i definitely recommend it

(Translated by Google) Beautifully located, are there often. In my opinion, swings and a hill are missing so that the children can go on the zip line alone...

(Original)
Schön gelegen, sind auch oft dort. Meiner Meinung nach fehlen Schaukeln und ein Hügel, damit die Kinder alleine auf die Seilrutsche können...

(Translated by Google) Nice playground, in the shade and not much going on.

There is a deduction for: Smoking in the playground, snooping around the benches and all the armchairs that are always standing around in the café.

(Original)
Schöner Spielplatz, im Schatten und wenig los.

Abzug gibt's für: Rauchen am Spielplatz, Tschickstummel rund um die Bänke und die ganzen Sessel die vom Café immer herumstehen.

(Translated by Google) Spacious, uncrowded playground. The forest next to it has become noticeably thinner as many trees have been felled, but the charm of the ambience is still somewhat present.

(Original)
Großzügiger, nicht überlaufener Spielplatz. Der Wald daneben wurde deutlich lichter, da viele Bäume gefällt wurden, dennoch ist der Charm des Ambientes noch einigermaßen vorhanden.

(Translated by Google) Very nicely designed playground in a beautiful natural setting. However, entire groups of children often use the devices.

(Original)
In schöner Naturkulisse sehr nett gestalteter Spielplatz. Oft belegen allerdings ganze Kindergruppen die Geräte.

(Translated by Google) I recommend it with a clear conscience, a beautiful playground between Cafe Rosenhein and the forest.

(Original)
Polecam z czystym sumieniem, piękny plac zabaw między Cafe Rosenhein a laskiem.

(Translated by Google) Nice playground for children but unfortunately a bit small

(Original)
Schöner Spielplatz für Kinder leider aber etwas wenig

(Translated by Google) Nice little playground. With a great forest right next door

(Original)
Schöner kleiner Spielplatz. Mit toller Wald gleich nebenan

placeMetadata.name: PRESS THE BUTTON Studio & Faces Graz

sources.snippet: PRESS THE BUTTON Studio & Faces Graz is a top-rated headshots studio in Graz, Austria, located at Sparbersbachgasse 22. With an impressive rating of 4.8 out of 5 stars based on 41 reviews, this studio has gained recognition for its outstanding services and unique, fun-filled photography experiences.Customers rave about the exciting and entertaining atmosphere at PRESS THE BUTTON Studio. It is described as a perfect place for group events or family outings, where everyone can have a great time together.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Graz Best Professional Headshot Photo Studios

reviews.reviewText:
(Translated by Google) Nice location with a variety of equipment to create wonderful memories. The staff is super friendly, the pictures are available quickly and in great quality.

(Original)
Nette Location mit vielfältigen Equipment, um wunderbare Erinnerungen zu schaffen. Das Personal ist super freundlich, die Bilder schnell und in toller Qualität verfügbar.
Fun event for groups or family!

(Translated by Google) Visited for the second time and as always an experience!
The children thought it was great.
The options for taking photos and the choice of accessories were very diverse.

(Original)
Zum zweiten Mal besucht und wie immer ein Erlebnis!
Die Kinder fanden es mega.
Die Möglichkeiten zu fotografieren und auch die Auswahl der Accessoires waren sehr vielfältig.

(Translated by Google) Super great concept. You can let your creativity run its course there.
Very nice and competent support and explanation from the lady on site.
The processing was also really quick. After less than 24 hours we had our photos.
I recommend it to everyone for everything, whether couples, families, children...

(Original)
Super tolles Konzept. Da kann man der Kreativität seinen Lauf lassen.
Sehr nette und kompetente Betreuung und  Erklärung von der Dame vor Ort.
Die Bearbeitung ging auch wirklich sehr schnell. Nach nicht einmal 24 Stunden hatten wir unsere Fotos.
Empfehle ich allen für alles, egal ob Pärchen, family, Kinder....

(Translated by Google) Rip off.. idea is really cool, and the photos turn out great. But sorry, you're already paying for your stay there anyway. And then another 200€ to browse for digital photos... In addition, they make a preselection from the pictures for you.

Even though we had booked for 40 minutes, they would have kicked us out after 20 minutes and we wouldn't have noticed. But yes, “oops, you’re right” I found it very hypocritical…

Okay, and since the answer is always: You can see the prices on the website and the employees edit the photos extensively,...
I criticize the concept. I don't think it needs any editing. The camera takes great photos anyway and that's just my criticism. You could offer a package that leaves out this part and only gives you digital, unedited photos. Would save money on both sides

(Original)
Abzocke.. Idee is echt cool, und die Fotos werden toll. Aber sorry, man zahlt eh schon dort für den Aufenthalt. Und dann nochmal 200€ zu blättern für Digitale Fotos… Dazu kommt dass sie für dich eine Vorauswahl aus den Bildern treffen..

Sie hätten uns auch obwohl wir 40 min gebucht hatten, nach 20 min schon rausgehaut wäre uns das nicht aufgefallen. Aber ja „ upsi da habt ihr recht“ fand ich sehr scheinheilig…

Okay und da ja immer geantwortet wird mit: Die Preise sieht man auf der Website und die Mitarbeiter bearbeiten die Fotos aufwändig,..
Ich kritisiere das Konzept. Ich finde es bräuchte keine Bearbeitung. Die Kamera macht eh schon so tolle Fotos und das ist dann eben meine Kritik. Man könnte ja ein Paket anbieten, dass diesen Part auslässt und man nur digitale unbearbeitete Fotos bekommt. Würde auf beiden Seiten Geld sparen

(Translated by Google) Exciting to experience with children, as a family, staff incredibly friendly and available at any time, BUT: You can only order photos digitally (and not exactly inexpensively),
to then work it out yourself... it's a shame, sending the originals straight away would be much more helpful/better...

(Original)
Spannend zu erleben, mit Kind, als Familie, Personal unglaublich freundlich und jederzeit erreichbar, ABER: Fotos kann man nur digital (und nicht gerade kostengünstig) bestellen,
um sie dann erst selbst auszuarbeiten… schade, Zusendungen gleich im Original wären deutlich hilfreicher/besser…

(Translated by Google) Recently had a shoot. It was very funny and can only be recommended.

Nice team, but the ground was freezing. Would recommend wearing nice shoes for small children. Barefoot photos were extremely uncomfortable for the adults. Children would get sick.
But I reported it back and my feedback was forwarded to Graz by the headquarters according to the email.

(Original)
Hatten vor kurzem ein Shooting. War sehr witzig u nur zu empfehlen.

Nettes Team, aber der Boden war eiskalt. Würde für Kleinkinder empfehlen schöne Schuhe anzuziehen. Barfußfotos waren extrem unangenehm für die Erwachsenen. Kinder würden krank werden.
Hab es aber rückgemeldet und mein Feedback wurde von der Zentrale laut Mail an graz weitergeleitet.

(Translated by Google) Super cool photo studio. For me, an annual visit is almost mandatory. It's so great when you're the photographer yourself. These “forced” poses are no longer necessary. The photos are well edited and look really great. A very small minus point is unfortunately it is relatively expensive. But as I said for once a year that's easy compared to other photographers.

(Original)
Super cooles Fotostudio. Für mich ist ein jährlicher Besuch fast schon Pflicht. Es ist so super wenn man selbst der Fotograf ist. Diese "gezwungen" Posen fallen weg. Die Fotos sind super bearbeitet und schauen wirklich toll aus. Ein ganz kleiner minus Punkt kommt dazu leider ist es relativ teuer. Aber wie gesagt für einmal im Jahr ist das leicht drinnen im Vergleich zu anderen Fotografen.

ops.insert: Contemporary floating structure featuring a café, theater & striking nighttime illumination.
First built in the 10th century, the hilltop castle overlooks the city & is accessed by a funicular.
Riverside contemporary art museum in amorphous blue building, with cutting-edge exhibitions.
Tours of 17th-century palace's stately rooms, featuring painted ceiling panels & landscaped gardens.
Concerts, opera & ballet in a baroque-style theater with an intricate red, white & gold interior.
Historical town center with cobblestone streets, iconic landmarks & architecture of various eras.
Built in the 15th century, this Gothic Roman Catholic cathedral is dedicated to Saint Giles.
This 17th-century mausoleum housing the body of Emperor Ferdinand II features stucco & frescoes.
Buzzy mall with fashion stores & a supermarket, plus a medical center, kids' play area & food court.
Built in the 15th century, this castle is known for its double-spiral staircase made of stone.
Landmark hilltop 13th-century medieval clock tower with a garden & panoramic town views.
Historical town square surrounded by medieval buildings & featuring a bronze statue of a punk.
Housed in an 1811-built armory, this museum displays the historic military hardware of the region.
Hip, modern cafeteria offering a daily self-service buffet of international vegetarian fare.
Landmark church & pilgrimage site atop Purberg Hill featuring elaborate baroque art & architecture.
Iconic double spiral staircase in the Burg known for its architectural beauty & historic charm.
Elegant, ornate Renaissance palace built in 1527 with arched windows & a courtyard of arcades.
Leafy oasis with a children's playground & landscaped walkways through planted flower beds.

Panoramic city views from a steep funicular railway carrying passengers up the Schlossberg hill.

data.title: The 44 most romantic places in Vienna

placeMetadata.name: Belvedere Palace

sources.snippet: The famous Kiss is Vienna’s most famous painting and a trip to the Belvedere Palace to see it is certainly one of the most romantic things to do in Vienna. Created by Viennese painter Gustav Klimt, The Kiss is displayed inside the Upper Belvedere’s galleries, which is also home to many other fabulous masterpieces. With a background infused with gold, the painting has an almost mosaic effect and it depicts a couple locked in an embrace in a meadow of flowers.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: Indulge your inner art enthusiasts with a visit to the Belvedere Palace, a magnificent Baroque complex that houses an impressive collection of Austrian art. As you admire the masterpieces, share your thoughts and impressions with each other, sparking lively discussions and deepening your emotional bond. Don’t miss Gustav Klimt’s iconic painting, “The Kiss,” which perfectly encapsulates the essence of your romantic getaway in Vienna.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Vienna: A Whirlwind Waltz of Love in the Imperial City

sources.snippet: This stunning palace complex is located between Belvedere Upper and Lower park, which features beautiful gardens that are perfect for a romantic stroll with your loved one. The palace, which was once the summer residence of Prince Eugene of Savoy, is a beautiful and historic building. Couples can take a tour of the palace together and learn about its history and architecture.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: The Belvedere Palace, split into the Upper and Lower Belvedere, is another architectural marvel. Originally built as a summer residence for Prince Eugene of Savoy, it now houses a stunning collection of Austrian art, including Gustav Klimt’s famous “The Kiss.” The gardens and fountains surrounding the palace offer a beautiful setting for a romantic stroll.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

sources.snippet: Arguably one of the most famous paintings in Europe, The Kiss is located in the Belvedere Palace. Easily one of the best places for couples to visit in Vienna, it was created by the skilled painter Gustav Klimt. You’ll find the painting within the upper galleries of the Belvedere which is also home to many magnificent artworks.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

sources.snippet: Another magnificent garden, through which you can stroll hand in hand, awaits you in front of the imposing Belvedere Palace. The large fountain in the middle of the grounds is a particular eye-catcher and invites you to linger, especially in summer. But the castle itself also exudes a romantic atmosphere with its baroque style.
sources.shortName: In love with Vienna

sources.snippet: The Schonbrunn Palace, Hofburg Palace, and Belvedere Palace are excellent examples of baroque architecture. Baroque style is known for the expression of grandeur and drama. Many buildings include grand open spaces, columns and intensity drawn from lighting.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

placeMetadata.description: Baroque, 18th-century palaces housing art from Middle Ages to today, with notable Klimt collection.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Belvedere Palace is a stunning example of Baroque architecture located in Vienna's Landstrasse district. It consists of two grand palaces separated by a beautiful French-style garden. Originally built as a summer residence for Prince Eugene of Savoy in the 18th century, it now houses an impressive art collection spanning from the Middle Ages to contemporary works, including a notable collection of Klimt paintings.

reviews.reviewText:
This is a must if you're in Vienna.
The inside of the palace (upper side) is very beautiful and it offers not only Austrian art but also contemporary art. In the lower side you can find a different exhibition, this time they had different close ups of the most important works of art they had in the museum.

Visiting Belvedere Palace in Vienna is a feast for the eyes, particularly if you appreciate grand architecture and historic structures. The palace itself is stunning, with intricate interiors and elegant layouts that make wandering through its halls a visual delight. Even with parts of the building under restoration, the charm and grandeur of the palace remain impressive.

The exhibition, however, is less remarkable. While it has its moments, it doesn’t quite match the awe-inspiring atmosphere created by the palace and its architecture. Art lovers may enjoy it, but for those primarily seeking a “wow” factor, it may feel underwhelming.

A practical note: the queues can be long, especially on weekends. Even if you buy tickets online, you may have to wait for a later slot; when we arrived, our online tickets only allowed entry three hours later. Planning ahead and booking well in advance is highly recommended.

The gardens are fantastic and free to explore. Locals often jog, run, or just relax there, and it's lovely to see artists drawing or people chilling. Overall, the views and grounds make it worth avisit!

Overall, Belvedere Palace is worth visiting for its architecture and historical appeal, but don’t set your expectations too high for the exhibitions.

The castle was awesome.  Likes the gardens as well . Should spend more time there but we had only 1 hour as . Too many things to see here in Vienna for sure .
Like the way everything is put .
Gardens are not fully blooming as of now

Excellent collection of paintings. Beautiful garden and view from Upper Belvedere to Lower Belvedere. Not to forget about the Famous Painting of Gutav Klimt, "The Kiss". Easy access via local public transport. If you brought ticket go directly to the main entrance.

Belvedere Palace was incredibly stunning! It is worth coming here while you are in Vienna. The grounds and palace are beautiful as you would expect. Where it really shines though is the inside. The art collection is absolutely incredible and is something you should not miss in Vienna. It is so amazing to come here and admire works of art and to learn about the history of that art, and the artists behind it. The kiss is the main draw of the Belvedere for many, it is much more beautiful in person than what you would expect. I would definitely recommend buying tickets in advance and coming in the morning is the way to go here because of the crowds.

p.s: In my case, i only went inside the main building, which is why it greatly influences my review of the place....
(words cannot seem enough for me to describe how great this place was and how it made me feel..)
I remember the first time i walked past the gates of this magical place...
I was stunned.
The Lower Belvedere (the smaller building to your right when you walk through the main gate) was just a great glimse reflecting the grace, delicacy and beauty of the main thing which was just above your view.
Making your way up, walking through the gardens, the power of the sphinxs making itself known around your every step ; finally reaching your end where you stood just in front of the building and getting sad that your eye cannot capture the whole view in just a gaze.
This was about the back of the palace, you get curious and start looking around until you get to the front of the building.
I can describe looking at the details of the scene was like looking at a perfectly decorated piece of cake you dreamed of getting for your birthday.
The inside is just a whole another story written and built on it's own.
A fairytale coming to life, bringing its glory to your step and senses....
The carved stone making you not feel alone, the painted walls feeling like home and the pieces of art having your breath taken away for seconds....
Visiting the palace overrall was such a fulfilling and calming experience for me and everytime i make my way back to the city of Vienna, this place will be always waiting for my next visit.

We visited the palace ground and the lower Belvedere. It is really beautiful from the outside. The inside exhibition is also good if you are art lover. We mainly went there to see Gustav Klimt’s famous painting “The Kiss”. It was very nice to see it in person after all the years of seeing pictures of it. The details of the art is wonderful. Definitely worth a quick visit. I would recommend getting the tickets ahead of time and planning. Make a whole lot of difference.

Build by Prince Eugene of Savoy  as a summertime residence,  transformed into an art gallery by Maria Theresa, the museum houses a lot of important artworks.
It's a beautiful building. The Marble hall is impressive, offering breathtaking views of the palace garden.
Many people come here for Klimt, but it offers so much more to see. The medieval gallery is small and very interesting. I would definitely suggest checking it out.
Buying tickets in advance is a good idea, as when you come without the tickets you might need to wait for couple of hours to be able to enter the palace. If that happens, go for a walk in the palace garden. Beautiful.

placeMetadata.name: Hofburg

sources.snippet: Explore this grand palace complex with your loved one and admire its stunning architecture, including the Spanish Riding School where you can watch performances by world-famous Lipizzaner horses!. Not only is the palace itself a beautiful and historic building, but it is also located in the heart of Vienna, one of the most romantic cities in the world. While at the palace, couples can take a leisurely stroll through the beautifully manicured gardens, admire the stunning architecture of the palace, and learn about its rich history.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: The Hofburg Palace, located in the heart of Vienna, served as the Habsburgs’ winter residence and now houses several museums and the Austrian National Library. The palace complex includes the Imperial Apartments, the Sisi Museum dedicated to Empress Elisabeth, and the Silver Collection, which showcases the opulent lifestyle of the Habsburg court.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

sources.snippet: You almost can’t visit Vienna and not see the Hofburg Palace. This impressive imperial complex was once the winter palace for the Austria-Hungarian royalty and is one of the most significant buildings in Vienna. It’s also one of the most physically appealing with its charming Baroque architecture and beautiful European style.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: No romantic trip to Vienna is complete without a visit to the Hofburg Palace. This architectural marvel and a key landmark in the city and is one of the best places to visit in Vienna. It was once the winter residence of the Austria-Hungarian royalty (you can imagine just from this how impressive it was!).
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

sources.snippet: Hofburg Palace is located close to the Parliament (5-10 minutes walking). It’s one of the most beautiful places in romantic Vienna. The entrance to Hofburg is located at the Sisi Museum.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna For Couples [With Map]
Romantic Things To Do In Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Habsburg palace complex with ornate, baroque interiors, imperial apartments & a silver museum.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Hofburg Imperial Palace, located in the heart of Vienna, is a grand complex that served as the residence and seat of power for the Habsburgs. This historic site, dating back to the 13th century, stands as a testament to the imperial history of the Danube monarchy. Today, it houses various institutions including the Austrian Federal President's office, museums such as the Sisi Museum and Court Silver Collection, and serves as an international conference center.

reviews.reviewText: Beautiful historical building in the central location. Really enjoyed our visit there. Nice park to sit and rest during the hot Summer weather. Love Vienna so much and will definitely be back and visit a few of the museums. Walking distance to other attractions, lots of shops, restaurants and cafes around.

Impressive imperial palace complex in the heart of Vienna. Rich history, grand architecture, and well-curated museums make it a must-visit. Allow enough time to explore the Sisi Museum and the Imperial Apartments.

We didn’t have enough time to go inside Hofburg Palace, but even from the outside, it’s incredibly grand and impressive. The architecture is stunning. The palace grounds are vast, with beautiful courtyards and statues. It’s a lovely area to walk around, and there’s so much to take in, even without entering the museums.

absolutely amazing! The history and grandeur of the place are incredible, and it's so much bigger than you expect. Walking through the imperial apartments and the Sisi Museum is a fascinating experience. It's a must-see for anyone visiting Vienna.
One of the most beautiful castles in the world situated in the middle of a large area of magnificent buildings and lots of history. Very impressive and a must visit.

Magnificent, and even more so at sunset, of course.
One of the top 5 places to visit in Vienna.
I particularly recommend the National Library, absolutely unique and unmissable.

Sisi Museum is definitely worth the money and time. There you learn fascinating history of the empress and some misconceptions are cleared up. The royal apartment tour is also interesting. Sadly the silver collection is not open. Book the ticket online to avoid waiting.

We paid to see the library, it was kinda nice to see some of the families books from afar. The library was nice and impressive but it’s so small. You can walk in and walkout in 10 minutes, an hour if you really take your time.

Not sure it was worth the time and money to stop to visit this place.

placeMetadata.name: Vienna State Opera

sources.snippet: Vienna is synonymous with music, so what better way to celebrate your love than with a night at the opera?. The Vienna State Opera, one of the world’s most renowned opera houses, offers a captivating lineup of performances that will leave you both spellbound. As the music swells and the singers’ voices soar, you’ll feel your hearts become one, bound together by the enchanting melodies.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Vienna: A Whirlwind Waltz of Love in the Imperial City

sources.snippet: Enjoy an evening out at this iconic opera house with your partner – it’s sure to be an unforgettable experience!. The Vienna State Opera House in Vienna is a great place for a romantic visit for a couple. The opera house is a stunning and iconic building, with its beautiful architecture and rich history.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: Vienna State Opera is often said to be the most impressive Opera House in Europe. What better way to show your loved-one you care, than to take them out for a memorable date to watch an incredible performance?. As well as the lavish class of the Opera House, the architecture of the building is sublime.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: For a very elegant and Viennese evening consider watching a show at the Staatsoper (Vienna State Opera), or one of the many other concert halls around the city. You can find listings for many shows on the tourism website events.wien.info (then filter by date).
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Vienna

sources.snippet: As one of Europe’s most awe-inspiring opera houses, visiting the Vienna State Opera is one of the most romantic things to do in Vienna. Plus, you can watch all sorts of performances here. From ballet to theatre to opera.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

sources.snippet: Hotel Park Villa is the ultimate romantic accommodation in Vienna for budget travelers. At Hotel Park Villa, breakfast is included and you can enjoy it on a quaint garden patio.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

placeMetadata.description: World-famous opera house offering major productions, original decor & multilingual guided tours.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Vienna State Opera House, also known as Wiener Staatsoper, is a world-renowned opera house that has been hosting major productions and guided tours. It is one of the largest and most magnificent theaters globally, with a rich history dating back to 1625. The current grand Opera House was constructed in 1869 and features a French Early Renaissance style.

reviews.reviewText:
if you're a fan of music, or even just beautiful buildings, the tour of the vienna state opera is a must-do. i wasn't sure what to expect, but it was really fascinating.
​it's a guided tour, so you go with a group and a guide tells you all the stories. they take you through the grand staircases and these incredibly ornate rooms like the tea salon and the marble hall. everything is so elegant and detailed, and it's wild to think that parts of the building had to be rebuilt after being bombed in world war ii. you see the original parts and the restored parts side by side, and it's a cool mix of history.
​the highlight for me was seeing the auditorium and the stage from different angles. you get to stand in the royal box and look out, and it makes you feel like you're royalty for a second.
​the tour is about 40 minutes long, and you get so many interesting facts and stories. they tell you about the famous composers and conductors who worked there. it's a really great way to appreciate the opera house even if you don't have time to see a full performance. it's a good idea to check the schedule online and book your tour in advance because they're really popular

It was our first opera.  It was amazing.  The story was interesting and very easy to follow the subtitles on the little screen in front of each seat.  The cast and Orchestra were extremely talented. The opera house is magnificently beautiful.  It's well worth a visit.

If you’re in Vienna, you definitely have to visit the  State Opera House! I’ve been to opera houses in the U.S., but most of them are relatively new compared to this one. The level of detail here is incredible – every corner feels like a work of art, from the ornate ceilings to the grand staircases.

The performance was equally stunning. The orchestra and opera singers were on another level – so powerful and moving that even though I’m not usually into classical music, I loved every minute of it. This was truly an unforgettable experience and one of those bucket-list items you absolutely have to check off when visiting Vienna.

Phenomenal. Did I say that yet? Did I say phenomenal? I sat in the balcony and I could see everything. I recommend if you can to get front row seats spend the extra €50 it was just phenomenal. The music was excellent and they did some fun things at the end. Did I say phenomenal?

The English Guided Tour of Vienna was well organized, with many other language tours choreographed outside of the stage.

However, I felt they (Crowd control) became too rigid and lost their purpose when dealing with tourists. They separated families, unlike in the USA, Canada and almost anywhere, where people will switch out individuals if they have fixed people to tour, here, they don't understand and sounded rude.

The Opera is a historical early modern place of networking and pompous and continues today, and also, it is maybe the most inefficient way of doing stages and keep the jobs.

That said, enjoyed the seeing The Opera, our tour guide was excellent,most importantly 30 second seating at the biggest and the best, king's box.

Taking in an opera was on my bucket-list for Vienna. The venue is vintage and grand, reminiscent of the bygone days of pomp and finery. I had made a point to dress up, dropping off my tourist garb in the cloak room, but many did not. The opera I attended was sold out so I was lucky to get standing tickets in the Stehparterre section, which still offered good views. It was a mesmerizing evening where I enjoyed music masterpieces, angelic voices, while surrounded by rich Viennese history. It took some planning to score tickets but it was a worthwhile endeavor for me.

Beautiful building and an amazing experience. The atmosphere is elegant and the staff is very professional. Even if you’re not into opera, it’s worth visiting for the history and stunning interior. A highlight of Vienna!

Beautiful beyond words..pl book ticket for guided tours online, they fill up fast.. though they sell offline tickets 30 mins before the tour from the opera house( but these are unsold tickets so not sure if you would one, but you may try your luck). Arrive at the venue 15 mins before the time..it is a must visit place in Vienna.. highly recommend this one

placeMetadata.name: Danube Tower

sources.snippet: On the Danube Tower, lovers have the opportunity to get a little closer to heaven. The tower restaurant and tower café convince with culinary delicacies and offer the perfect ambience for an evening for two. The overwhelming 360-degree panoramic view of Vienna (especially at night) rounds off the location and ensures magical moments come true.
sources.shortName: In love with Vienna

sources.snippet: Take your loved one to the top of this iconic tower for breathtaking views of Vienna’s skyline and beyond!. Enjoy dinner at its revolving restaurant or take in some live music at its rooftop bar – either way, you’re sure to have an unforgettable experience here!. The Danube Tower in Vienna is a great place for a romantic visit for a couple.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: If we wanna talk about romantic things to do in Vienna, we need to talk about its cuisine. The capital offers countless options for romantic dining. From the Turm-Restaurant on top of the 252 m high tower, you can see all of Vienna above the clouds.
sources.shortName: 🗝 Most romantic places in Vienna - Ideas

sources.snippet: This viewing platform has a revolving restaurant at 170m (and coffee house) featuring regional produce. Special “top of romance” packages, for example, ensure a window seat and include sparkling wine and red roses.
sources.shortName: Romantic dinner locations in Vienna

sources.snippet: The Danube Tower offers a unique setting for a dinner where you can enjoy a spectacular view of the city. Here you can find out everything you need to know about a romantic dinner at the Danube Tower:
sources.shortName: Romantic dinner above the rooftops of Vienna at Danube Tower
Romantic things to do in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Iconic tower opened in 1964, with open-air & covered observation terraces, a restaurant & a cafe.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Danube Tower, also known as the Donauturm, is an iconic landmark in Vienna that opened in 1964. As the tallest structure in Austria at 252 meters, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Danube River from its observation deck at 150 meters. The tower is part of the Danube Park, which was transformed from a former rubbish dump into a park with various attractions and facilities for both children and adults.

reviews.reviewText: We always visit observation towers where possible to gain an overall view of the location we are visiting. The Danube Tower is to the side of a large area of structured park which is on the other side of the river to the main city centre - we reached it on the Metro, followed by a 10-15 min walk, but it was worth it. The lift up to the observation deck had a glass roof, so you good watch the ascent and the view from the deck was great - if a little windy!!!  We then visited the cafe for a drink or two to watch the scenery, before eating at the revolving restaurant on the floor above. We really enjoyed the experience and the view and it was worth the effort to get there. Recommended.

We had an incredible experience visiting the Danube Tower, the tallest structure in Austria at 252 meters. The fast lifts take you up to a 360° viewing platform.

Once you reach the top, the view stretches far beyond the city's limits, offering a truly breathtaking experience.

We highly recommend booking tickets online in advance.

We visited the Danube Tower on Saturday, August 2, 2025, around 8:30 PM on a stormy evening and it turned out to be an unforgettable experience. It was cloudy and dramatic at first, then later, it poured.

We took a peaceful walk through Donaupark on the way in, beautifully green, calm, and spacious. Then came the real highlight: the view from the top of the tower. As the storm rolled in, we watched the clouds and lights shift across the city skyline. One local even told us he had never seen such heavy rain in Vienna before, which made the moment feel surreal and almost cinematic.

The kids absolutely loved the slide and went on it twice. I worked up the courage to try it too, after a little fear moment that lasted a good 3 to 5 minutes 😅. The staff member at the slide was incredibly kind and patient with both the kids and with me.

We didn’t dine at the restaurant as the storm got stronger, we felt it was safer to head back to the hotel. While the person checking tickets could have been a bit more welcoming, everything else was smooth and enjoyable.

The only downside was the toilets. They were not clean and had a strong unpleasant smell definitely an area that needs more attention.

This spot is still perfect for families, a beautiful mix of nature and city views all in one place. Definitely a must visit when you’re in Vienna.

The Danube Tower is a must-see in Vienna! The panoramic views from the top are absolutely breathtaking, offering a full 360° look over the city, the Danube River, and beyond. We enjoyed a delicious coffee and came at the rotating restaurant with an unforgettable view. There is also a slide from the upper deck on 160m height, but the ticket is extra. The whole experience was smooth, relaxing, and well worth it with a lot of photo opportunities on an outdoor and indoor panoramic deck. A perfect stop for anyone visiting Vienna!

The tower is located on a beautiful peninsula. The walk was pleasant. I didn't buy tickets in advance, but I recommend buying them on the official website (if you go there with several people, you can save a couple of euros). There was no queue, so you could go up straight away. The elevator has a mirrored ceiling, so it was clear as we went up. The view of the city was magical. I also went down the slide, it was worth it. The place is really worth a visit. As for the staff, they were all very nice and pleasant, even though I didn't speak German perfectly. So highly recommended!
This was a really great place to visit, the view of the city from their is breathtaking. It is a bit expensive to go up but it is well worth it. I would definitely recommend the visit

Climbing the tower is an attraction in itself. The view is breathtaking when the weather permits. The restaurant is very good and artisanal. It rotates slowly and allows you to appreciate the 360° panorama throughout your meal.

Visited the Danube Tower — absolutely breathtaking! The cafe and restaurant slowly rotate, so while sitting at your table, you get a full 360° view in just 30 minutes. The scenery is stunning: the city, the Danube, and green landscapes all around. Such a unique and memorable experience! 🌍✨

placeMetadata.name: Schönbrunn Palace

sources.snippet: Begin your Viennese romance with a visit to the magnificent Schönbrunn Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage site that once served as the Habsburgs’ summer residence. Meander through the lavish Baroque rooms, whisper sweet nothings in the intimate corners and imagine yourselves as royalty from a bygone era. Don’t miss the enchanting gardens, where you can steal a tender kiss amid the blooming flowers and regal fountains.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Vienna: A Whirlwind Waltz of Love in the Imperial City

sources.snippet: Vienna is covered with breathtaking parks, but at the top of the list are the  gardens of Schönbrunn Palace. Among the most romantic places in Vienna, the gardens of Schönbrunn Palace are open to the public at no cost whatsoever. They are about a square kilometer in size with plenty of space to take a relaxing walk and observe the fountains, flowery parterres, and green alleys.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Vienna: Discover the Musts

sources.snippet: This stunning palace is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Vienna and is a must-see for couples. Take a romantic stroll through the gardens and admire the beautiful architecture of this Baroque masterpiece. The palace, which was once the summer residence of the Habsburgs, is surrounded by beautiful gardens that are perfect for strolling hand in hand.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: Hands down, the list of romantic things to do in Vienna for couples won’t be complete without mentioning the Schonbrunn Palace. It’s the best tourist attraction in the city!. We book a City Discovery tour that included visiting a palace, a romantic dinner and a classical music concert (going to one of the concerts in Vienna was high on our bucket list).
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna For Couples [With Map]

sources.snippet: One of Vienna’s most iconic landmarks is Schönbrunn Palace, a grand residence built by the Habsburgs to rival Versailles. With an astonishing 1,441 rooms, this sprawling palace and its surrounding park are a breathtaking introduction to Vienna. It is highly recommended that you book a tour to appreciate the palace’s grandeur fully.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

placeMetadata.description: 18th-century summer palace with tours of lavish rococo ceremonial rooms, plus gardens with a maze.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Schönbrunn Palace is an 18th-century summer residence that offers tours of its opulent rococo ceremonial rooms and lavish gardens with a maze. The palace boasts beautiful Baroque and Neo-Classical architecture, reflecting Vienna's rich history as the town of Habsburgs and Maria Theresa. It is Vienna's most visited attraction, featuring 45 luxurious state rooms, ceremonial halls, and private apartments once inhabited by Empress Elisabeth and Emperor Franz Joseph.

reviews.reviewText: Amazing palace, we took the full access. The garden was breathtaking, and the palace was pretty.  The art collection in the palace was stunning. Definitely enjoyed it. I would recommend buying tickets online, as they are strict in entrance timing .

The palace is really gorgeous. The museums inside palace and certain portion of the garden can be visited only with tickets. But we did not buy any ticket and directly visited the garden behind the palace. The garden is really humongous and beautiful.  The center has beautiful flowers followed by fountain. Also beautiful place to click a photo or two.

As the garden is so huge I saw some people there for their morning stroll. Hey Perplexity, rewrite it and adjust the tone and grammatical errors.

The palace is truly stunning. Access to the museums inside and certain sections of the garden requires a ticket, but without purchasing one, it’s still possible to visit the garden area behind the palace. The gardens are vast and beautifully maintained, with vibrant flowers at the center leading toward a lovely fountain. The scenery makes it an excellent spot for photos. Given the sheer size of the gardens, it’s common to see people enjoying a morning stroll there.

This palace is beautiful. It is large, so definitely keep some time aside so that you can see it at your own pace. If you like to listen to everything then this will take a significant amount of time. If you want to quickly look around, read few things and stroll around, it will take an hour or so. Be sure to get into the palace itself by 11am otherwise it can get crowded. I would recommend seeing the gardens and park behind the castle first thing in the morning and then follow it with the castle tour inside. I would highly recommend purchasing the ticket ahead of time. You will not be able to take in your backpack but they have a safe area to store them. The palace is located near the station so it is an easy walk. If you are elderly then it might be difficult to walk to and around the whole castle grounds. This palace is worth the visit.

Very nice experience visiting this Palace. It was educational, although we did the audio tour and there were many basic facts which seemed to be missing and I might therefore recommend a guided tour. Plan on spending at least an hour on the grounds, as they are beautiful and enormous.

We didn’t go inside the Schönbrunn Palace, but just strolling around the beautiful grounds was more than enough. My boyfriend and I enjoyed walking through the gardens, hiking up to the Gloriette for amazing views, and even wandering into the nearby forest trails. Peaceful, scenic, and a lovely way to spend time together — we loved every moment!

A very interesting site to explore. What I really liked is that the audio guide provided by the museum focuses on the most important information and is very easy to follow. The gardens are also beautiful.

If you want to get a glimpse of how royalty lived, Schönbrunn Palace and its gardens are a must-see! This is one of favorite visits in Vienna. The Baroque architecture is absolutely magnificent, and the grounds are just as impressive. The massive garden stretches behind the palace with the Gloriette perched on the hill, offering one of the best views in Vienna. My tip – start your visit at the Gloriette first and snap some photos of the entire palace and gardens from the balcony. Then, take a leisurely stroll down the hill, through the fountains and perfectly manicured paths, and make your way to the palace entrance.

The inside tour requires a ticket, but it’s worth every euro. The lavish interiors and rich history give you a true appreciation of the opulent lifestyle of the royal family. We were in awe of the intricate details and grandeur of each room – it really transports you back in time. For even more context, check out the Netflix series The Empress before or after your visit – it adds another layer of appreciation. A must-do when in Vienna!

The grounds and gardens are absolutely massive and very beautiful! They've done a wonderful job making most of it wheelchair accessible, with a few minor exceptions. The interior is gorgeous with lots to see. You could spend all day in the gardens alone. The hedge maze alone takes about 45 minutes! The zoo is also here, and a playground for kids.

placeMetadata.name: St. Stephen's Cathedral

sources.snippet: The gothic revivalist St Stephens Cathedral is one of the most important religious buildings in Vienna. St Stephens suffered many times throughout various conflicts, but never so much as during the last days of World War 2, when fire from street fighting engulfed the rooftop and severely damaged parts of this stunning stone church. After reconstruction the cathedral was reopened and today is a symbol of stability in Vienna.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

sources.snippet: Known for its incredible buildings and architecture, Vienna’s churches are just as impressive as her palaces!. Standing nobly in the heart of Stephensplatz, St Stephen’s Cathedral is not just the most important church in Vienna, but the whole of Austria as well. Plus, the rather splendid Pummerin, is the second-largest free-swinging chimed church bell in all of Europe.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: This iconic cathedral is one of the most recognizable landmarks in Vienna and is a great place to take your loved one for a romantic evening out.
