Admire the stunning Gothic architecture and take in the breathtaking views from atop its tower. St. Stephen’s Cathedral is a beautiful and historic building that is sure to impress.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: St. Stephen’s Cathedral is one of Vienna’s most beautiful buildings. Located on Stephansplatz, St Stephen’s Cathedral is not only the most significant church in Vienna but also all of Austria. Plus, it contains the second-largest free-swinging chimed church bell in Europe.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

placeMetadata.description: Medieval Roman Catholic place of worship with an ornate spire, catacombs & a treasury museum.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: St. Stephen's Cathedral is a medieval Roman Catholic place of worship in Vienna, Austria. It features an ornate spire, catacombs, and a treasury museum. Visitors can explore the cathedral to admire world-renowned works of art and church utensils for a fee. The catacombs house the remains of Austrian emperors and are accessible only to guided tour groups for an additional cost.

reviews.reviewText:
A Must-See Cathedral in Vienna!
This is the most important and iconic cathedral in the city — absolutely massive and breathtaking. Entry to the main part is free, though some side sections require a small fee.
I highly recommend climbing to the top — it costs €6.50 and involves 343 steps. It may sound like a challenge, but it’s not as hard as it seems, and it’s totally worth it! The views over Vienna from the top are spectacular. There's also a small souvenir shop up there, which adds a nice touch to the experience.

There is an elevator on the other side if you prefer that, but many say the staircase side offers better views (I didn’t try the elevator myself). Plus, climbing up and down is a fun little workout.

Super recommended — a must-do in Vienna!

A breathtaking masterpiece—St. Stephen’s Cathedral is the soul of Vienna. Its soaring Gothic spires, dazzling tiled roof, and awe-inspiring interior leave you speechless. Whether admired from the bustling square or explored within, it’s an unforgettable encounter with history, faith, and beauty.
We didn’t go inside but the view from outside was amazing.

A famous landmark the city of Vienna is known for.
Located at the center of this big beautiful city; representing century long artistic heritage and curiosity.
The main tower and it's beauty can be seen from kilometers away....but then when you're right in front of it, it simply takes your breath away.
The building itself is quite adjusted to it's surroundings as they were built around it throughout the years.
Then when you get to the interior, under the dim lights you get to see just how perfectly detailed everything is.
A true masterpiece, important enough to represent a city like Vienna ,in the history of Cathedral Building.

Really impressive building, you must go up in one of the towers or in both of them for great views of Vienna. The inside of the cathedral is very impressive too. The catacombues tour is interesting also.

St. Stephen’s Cathedral – A Beautiful and Tall Church
St. Stephen’s Cathedral is very big and very beautiful. The tall tower is easy to see from far away. The outside has many little details carved into the stone, and the roof is colorful with patterns that look like a blanket made of tiles.
Inside, the church feels quiet and peaceful. There are big stone columns, high ceilings, and colorful glass windows that let in pretty light. The whole building shows how talented the builders were, even hundreds of years ago.
It’s a great place to see if you like old, special buildings.

St. Stephen’s Cathedral, or Domkirche St. Stephan, is the spiritual and architectural heart of Vienna. With its towering Gothic spire and colorful tiled roof, it stands as a stunning symbol of the city’s heritage.

The south tower, rising 136 meters, offers breathtaking views of Vienna for those who climb its 343 steps. The cathedral’s roof, made of over 230,000 glazed tiles arranged in striking mosaics, is a visual highlight and an engineering feat.

Inside, the mix of Gothic, Romanesque, and Baroque styles reflects its long and layered history. From vaulted ceilings to intricate altars, the interior inspires awe. The catacombs below offer a haunting yet fascinating look into Vienna’s past.

St. Stephen’s is more than a monument — it’s an active place of worship and a witness to Austria’s key historical moments. It survived World War II bombings and became a symbol of Vienna’s resilience and cultural pride.

Whether you're admiring its facade, exploring its interior, or attending a concert, St. Stephen’s Cathedral is a must-visit landmark that captures the essence of Vienna.

St. Stephen’s Cathedral is the heart and soul of Vienna. With its stunning Gothic architecture, colorful tiled roof, and iconic south tower, it's a must-see landmark. Step inside to admire centuries-old altars, catacombs, and breathtaking stained glass. Climb the tower for panoramic city views or just soak in the spiritual and historical atmosphere—an unforgettable experience for any visitor.

A beautiful cathedral with several paid options to see more. We were able to enter the back area of the church for free, and enjoyed the organ music during Sunday mass. We paid €7 to climb the south tower, which was a bit crowded but enjoyable. We also paid €7 to take the catacombs tour, which we thought was awesome. Definitely a great church to visit and spend a little time.

placeMetadata.name: Prater

sources.snippet: This large park is perfect for couples looking to spend some quality time together outdoors. Take a romantic walk through its lush gardens, ride on its iconic ferris wheel, or enjoy some delicious food at one of its many restaurants and cafés. The park, which is located just next to the city center, is a beautiful and peaceful oasis that offers plenty of opportunities for couples to spend quality time together.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: Vienna's Prater is an iconic amusement park and a picturesque spot for a romantic wedding proposal. Capture moments of joy among vintage carousels and modern rides, or find tranquility in the park's green spaces. As night falls, the Prater transforms into a magical setting, perfect for an unforgettable proposal.
sources.shortName: Vienna - Local Lens

sources.snippet: Prater public park is one of the most romantic places in Vienna for couples. There is always a lot going on there, although it’s getting really busy in the summertime. Attractions available all year round include:
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna For Couples [With Map]
Romantic Things To Do In Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Large park with old-time amusements, including a landmark giant wheel dating from 1897.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Prater is a historic public park in Vienna that has been open to the public since 1766. It features a long promenade, traditional amusement park rides, a planetarium, and a museum showcasing its rich history. The park also houses children's rides from the '20s and '30s that survived a fire in 1945. One of its most iconic attractions is the Prater Ferris Wheel, offering an unforgettable view of Vienna from above.

reviews.reviewText:
A Perfect Blend of Nature and Fun – A Park for Everyone!
This park truly offers the best of both worlds. On one side, you’ll find a peaceful and charming green area with a pond full of ducks, perfect for a relaxing walk, biking, or even a picnic under the trees. It's an ideal spot to unwind, enjoy nature, or just let the kids run free while you sit back and take in the serene atmosphere.

On the other side of the park is a huge amusement area that’s packed with games and attractions for all ages. From thrilling rides to fun games for kids, there's something here for everyone. We tried the giant Ferris wheel, which gave us amazing views — definitely a highlight! The ride cost €6 per person, and it was well worth it. Keep in mind that while entry to the general park is free, each amusement game or ride has its own separate fee.

There’s also a fantastic section within the park filled with restaurants! you can visit day or night. It’s a great area to relax after a walk or a fun ride, and it's equally enjoyable for both adults and kids.

All in all, this park is a must-visit. Whether you're looking for a calm afternoon in nature or an exciting day of fun, it has it all in one place!

Prater at night is a whole vibe—the lights are dazzling, the energy is high, and the place is filled with young people enjoying themselves. The atmosphere alone makes it worth a visit. There are tons of rides and amusement games, from family-friendly options to seriously thrilling ones.

I only managed to try the Ferris wheel. The ride goes for three rounds, and the view at the top is beautiful, but honestly, I’d recommend going for the newer Ferris wheel instead—it feels like the better option. I didn’t get to play the games, but walking around, you can tell it’d be a really fun spot if you had the time.

One thing to note: most rides and games are individually priced. This works if you know exactly what you want to try, but if you’re hoping to experience everything, it might add up quickly. I didn’t come across a proper “all-access” pass, though maybe one exists. Still, it’s an exciting place to wander, soak in the vibes, and jump on a few rides that catch your eyes.

I went there with my friends during our trip in Vienna and frankly there are a lot pf options of rides you can take. If you are adventurous and you like different types of rides this is the place. They even had go kart and pony rides for children and restaurants with food.
We had a blast! The Vienna looping made me think I was going to die. It's really fun to come with a large group. There's a wide variety of things to do. I even won a Hello Kitty!
Heaps of rides and attractions! We easily spent over 5 hours here and had a great time. There's roller-coasters, the sling shot, dodgem cars, ghost trains, fun house labyrinth and loads more to do.

Prater is one of the must-visit spots in Vienna. It’s a huge park with both green spaces and an amusement park area, so you can enjoy nature and fun rides at the same time. The highlight is definitely the Giant Ferris Wheel, which gives you a beautiful view over the city.

It’s a great place for a walk, cycling, or just relaxing on the grass. Families, couples, and solo travelers will all find something to enjoy here. There are also plenty of food stalls and restaurants around, so you can easily spend a whole afternoon or evening.

A perfect mix of relaxation and entertainment in the heart of Vienna!

It s the same good quality Prater we Eastern euro immigrants know from the 90s , clean , fun , clean washrooms. However in a rainy day that that day was , 90 PERCENT of attractions closed. Not fair for tourists that were were and we traveled from poor land of the Balkans.

Spectacular!!! Nothing else like it in the world (that I have ever seen). Absolutely fun. Gives a feeling of going back to an era of amusement parks and fairs - with all the thrills of modern rides. Lots of games and delicious food too.

placeMetadata.name: Volksgarten

sources.snippet: To name the most romantic places in vienna we need to mention the Volksgarten (“peoples garden”). It  is a nice place in Vienna and especially worth a visit in late spring or summer. During this time 1000 of roses bloom in competition and want to be examined - if that's not romantic, then we don't know what is!.
sources.shortName: 🗝 Most romantic places in Vienna - Ideas

sources.snippet: You may also consider a romantic stroll through Volksgarten or the Schonbrunn Gardens. Volksgarten doesn’t close, so it’s the perfect setting for a sunset stroll. The most romantic part of Volksgarten is the summertime Rose Garden.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

sources.snippet: This was the first public park in the city, and it is famous for its beautiful gardens with over 4,000 rose bushes. There are tons of potential Vienna proposal spots all throughout the park!. Propose and Capture here!
sources.shortName: Vienna - Local Lens

placeMetadata.description: Strauss & Lanner once played in this manicured public park with temples, fountains & rose gardens.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the heart of Vienna, the Volksgarten is a stunning public park that beautifully marries history and leisure. Originally designed as a private garden for archdukes, it has welcomed visitors since 1825 and is now part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site Historic Center of Vienna. The park features manicured landscapes adorned with temples, fountains, and vibrant rose gardens.

reviews.reviewText:
One of the most beautiful and peaceful parks in Vienna.
Whichever time of the day,  this is the perfect place to take a break and enjoy the so many roses growing here.
Just take a look at these pictures.

An impressively lovely gardens right along the inner city of Vienna. Everything is precise, orderly and beautiful.

There’s a section where rose bushes are donated by people and it makes for a colorful pop along the walking path.

We came on a rainy day but this would be a lovely spot to sit and spend more time when the weather is better. I loved how precise everything was set up here, the grounds are very well attended to and cared for.

It is one of the must visit place I stayed there for almost two hours.It was a really good place to relax.There are places to sit and enjoy beautiful greenery all around, the fountain and statues looked great, and the nearby monuments were truly mesmerizing.

Large garden with lots of roses. Water mists on to cool down tourists under the strong sun. Bathed in sunlight on the bench, my eyes linger on roses in full bloom, while heavy music roars from the club — a strange harmony of beauty and chaos
Perfect place during the spring season. Flowers are in bloom and they smell really good. It gets crowded a bit so better to visit early. Park is free, with lots of benches.

We went during the winter. I really wanted to like the garden but it just does not look as good as expected. But I’m sure it should look better in spring/summer when all the grass are green and the flowers are blooming.
Nice little park with a lot of sitting place right in the centre of Vienna. It's especially beautiful in May and June when the roses are blooming. It's usually crowded, too.

a little bit of nature is a nice change of pace. volksgarten is a public park right in the middle of everything, between the hofburg palace and the parliament building, but it feels like a little oasis. the main attraction for me was the rose garden. there are thousands of rose bushes with all different kinds of colors and scents. if you're there in late spring or early summer, when they're all in bloom, it's just magical. it's the kind of place where you just want to sit on a bench, breathe in the air, and watch the world go by.
​besides the roses, there are a few cool things to see. there's the theseus temple, which looks like a mini greek temple, and it's kind of a funny contrast to the ornate imperial buildings around it. and if you're a fan of empress sissi, there's a beautiful memorial to her in a quiet corner of the park. it's a really peaceful spot.
​the best part is that it's completely free to enter. it's the perfect place to take a break from sightseeing. it’s open from early in the morning until late at night, so you can easily pop in whenever you're in the area

placeMetadata.name: Schönbrunn Zoo

sources.snippet: It’s one of my favourite things to do with my fiancé and I’m sure you’ll agree that it’s certainly a romantic day trip. Tiergarten Schonbrunn, or Vienna Zoo, is located on the grounds of the Schonbrunn Palace. It’s actually the oldest zoo in the world and was originally created as an imperial menagerie to house the Emporer’s collection of exotic creatures.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: In fact, it’s one of my favorite activities, especially when I’m with my fiancé. Going to the zoo is a wonderful date idea and what better way to do it than to visit the oldest zoo in Europe?. Within the Schönbrunn Palace, Vienna’s zoo is a fantastic place to visit with your other half.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

placeMetadata.description: 500 species of animals, including giant pandas, Siberian tigers & elephants, in 18th-century zoo.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Schönbrunn Zoo, located in the garden of the Schönbrunn Palace, is a historic 18th-century zoo that offers a diverse collection of over 500 animal species. The zoo is known for its child-friendly programs and activities, including free children's tours on Sundays and special Christmas workshops and activities during the holiday season. As the oldest zoo in Europe, it boasts a rich history dating back to Empress Maria Theresa's nature-loving husband, Francis Stephen.

reviews.reviewText:
I absolutely loved my visit to Schönbrunn Zoo! It’s beautifully maintained, with a wide variety of animals and plenty of space to explore. The trail takes around 3 to 4 hours, so I highly recommend bringing water, wearing comfortable clothes, and good walking shoes, especially since some paths are uphill.

Highlights include the giant pandas, the tropical house, and the aquarium. It’s a perfect place for a day out, and being located next to Schönbrunn Palace makes it easy to combine both attractions. Highly recommended!

Schönbrunn Zoo, nestled within the magnificent grounds of Schönbrunn Palace in Vienna, truly stands out as a world-class experience. It's not just a zoo; it's a beautifully maintained haven where both animals and visitors can thrive.

One of the most remarkable aspects of Schönbrunn Zoo is its exceptionally calm and well-organized atmosphere, even during peak times. Whether you visit on a busy holiday, a bustling weekend, or during the height of summer, the flow of visitors is managed so effectively that you never feel overwhelmed. This allows for a much more relaxed and enjoyable experience, giving you ample space to observe the animals without feeling rushed or crowded.

The enclosures are consistently well-maintained, reflecting a deep commitment to animal welfare. It's evident that the animals are content and comfortable in their environments, which is a testament to the zoo's dedication to providing excellent living conditions. This attention to detail creates a positive and enriching experience for the animals, and consequently, for the visitors who can see happy, healthy creatures.

For those looking to refuel, the food and drink options are plentiful and of good quality, with surprisingly reasonable prices that won't leave you shocked. You can find nice spots to grab a bite or a drink all throughout the zoo, ensuring convenience and variety during your visit.

The variety of animals is truly amazing, offering a diverse collection from across the globe. From exotic species to beloved classics, there's something to fascinate every age group and interest. Beyond the animal residents, the zoo also boasts a lot of nice architecture throughout, adding to the aesthetic appeal and making your stroll through the grounds an even more delightful experience.

In summary, Schönbrunn Zoo is a must-visit in Vienna. Its tranquil environment, superb animal care, excellent amenities, diverse animal collection, and beautiful architectural elements combine to create a truly memorable and highly recommended day out.

amazing zoo, clean and fun to walk around. saw many types of animals here and there was many viewing points for each enclosure ensuring you can see each animal. had a great time here, and the surrounding area is beautiful.

We are very satisfied with our first visit to the zoo. There is a great variety of animals that could be seen there. Vienna zoo is known as one of the best in Europe and also worldwide and it is true. We had very good time and spent more than 5 hours walking around and exploring. It is a must visit if you plan a trip to Vienna!!!

Schönbrunn Zoo is a fantastic place — one of the oldest in Europe and truly worth a visit. I really appreciated the clearly marked path that guides you through the zoo in about 2–3 hours. Just make sure to grab a map at the entrance, or you might get a bit lost. The zoo isn’t overwhelming in size, and beyond the fascinating animal exhibits, the architectural layout is also quite interesting.

A highlight for me was the treetop walk, built around a former bomb crater from WWII. It’s now fully overgrown and serves as a peaceful space where you can observe local urban wildlife like birds and small mammals. Despite visiting on a hot weekend, it was still possible to avoid crowds and enjoy the visit comfortably.

The penguins were a real show — especially since you can watch them walk and swim up close through glass walls. There are several species, from emperor penguins to smaller ones. The polar bear was also a standout — a rare sight in European zoos, and this one was especially active and engaging.

There are lots of family-friendly attractions, like a ground-level tunnel to watch small mammals like ground squirrels from their eye level. We didn’t see many monkeys, but overall, the experience was great.

Tickets are on the pricey side, but it’s worth spending a day here. You can bring your own food and enjoy a picnic at one of the tables, avoiding the expensive food stands. On hot days, it’s also good to know there are many water refill stations around. Highly recommended!

Had a great time at the zoo today. Very well laid out with a varied range of wildlife, birds, reptiles etc. it topped 32 degrees today. Drinking water was essential and the large number of water fountains very much appreciated.

We had a wonderful visit to the world’s oldest zoo! It’s surprisingly large—plan for around 3.5 to 4 hours to see everything. There’s a great variety of animals, and we especially loved seeing the pandas, polar bears, tigers, and elephants. A well-organized and enjoyable experience for all ages!

Was fun to see the penguins being fed. Staff was very friendly and nice. Many animals to see. Recommend for family’s to spend time with, but be prepared for walking since the trail can take up to 4 hours, so don’t take people who don’t like to walk, if you want to see the whole park.😂😉 As all amusement parks and zoos the food and drinks are a bit pricier than outside the park. Overall I recommend seeing this zoo!

placeMetadata.name: Viennese Giant Ferris Wheel

sources.snippet: The Giant Ferris Wheel at Prater Amusement Park offers another fun opportunity in Vienna for couples. It was originally constructed in 1897. At that time, and for decades after, it was the tallest Ferris wheel in the world.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

sources.snippet: The Giant Ferris Wheel is THE landmark of Vienna and there is enough time for togetherness on a ride in the legendary red gondolas. Seeing Vienna from above alone is worth the climb to the top.
sources.shortName: 🗝 Most romantic places in Vienna - Ideas

placeMetadata.description: Fairground attraction rebuilt in 1945, with wooden cabins offering dining & an exhibition.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Viennese Giant Ferris Wheel, also known as Riesenrad, is a famous attraction located in the Wiener Prater. Originally opened to the public in 1766 by Habsburg Joseph II, this former royal hunting ground quickly became a popular entertainment hub for locals. The Ferris wheel was built in 1897 and rises to 65m, offering visitors stunning views of the city during its 20-minute rotation.

reviews.reviewText:
The Great Wheel From Vienna, a wonderful symbol of this city. It's definitely a must for those coming here. The views are stunning and the tickets are worth it. This is the best thing from Prater! 🙌
I definitely recommend it! ✅️🌟👍🏻

Very cool kind of pricey Nice to be able to see the city from such a vantage point. Was disappointed the way they rush you in and out of the car and so many people on each, also that they do not stop you at the Apex and was only taken around for one circle. Overall was a good experience recommend doing it once.

I haven't been on many Ferris Wheels so I don't have a lot to compare this one to but I really enjoyed it. The cabins are big and spacious and they don't stuff them full of people so there's plenty of room to move around and get a good view as it goes around. You'll be able to take some great pictures of Vienna and the panoramic view is spectacular. It was a windy day so there were some points where the cabin swung back and forth which may be scary for some people. If you're afraid of heights it's probably not the best choice but for everyone else it'll probably be worth it. The price is €14.50 for a single ticket.

Super slow. Not much of a view. Just worth going as it’s the oldest. They really don’t invest to make it a fun memorable experience. Many cable cars are blocked for dinner service , but no one knows how to book this dinner service and the price. But in advance no line tickets.

In order to see the view from above I would recommend to ride a Ferris wheel. There’s enough space inside . I bought a Vienna pass and it was included in this pass . We even have a nice picture from the whole family before the ride . Some pictures are taking from above .

Gorgeous sunset views from atop this beautiful Ferris wheel.  You ride within large cars that are all enclosed where you can sit or walk around sharing the different views with other riders.  It’s quiet, smooth, solid and feels very safe.  Highly recommend this experience.  Easily purchased my ticket at the ticket desk inside the building below behind the restaurant (a cool dry Saturday evening in May.)  During the summer it might be better to buy online to avoid a long wait. Before going up you get to see a beautiful one-room display of very artfully made models of the park and its history. You can walk through as fast or as slow as you desire.

Excellent Austrian service. The gentleman at the ticket station with Turkish sold tickets and open the doors tot he wheel with ok customer service. Then there were the beauty of the Vieanna wheel above beautiful Vienna. Beautiful pics, nice atmosphere, safe place, clean surroundings, good English skills in the service staff.

Wonderful views across Vienna from large, sturdy wagons.
Yes, it's a tourist trap, but not without merit.
We timed it well, but do plan ahead - it looks like the queue often gets frustratingly long at peak times (sunset).

placeMetadata.name: Sigmund Freud Museum

sources.snippet: A post shared by Sigmund Freud Museum Vienna (@sigmundfreudmuseum). A fascinating insight into the father of psychoanalysis – the apartment Sigmund Freud lived in and worked out of from 1891 until the Nazis forced his departure in 1938. His daughter returned much of the original furniture and many of Freud’s possessions, allowing visitors today a glimpse into the man.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

sources.snippet: The Freud Museum is one of the best places to visit in Vienna!. It’s a must-see for psychology lovers and philosophers.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

placeMetadata.description: Museum dedicated to the life & works of the father of psychoanalysis, housed in an elegant building.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Sigmund Freud Museum is a tribute to the life and work of the renowned father of psychoanalysis. Housed in an elegant building not far from Vienna's historic Hofburg district, this museum offers a glimpse into Freud's personal and professional life. Visitors can explore his former practice and private quarters, which served as the family home for nearly five decades.

reviews.reviewText:
I have been to the Freud Museum both before and after the refurbishment. Before, it appeared to be small but cozy, and only after the recent refurbishment, more rooms can be opened to the public, thanks to the beautiful work from the architect.

I very much disagree with many of the negative comments complaining the place is nearly empty - it is indeed true that not many original belongings are left to show, but this is NOT because the museum does not want to, it is because they are not there anymore.

In June 1938, Freud and his family left for London due to the National Socialism situation in Germany/Austria, taking as much as they can. As a consequence, when Freud died later, his London house was turned to a museum too.
Having said these, it is in principle perfect if one can visit both, first the one in Vienna then in London, also to experience the progression in history.

But this cannot be a reason to give low reviews to the one in Vienna.

And if you think about it, Berggasse 19 is the place where Freud wrote all his famous book, saw nearly all his patients, and the place where magic had happened. This place can be more intense, if you value the space, the moment, even though it appeared empty.

That said, it is appreciated that not everyone visits here has this level of background knowledge, but the museum has done their job to state that there is the London one for those who are more keen to see these personal/historical items.

Wonderfully leisurely perusal of all rooms, all displays. An illuminating visit. Just seeing some of the lukewarm, or negative reviews. Best to ignore. If you’re interested in psychoanalysis, if you’re interested in Freud, if you’re interested in the intellectual and cultural vitality of a bygone Vienna, you will find the museum as we did: fascinating.

Very interesting to learn about Freud. But you should be patient to read texts about him and his work rather than seeing exposed materials which are limited. Anyways I think visiting this museum is something to do for general culture. Please don't bring your kids since it might be boaring for them

A very interesting museum in Vienna! I appreciated this so much esp as a professional working with children. Been reading about Freud for years and it’s amazing to see his actual place and belongings. There are a lot of interactive areas too. Bought a coaster from the shop.

Interesting museum, not much to see as it is mostly empty with many showcases of Freud's belongings and handwritings. Price is fair for what it offers so if interested in learning a bit more about Freud and seeing his old place you should visit without very high expectations.

the museum is a piece of history and well worth a visit...especially for those people who thought they knew him and his family. we enjoyed our time. You can walk room by room and you will read the history and see the artifacts of the time. Unfortunately, all the walls have been painted over, so it is just a shade of white and there is no furniture in any spaces.

It was an intimate museum. Love the part where they play a long video of his daughter introducing some videos shot back in the days. Feels closer to the whole family after watching. Staffs were very nice too.

Highly recommend a visit.
It was wonderful to be in the apartment were Freud did his work. Very spacious and well worth the 20 euros. A nice coffee shop at the ground floor, coffee was great.

placeMetadata.name: Café & Restaurant Motto am Fluss

sources.snippet: One of the most beautiful restaurants in Vienna and the perfect place for a date. Motto am Fluss is located along the Danube Canal and here you’ll be presented with a great menu, romantic ambience and fantastic service. If you plan to go here make sure you book a table in advance, especially if visiting around Valentine’s Day, the Christmas season, or on a weekend.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Vienna

sources.snippet: Motto am Fluss is a trendy restaurant/cafe/bar located right at the Vienna channel, built in the shape of a ship - and THE place to be if you are in the neighbourhood or
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Dining Restaurants in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Stylish, all-day venue for local & global cuisine in an iconic boat-like building, with canal views.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Café & Restaurant Motto am Fluss is a stylish and iconic venue located in a boat-like building with stunning canal views. The restaurant offers a delectable all-day menu featuring both local and global cuisine. Guests can enjoy a delightful brunch experience, complete with an array of delicious options such as All Day Breakfast Sandwich, soft-boiled eggs with breadsticks, sweet potatoes, avocado, pickled radishes, and homemade Nougatcreme.

reviews.reviewText: We discovered Motto am Fluss while walking around looking for a place to eat, and it turned out to be our best experience in Vienna! From the service to the food to the overall atmosphere, everything was spot on. Even though the place was packed and we didn’t have a reservation, they still managed to give us a second-row seat with a great view. The table was super comfortable and spacious, which made the experience even better. Special thanks to Phelix, both waiter and chef, who was always smiling, welcoming, and made us feel right at home. The only downside was the dessert, which didn’t match the quality of the rest of the meal. Still, highly recommended!

Great place, pretty classy. Get the All Day Big Boy Breakfast Sandwich. It was quite pricy at €16 but it was worth it. The best thing about this place is the amazing atmosphere when the sun is out. If you know you are coming on a sunny day, make a reservation to sit outside in the shade. You will experience the definition of atmosphere. Places like these will make us come back to Vienna.

Great food that tasted exquisitely and was presented immaculately. €165 for 2 people spent. Was a little too warm by the window but it is summer. Nice to have a steak that was cooked exactly as wanted. If we visit Vienna again we will surely eat here again. Recommended to reserve a table ahead of time.

The location of the restaurant and cafe was pretty nice. By the river and right in the heart of city.

We tried their breakfast menu which was okay. It wasn’t super! Yet it wasn’t bad either.
Service is quick and staff were friendly and attentive.

It was a Saturday so a bit busy yet we didn’t wait and got seated right away.

All in all, the atmosphere was worth it.

This place is recommended on various guides and by various people. We reserved a dinner for 6:30 PM and we arrived at the opening at 6. Was not a problem to get a table next to window as we asked for. The waiter was very good and helped to make some choices between the options we had for food. Also he recommended a good local white wine for our fish. What I appreciated ( and I recommend people traveling from other countries or continents to do - verify where you travel and what is the local food and people culture ) was the focus on client wellbeing . Example: food takes time to be served ( thanks good is cocked and not microwaved ) and the waiter asked us if we are ready for main dish or we want to wait a little and enjoy view and discussion.
Regarding the food - is a real gastronomic restaurant , I enjoyed the fish and chips revisited and the gazpacho as starter. If you are not in rush, if you understand the restaurant is an experience and not a need to eat, if you accept the local “cold” people style then go here and enjoy the view of Danube Channel.
One mention - they have bar, terrace and restaurant - my dinner was in the restaurant.

Amazing atmosphere and great view!
If you want to spend an evening with good drinks, lively atmosphere, breeze from water, I recommend Motto. It is a bit pricey, so be prepared to give some cash.

The location is a former cruise ship, and the vibe is accordingly great!

I recommend reserving a place in advance
Very cozy restaurant right at the Donau. The staff was friendly and attentive. I had the breakfast sandwich which tasted good besides the fact that the avocado has had its best times.

the restaurant is in the boat so its has a very beautiful scene and vibe. food was little pricey but the portions were big and water & bread with butter was gifted. so it’s worth it for special occasions. it was so tasty too. service was also nice

placeMetadata.name: Lower Belvedere

sources.snippet: The setting itself is romantic enough, with all the finery of the Upper Belvedere Gallery in Prince Eugene of Savoy’s summer palace. And the painting adds to the mood, with a sensual explosion of colour set against a shimmering backdrop of gold leaf.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna
Romantic things to do in Vienna

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lower Belvedere is part of the stunning baroque complex that also includes Upper Belvedere, connected by a beautiful garden. It houses Gustav Klimt's renowned masterpiece, The Kiss, and features an extensive art collection spanning from the Middle Ages to contemporary pieces. Visitors can enjoy diverse exhibitions such as the impactful Dali - Freud showcase and thought-provoking modern tree exhibition.

reviews.reviewText: After the palace, we walked through the garden and found that there is another museum as we didn’t know there was another one. But we were this went in and it turned out to be a very cool museum with some rather unconventional work.

Lower Belvedere in Vienna is a charming spot that offers a lovely, more intimate experience compared to its grander counterpart, Upper Belvedere. The palace features beautifully preserved Baroque architecture, and the interiors are quite elegant. Highlights include the Marble Hall, the Golden Room, and the Hall of Grotesques, each with intricate designs and a rich history. The palace also hosts special exhibitions, adding a bit of variety to the visit. The surrounding gardens are peaceful and perfect for a stroll. While it may not have the extensive collection of its bigger sibling, it's definitely a worthwhile stop for anyone interested in Austrian art and Baroque architecture. Overall, a solid four-star experience!

Although it's smaller than the Upper Belvedere, my visit was incredibly rewarding and fulfilling. There was a special exhibition centered around the works of Gustav Klimt and Egon Schiele, which exceeded all my expectations.

Seeing famous works like Klimt's "Water Serpents I" and "Judith" up close was a truly moving experience. The exhibition also offered a deep dive into Egon Schiele's artistic world through his various drawings and paintings.

What impressed me most was the feeling of these vibrant and revolutionary artworks breathing new life into a historic palace. There was a wonderful sense of the past being re-energized and revitalized, which I found truly fantastic.

The compact size of the exhibition space is actually a plus, as it allows you to appreciate each piece deeply without feeling rushed. I highly recommend it for anyone interested in Viennese Modernism!!

Nice museum, visited the interesting exhibition here on the reconstruction of lost Klimt masterpieces. The huge paintings had been commissioned for the ceiling of the main hall of the University of Vienna, but they were considered pornograhic and grotesque, and Klimt sold them to a private collector instead. In 1945 they were destroyed when retreating nazis set fire to the building they were housed in. Google helped to reconstruct the colours on the basis of old black and white photos.

The museum itself is much smaller than the Upper Belvedere. There was also a collection of medieval art
Beautiful exhibitions going on at the moment. Ranging from Medieval art to Modernism. The Klimt one is a must see.

Book this online in advance and include the Upper Belvedere for a full afternoon of art. There are special exhibits here but the exhibit on Klimt's painting techniques, which includes several of the collection's paintings, is really worth the price of entry.
2025 jun. Now the building from one side is renovating, all fountains not working, there is no flowers... beautiful, but a bit disappointed.
Beautiful spot but the museum is over priced 🤔

placeMetadata.name: Naschmarkt

sources.snippet: This vibrant market is full of delicious food stalls that are perfect for couples looking to enjoy some delicious local cuisine together!. Located in the heart of the city, Naschmarkt is a vibrant and lively market filled with a wide variety of food, drinks, and other goods. Couples can stroll through the market together, trying different foods and drinks and taking in the sights and sounds of the city.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

sources.snippet: Naschmarkt is Vienna’s largest and most popular street market. It’s one of the best things to see in Vienna for free!. Since there’s no cost for admission.
sources.shortName: 17 Romantic things to do in Vienna for couples

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Naschmarkt is a bustling open-air market with two distinct lanes. One side is filled with casual dining spots, while the other offers high-quality produce and gourmet products favored by renowned chefs for their culinary creations.

placeMetadata.name: horse-drawn carriage tours

sources.snippet: A Fiaker ride through Vienna’s historic centre offers a nostalgic and romantic way to explore the city. These traditional horse-drawn carriages, with their velvet and brass fittings, provide a charming experience. Consider a ride through the Innere Stadt, passing landmarks such as St. Stephen’s Cathedral and the Hofburg Imperial Palace.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Vienna: A Honeymoon Guide

sources.snippet: Capture a view of this magnificent Baroque city during a romantic horse carriage ride. Get the feeling of riding in a time machine back to the 19th century while holding hands with your loved one. Book your horse carriage ride with a starting point at St. Stephen’s Square and travel along the boulevard known as the Ring.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Vienna: Discover the Musts

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vienna's horse-drawn carriage tours, also known as fiakers, are available at various stands throughout the city such as Stephansplatz, Michaelerplatz, Albertinaplatz, Petersplatz & Volksgarten. These charming rides offer a unique way to explore the city's landmarks and can even include a private dinner experience for those seeking an extra touch of romance or luxury.

placeMetadata.name: RUSH Swimming

sources.snippet: One of the lesser-known things to do in Vienna, but certainly not one to be overlooked are Vienna’s outdoor pools. Most of the summer pools are open from mid-May to September and certainly offer a refreshing escape from the hot summer heat. Schönbrunner has a delightful open-air pool that was artfully restored in the 1920.
sources.shortName: 11 Romantic Things to Do in Vienna for Couples in Love

sources.snippet: An often-overlooked gem in Vienna is the city’s outdoor pools. Typically open between mid-May and September, these pools offer a great place for a wild swim. There are several pools across the city.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 12 Surprisingly Romantic Things to Do in Vienna Austria

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: RUSH Swimming is a popular choice for swimming lessons in Vienna, offering outdoor pools that are open from mid-May to September. The school has received praise for its supportive and flexible booking system, with Sandra being particularly helpful. Coach Ana Krolo is highly regarded for her effective teaching techniques and ability to quickly identify and correct mistakes. The school's classes have been commended for their competence, engaging atmosphere, and the rapid progress made by students.

reviews.reviewText:
I am in vienna for one month so I decided to enroll my kids here so swimming classes.
I was a bit hesitant at first because of some of the reviews. But after the third class with Coach Nastya my son started swimming. She is great and my son and daughter love her. And the lady responsible for setting up the timing and letting us in is very nice!
Thank you 💖
Professional swimming lessons: Anastasia, the trainer, is friendly, patient, and highly skilled. She provides personalized guidance, ensuring a supportive and motivating learning environment.
I am really happy with the private swim training I arranged for my daughter. Sara is an excellent teacher! My daughter was able to make a lot of progress in a very short period of time.

I learnt how to swim from scratch with Sara and sometimes Nastja. Very friendly, patient and knowledgeable coaches! I can now swim breaststroke and free style pretty well and I am now learning backstroke.

Nastja has been amazing in regards to training us from the basics. I am happy with the progress although I still need more practice to be quite more regular. I would definitely go for more swimming courses offered by RUSH in the future.

Nastja is a super - couch 😊 Super helpful and easy to follow! She keeps motivation at a high level, and time flies. Had a problem breathing in the water, and it was solved already after the first training, without me noticing it! Simply brilliant 😄 Will come back!

The coaches are nice and helpful.
They also speak several languages except German.

'' very good!'' I am having swimming classes at RUSH Swimming and I could not be happier with the lessons and the school. Sandra is very supportive and helps me booking and rescheduling my classes whenever needed. I have my lessons with coach Ana Krolo and she is the best coach ever. Her teaching technique is super effective. We quickly found my mistakes and Ana can immediately tell me what to do to correct it. She utilizes every minute of the lesson to give me best training possible. My goal at the beginning was to learn enough so that I can save myself but I am now not only can swim but I enjoy swimming very much. If you want to learn how to swim from a world class swimmer, Ana is the coach.

placeMetadata.name: Vienna City Hall

sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Massive municipal building built using some 30 million bricks & now hosting balls, markets & events.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Vienna City Hall, also known as Rathaus, is a massive municipal building constructed with around 30 million bricks. It hosts various events such as balls and markets. The 19th-century neo-Gothic tower of the Rathaus stands at an impressive height of 103 meters, making it a prominent feature in Vienna's skyline. The building houses government offices, a city library, and over 1500 rooms.

reviews.reviewText: Vienna City Hall (Rathaus) becomes pure magic during Christmas! The grand façade, already beautiful, is transformed with lights and decorations that make it feel like a winter fairy tale. The famous Rathausplatz Christmas Market adds to the charm, with dozens of stalls offering handcrafted gifts, mulled wine, and delicious treats. The ice skating rink and carousel create a cozy, festive atmosphere perfect for families and couples. Even if you’ve seen other Christmas markets, this one feels special with the stunning backdrop of the City Hall. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Vienna during the holidays!

We visited the City Hall during the Christmas market, and it was one of the most wonderful Christmas markets we’ve ever experienced. The atmosphere was colorful and lively, filled with festive energy.

There were plenty of food stalls offering a variety of delicious treats, along with charming craft shops showcasing unique handmade items. It truly created a magical and memorable experience, a perfect way to enjoy the holiday spirit.

We visited during New Year's Eve and it truly was like a fairy tale land. Everything was meticulously made. Prices were about the same everywhere in the city. There were many areas and options for all ages.

Vienna City Hall, or the Wiener Rathaus, is a stunning Neo-Gothic building that serves as the seat of the local government. Its tall spire and detailed façade make it one of the most iconic landmarks in Vienna.

When I visited, I only saw it from the outside, but it was during the winter season, and the square in front of the City Hall was transformed into an impressive ice skating rink. It wasn’t just any rink—it was large, beautifully set up, and full of lively energy. Definitely a great spot to visit, even if just to enjoy the festive atmosphere around this magnificent building!

This neoclassical building represents the city of Vienna in such an authentic way; it makes you realize you are in the city where classicism rules over modernism.
Hosting local events, markets, shops and much more; this city hall is like no other.
Surrounded by so many more Viennese treasures, you really shouldn't miss the opportunity to see this masterpiece.

I call it the HEART of AUSTRIAN 🇦🇹 culture. From the different Balls to wining,  dinning and dancing 💃🏽……..it’s always a great time in there. Visit Vienna & check out on the different events that happen in Vienna’s City Hall

Vienna city hall is the town hall of Vienna, Austria, located in the Innere Stadt on the Rathausplatz, off the Ringstrasse. The Gothic Revival building was designed by Friedrich von Schmidt and constructed between 1872 and 1883. It houses the offices of the Mayor of Vienna, as well as the city and state government. It one of most interesting thing in Vienna and one of most beautiful building in Europe

This Neo-Gothic City Hall must be the most beautiful city hall I have ever seen anywhere.  The building is outstandingly intricate and looms over a garden where during Christmas time they hold a Christmas Market for the joy of Viennese people and tourists alike.

placeMetadata.name: Rathausplatz

sources.snippet: Enjoy some live music or take part in other events held at this large square located near City Hall. Rathausplatz in Vienna is a great place for a romantic visit for a couple. Located in the heart of the city, the square is a popular destination for couples looking to experience the vibrant and lively atmosphere of Vienna.
sources.shortName: 12 romantic sightseeing attractions in Vienna for couples 2022

placeMetadata.description: 19th-century park with statues, mature trees & fountains, plus summer cinema & winter ice rink.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Rathausplatz is a 19th-century park featuring statues, mature trees, and fountains. It offers various activities such as a summer cinema and a winter ice rink. Adjacent to the Vienna City Hall, this area is surrounded by significant landmarks including the Austrian Parliament Building, the main university, and the Neo-Gothic Votiv Church.

reviews.reviewText:
Wow, what a beautiful place! The building itself is stunning, and the best part was that there was a Film Festival 2025 happening when we visited. It really lit up the whole area – it felt like a fair!
They had installed a large screen right in front of the Rathaus building, and the atmosphere was incredible. There were so many food and drink stalls offering cuisine from different places. Aperol had its own little corner – their drinks were great too!
The area was so lively. We first went during the day and loved it so much that we went back again in the evening to enjoy the atmosphere. It was even more crowded in the evening, with so many people around. A musical movie was playing on the giant screen, and the whole place was buzzing with energy.

Such a great place for people to socialise. Various events take place here throughout the year. The town hall building is huge and very beautiful.
There are lots of eateries and bars here that you can enjoy.

A nice place to visit at night in Vienna. Film festival was held here June to end Aug, free entry. Lots of food stall and drinks at the courtyard, together with the music makes it like a carnival. Great place to socialise and appreciate Vienna at night.

Visited the Rathauplatz at 9pm on a Tuesday night in July and was overjoyed to discover a live televised performance of the Elizabeth musical that started at 21:00. The musical tells the dramatic and tragic story of Empress Elizabeth of Austria (known as Sisi). The tunes were beautiful, catchy and melodic; the actors' performance and costumes were simply outstanding.  What a treat on a balmy July night!

Historic site
Offers food options in the evening
Hosts movies, concerts for public
Has mobile restrooms
Is very safe
Is connected to public trams
A must visit site in Vienna’s 1st district
Go there with your friend during key moments - summer concerts, Christmas festivals, football games etc.

I always visit town halls in big cities. The architecture of these buildings are always admirable. In many bigger cities in Austria it is the most beautiful places, but Vienna is Vienna😎🇦🇹🇦🇹🇦🇹🇦🇹🇦🇹🇦🇹🇦🇹Too many beautiful places to visit😃Still one of them!!!👍🏻👀⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
A beautiful building surrounded by a great public space. Visited the other day and the screen was set up in front for a film festival, but we enjoyed the atmosphere with the food and drink vendors

Beautiful place, especially during summer with the film festival. Lots of food stalls ranging from korean to latin american food, drinks and cocktails and free seats to enjoy some films and concerts! Perfect summer night

placeMetadata.name: Das LOFT

sources.snippet: A few of the best options include Das LOFT bar and lounge, Lamée Rooftop bar, and Skybar at Steffl. These bars would be great for dates and if possible I would recommend trying to reserve a table.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Contemporary setting for innovative haute cuisine, with city views through floor-to-ceiling windows.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Das LOFT is a trendy restaurant offering innovative haute cuisine with stunning city views from its 18th-floor location at the Sofitel Vienna Stephansdom. The 21,500-square-foot illuminated ceiling by Swiss artist Pipilotti Rist adds to the contemporary setting. Despite strict building codes, this space offers 360-degree panoramic vistas of Vienna's skyline.

reviews.reviewText:
Came here on my birthday for the set meal by the window. View was amazing, started before sunset and after sunset it only got better!

The food was outstanding quality from start to finish, I particularly enjoyed the steak! The service was incredible and they couldn't of been nicer! When making my reservation I had to give my date of birth, which they obviously read because to my surprise at the end of my meal they presented me with a little surprise birthday cake!

My wife and I had a wonderful meal here with a truly amazing view and excellent service. Everything was spot on, which surprised us since in the United States most places with a view like this would not pay much attention to the quality of the food. Here it’s clearly different, they pay attention to everything. Highly recommended!

What an incredible experience! The view over Vienna was simply breathtaking, not to mention the wonderful delicious plates which were reserved. A shout out to Max, our waiter, who made the experience even more enjoyable through his explanation and professionalism. Highly recommended!

We made a reservation to celebrate our wedding anniversary and had high expectations for both the food and the overall experience.

On the positive side, the restaurant is beautiful—stylishly decorated, with very comfortable chairs and amazing views of the city. At night, the rooftop lights create a stunning atmosphere. The service was friendly and attentive, which we really appreciated.

When we made the reservation, we were asked if we were celebrating something—I mentioned our anniversary—but unlike someone at a nearby table who got a little birthday cake, we didn’t get anything at all. It’s not that we expected much, but it did feel like we were kind of overlooked. When you’re spending that much on a special night out, it’s a bit disappointing to see others being acknowledged and not you.

We also chose the wine pairing menu. Some of the wines were delicious, while others weren’t really to our taste. If you enjoy discovering new wines from small producers, it’s a fun experience—the explanations were interesting too. But if you want to be sure you enjoy every glass, you might be better off choosing your own wine.

As for the food, it was a bit hit-and-miss. The pork belly, the bread and butter, dessert, and the sides were all really good. But the main issue was with the steaks. We ordered one medium rare and one medium well, and although they were served cut in different sizes (which made us think they’d been cooked accordingly), both turned out to be well done. That was disappointing. On top of that, the sauce was overly salty—luckily the creamy gnocchi and cauliflower on the side helped balance it out.

All in all, it was a nice evening with beautiful views and good service, but I’m not sure I’d go back. For the price, the food didn’t quite live up to expectations.

Although the window-side tables and seats were empty, guests were pressured to order a minimum of €140 per person. This practice does not align with the standards of a professional restaurant that claims to be high-end and made the experience unpleasant. All the prime window tables remained empty, while the management simply responded, “Our restaurant is always fully booked,” without offering any flexibility or proper service.

The view is stunning, absolutely! We have visited multiple times and the service is kind, friendly, and welcoming. The food is good and they have interesting rotations in their menu each season. Unfortunately, each time we found awful restroom conditions. Considering that this is supposed to be a “higher-end” restaurant and experience, going to wash your hands definitely gives the impression that you are at a public restroom - smell from the top of the stairs, toilet paper on the floor, and I won’t mention more. Incredibly disappointing and a simple way to ruin the overall image of the place.

Elegant place to eat to, I loved the view and the food. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

I ordered the octopus, it was very soft and the sauce was creamy and delicate. The drinks were well mixed, we were very satisfied about everything❤️❤️❤️❤️

Would have given 4.5 for the beautiful view and the ambience, but leaving a 3 star due to unexpected charge on the final bill, which was disappointing to see from a high-end restaurant.

In addition to what I ordered,  they brought me a sourdough bread with some spread initially, which I didn't ask for and since everyone was getting it, I thought it was complementary. They didn't tell me otherwise. I was surprised to see they added 7 euros for it on the final bill. When asked, the waiter just brushed it and said it is normal at their restaurant. I have never seen such a thing anywhere else. I feel they should have been
upfront about it and not just force something upon their customer.

Food tastes decent.

Natalie at the reception was very helpful in accommodating a last minute reservation and has wonderful manners.

placeMetadata.name: Austrian National Library

sources.snippet: The Austrian capital is an ideal destination for couples, with a traditional coffee culture that invites you to slow down, and a National Library so beautiful you’ll feel like you’re in your own love story. The architecture is a thing of beauty, too, with Baroque, Renaissance and Gothic styles to take in via a tram tour around the Ringstrasse. Vienna is home to a belt of cultural institutions, too, from opera houses to museum complexes; whatever type of couple you are, you’ll find your fit in Vienna.
sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Baroque State Hall with ceiling frescoes housing National Library including papyrus & globe museums.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Austrian National Library, also known as the Prunksaal, is a magnificent Baroque State Hall adorned with intricate ceiling frescoes. It is located in Vienna and houses the Habsburg Court Library, which was commissioned by Emperor Charles VI in 1716. The library's stunning architecture features marble, gold, and hardwood elements that create a grand atmosphere. Visitors can explore the extensive collection of over 12 million books while admiring the opulent interior.

reviews.reviewText: I mean - so stunning!!!! Huge Beauty and the Beast vibes!! What I would give to climb a few of the ladders and crack open the books! A highlight of our trip for sure and would highly recommend! We used our Vienna City Passes to get in and I’m so glad we did!!

One of the most beautiful and magical bookstores I’ve ever visited! The whole time I was there, I felt like I was dreaming. I highly recommend visiting it, especially for book lovers. My only note is that it gets very crowded it would be much better if they introduced time slots and allowed groups in at intervals. That would improve both the experience and the flow of the visit. Still, it’s absolutely worth it!

Worth any money to see… I have visited many libraries around the world and this is one of the most fabulous. And as a geographer, the globe is absolutely amazing. The paintings even the stairwell are all beautiful. I highly recommend visiting. Danke !

This baroque library is among the most beautiful libraries in the world. It's been the Austrian emperor's library and contains over 200'000 books. Besides the books, the architecture is stunning, especially the ceiling paintings. Audio guide (on your own smartphone) available. Photo and video taking is permitted.

One wonderful room stacked full of books. Really surreal and has some nice detail about Austrian history through the media as well.

Worth a visit simply to stand in awe of this beautiful and historic interior.

Like a dream. It was one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to. As a tourist, I was here to take in all the beautiful aesthetics. I'm so glad I came by. Was a last min decision. The tour guide recommended it and I came right by and bought an entrance ticket.

The Austrian National Library in Vienna is a stunning place full of old books. Its grand State Hall with golden shelves and colorful ceilings is breathtaking. The rooms feel like stepping into history. It’s a quiet spot perfect for book lovers. A must-visit for anyone in Vienna!

I absolutely loved the place. While I do agree that the price is a bit much (though I had a student discount), I enjoyed it enough to say it's worth it. The place is beautiful, I was in awe. It also has an exhibition with significant points in Austrian history. That includes old papers and media from each time, which I found very interesting. There was no line for tickets, and while it was a bit crowded, it was alright. I recommend a visit!

placeMetadata.name: MuseumsQuartier Wien

sources.shortName: Romantic things to do in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Restored area of historic & modern buildings containing many of the city's finest museums.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: MuseumsQuartier Wien, also known as MQ, is a captivating blend of historic and contemporary architecture housing some of the city's most impressive museums. The complex, once the Imperial Court Stables designed by Fischer von Erlach, now showcases thousands of 20th and 21st-century masterpieces.

reviews.reviewText:
Museum of Vienna. Really nice place to visit.

The staff are also nice, the toilets are clean and they have a lot of exhibitions inside, must see.
I was there briefly, just to walk around that plaza. I felt that the place has so much history and tradition that I need to visit it again and spend more time going to all the museums.

Amazing cultural spot in Vienna with world-class museums, modern art, and lots of space to relax. Great mix of history, design, and vibrant atmosphere—perfect for both art lovers and just hanging out.
Definitely a must to see in Vienna. Wonderful architecture, very rich in culture and art. Lots to do and to see there. You may need more than a full day to visit all museums and exhibitions.
Must see. Free entrance for all up to 19yrs. Others pay 18€. It is reasonable, and of course the architecture is amazing. I hope you enjoy it. Paid parking 4.50/hr in the garage below.
Such a beautiful creative space with galleries, cafes and bars all in one place! A must visit and more than once!

This is such a cool and creative space, totally different vibe from the older, classic museums nearby, but in the best way. It’s this awesome mix of art, design, and chill hangout spots. The buildings themselves are a blend of old and modern, which gives it a really unique character. You can explore contemporary museums like Leopold or MUMOK, or just relax in the courtyard with a coffee and people watch. It feels young, artsy, and full of energy, but still very Viennese.
Realky interesed to learn about the Vienna Secession movement, started in 1897, and the artists that broke away to be instrumental in the "Art Nouveau" - including Gustav Klimt! Visit - its a treat!

placeMetadata.name: Brasserie Palmenhaus Wien

sources.snippet: This place is a great place to take a break when you tour the city. No matter if lunch, coffee, drink or dinner - it is always a success!. Food is great, service good - yo
sources.shortName: Best Romantic Dining Restaurants in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Former tropical house overlooking a large pond with upscale dining & drinking options.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Brasserie Palmenhaus Wien is a stunning former tropical house located in the Burggarten, offering upscale dining and drinking options. Originally built as a summer greenhouse for the Emperor in the 19th century, it now houses an impressive array of exotic plants. The restaurant serves traditional cuisine and brunch-style dishes, including sandwiches, cereals, fruits, and a special Austrian breakfast.

reviews.reviewText:
Delicious desserts and perfect drinks!
Stopped by for a sweet treat and was blown away. The desserts were rich, flavorful, and beautifully presented—definitely made with love. The drinks paired perfectly, whether you’re into coffee, wine, or something in between. Great atmosphere and friendly staff made it even better. Highly recommend!

Had breakfast at Palmenhaus Vienna and honestly, what a vibe!
The place is absolutely stunning – a glasshouse full of greenery right in the middle of Burggarten, with sunlight streaming in and a view that makes you feel like you’re in a mini botanical paradise. Breakfast was tasty, fresh, and beautifully served, but I have to say the portion felt a bit small for the price. Still, the unique atmosphere, the elegant yet relaxed vibe, and the whole experience totally make it worth it. Perfect spot for a cozy morning, weekend brunch, or just coffee in a dreamy setting. Highly recommend if you’re visiting Vienna

This was my first taste of Austrian food and also the one that stuck with me the most. I tried many more Austrian restaurants during my trip and I always found myself comparing those places to this one.

The atmosphere and the outdoor seating really contributed to the vibes of this place, not to mention the food was easily some of my favorite I had on my trip.

In the heart of the city, you will find this interesting and atmospheric spot. The outdoor terrace offers a charming view of part of the Burggarten and the Hofburg Palace. Inside, you can immerse yourself in an absolutely amazing garden atmosphere beneath a beautiful glass roof. The menu includes a variety of beverages, cocktails, food, desserts, and other soft drinks. I ordered beer and enjoyed my time there. Also, here a very friendly stuff that would have a good small talk with you on different languages. Overall, I was truly impressed by this place!

Great place to have meal and drinks. Waiter (bald guy with cashier id rk02 on 15 September 2025 at 1434 as per receipts - sorry didn’t get your name and give tips but management please thanks him for us)was fantastic. Great atmosphere too. Highly recommended. Please tips all the waiters/waitresses if you are happy with their service, sorry we didn’t cause we just arrived in Vienna and didn’t know the tipping culture here. Highly recommended.

Background
Brasserie Palmenhaus Wien is housed in a stunning 19th-century greenhouse, offering a blend of Austrian classics and international fare. Its prime location in the Burggarten makes it a magnet for tourists and locals alike.

Ambience
The glasshouse setting, flooded with natural light and lush greenery, creates an almost cinematic backdrop in the summer heat. ideal for leisurely brunches or afternoon Aperol spritzes.

Service
Impeccable. Staff are warm, attentive, and genuinely charming, striking the rare balance between efficiency and friendliness.

Food & Drink
Flavorful and well-executed, if not revolutionary. The menu leans crowd-pleasing—think schnitzel, fresh salads, and decadent pastries. Portions are generous. it delivers exactly what you’d hope for in such a setting: reliable, tasty comfort food.

Overall
Go for the ambiance and stellar service; stay for the solid, satisfying fare.

Brasserie Palmenhaus in Vienna is a stunning spot set inside a grand glass greenhouse by the Burggarten. The atmosphere is elegant yet relaxed, with beautiful views and plenty of natural light. The menu blends Austrian classics with international dishes, all well prepared, though prices are on the higher side. Service can be a bit slow when busy, but overall it’s a stylish place for brunch, lunch, or drinks in one of Vienna’s most charming

Palmenhaus in Vienna is such a stunning place—dining inside the historic glasshouse surrounded by lush greenery feels truly unique. The atmosphere is vibrant and elegant, and the food is delicious with fresh flavors. Service was attentive and welcoming, making the whole experience really enjoyable.

placeMetadata.name: Karlsplatz

sources.snippet: Just in front of the Karlskirche is the wonderful arts and crafts market in  Resselpark. This is the best place for anyone who is interested in arts and craft. Besides the many unique items that you can buy here, you can watch the processing of glass, wood, ceramics, leather and jewellery and thus gain an insight into the craft.
sources.shortName: Romantic Christmas markets in Vienna

placeMetadata.description: Bustling square, one of Vienna's largest, with a stately 18th-century Baroque church.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Karlsplatz is a lively square in Vienna, known for being one of the city's largest. It features an impressive 18th-century Baroque church, the St. Charles Church, with its striking blue dome. Nearby, visitors can explore the bustling Naschmarkt, Vienna's most popular market. Additionally, during winter, Karlsplatz hosts a traditional Christmas market right in front of the church.

placeMetadata.name: Austrian Parliament

sources.snippet: The Parliament is located very close to the Old Town in Vienna. We absolutely loved the architecture of Austria’s Parliament building. The high, winding stairs and the monumental bronze horse tamer look pretty impressive.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna For Couples [With Map]

placeMetadata.description: Guided tours of the lavish chambers in this imposing neoclassical building with a visitor center.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Austrian Parliament Building, located along the Ringstrasse, is a grand neoclassical structure that reflects Austria's history of secular liberal politics. The building offers guided tours through its opulent chambers and features a visitor center for visitors to learn about its significance. Outside the building, statues such as Pallas Athena and classical historians symbolize the importance of knowledge in politics. Visitors can also enjoy a leisurely walk in the beautiful Volksgarten before exploring this iconic landmark.

reviews.reviewText:
The whole building itself represents obligation, dedication and well kept heritage.
Exterior and Interior has great Neoclassical resemblance,
that on being built by authentic European architects.
True masters of respectful representation.
The Pallas Athena fountain is a grand masterpiece in front of the building and it locks your gaze while you walk or drive past it.
Highly recommended for architecture lovers and history enthusiasts

We took part in the free guided tour and it was an excellent experience. The building is stunning, with impressive architecture and beautifully restored interiors. Our guide was knowledgeable, engaging and provided fascinating insights into Austrian history, politics and the workings of the parliament. The tour was well-organized, easy to follow and a great way to learn more about the country’s democratic processes. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors!

Impressive historic building in Vienna! Beautiful architecture with stunning details, perfect for photos. Guided tours offer insight into Austria’s political history. A must-visit for history and architecture enthusiasts. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐”

Vienna’s Parliament is one of those places that impresses both inside and out. From the outside, the building is pure grandeur—massive columns, elegant statues, and a perfectly balanced neoclassical design that looks like something straight from ancient Greece. The Pallas Athena fountain out front adds even more drama and symbolism to the scene.

But going inside took it to another level. The interior is elegant, rich in detail, and surprisingly modern in parts after its recent renovation. The mix of historical halls, especially the grand National Council chamber, with sleek new elements like the visitor center and rooftop terrace, makes it feel alive and current—not just a relic of the past.

A must to visit in Vienna. Excellent experience to visit and learn about the Austrian democracy and political system. Magnificent building and architecture with lots of history. Free guided tours are available in various languages . They also have a nice and good restaurant for public whit reasonable w

Impressive!
Beautiful architecture and statues.
We love parks, and of course, we went to visit the Volksgarten park and its rose garden. So, as we were only a few steps away from the Parliament...
One of the most beautiful buildings in Vienna, not to be missed.
Just take a look at the photos.

Just casually strolled into the parliament museum. They have a nice section explaining the history of the Austrian democracy. They have a public library there as well. You can also interact with the members of parliament digitally. Cool place.

We really enjoyed our time here, visiting this impressive Parliament building. You can do so as part of an organized group and it's free. Inside you will learn a lot about the history and democracy of Austria. big congrats for our guide, Max. Very professional and dedicated at his job.

The architecture is impressive, taking lots of inspiration from Greek culture. Everything in the visitors center is modern and bright, and the hallways and rooms of the Parliament are full of historic furniture and walls.

Definitely worth paying a visit while you find yourself in Vienna as you're not gonna regret the time spent here.

placeMetadata.name: Stadtpark

sources.snippet: Vienna is the home of classical music, and if music be the food of love, play on. Stroll in the footsteps of the great composers, you can pick up a map with a suggested itinerary at the Tourist Information Centre. Looking for more things to do in Vienna?.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Vienna

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Stadtpark in Vienna is a picturesque spot, featuring the iconic golden Johann Strauss memorial and several other monuments and sculptures. It's known for being the richest park in Vienna for its collection of statues, including those of Franz Schubert, Franz Lehar, Robert Stolz, Hans Makart, Anton Bruckner, and Andreas Zelinka. Visitors can spend a leisurely day here feeding ducks by the pond or enjoying coffee from Espresso Mobil.

reviews.reviewText:
I really love this station, it's location is not the most useful, being relatively close to other better connected u-bahn stations. But it's setting is perfect, sitting just inside Stadtpark it feels urban and clean and open.

Otto Wagner's pavilion as an entry gate works perfectly in the setting.
Stumbled upon this park on my way to the theatre, it is beautiful, so calm yet lots of people just vibing

A beautiful park in Vienna, among many others!
Don't miss the golden statue of Johan Strauss, especially at sunset.

Cozy park for a nice stroll on a beautiful day. In summer the park comes to life with special events . Nice little ponds and beer gartens. Don't skip the opportunity for an apfelstrudel with icecream or a slice of sacher torte.
The only U-Bahn station that retains its original appearance.
Nice old school metro stop, and city park

While driving through in the subway - if you have the time - get out here and walk around the station. The combination of Wienfluss, Stadtpark and the stations historic architecture make for a great photo scenery ;)
Its a great experience to ride the metro here. It was in front of Inter Continental Wien.

placeMetadata.name: Kahlenberg

sources.snippet: Venture to the Kahlenberg, a hill on the outskirts of Vienna, where you’ll be rewarded with a breathtaking panoramic view of the city. As the sun sets, watch the sky erupt in a symphony of colors, casting a warm glow over the cityscape. With your arms wrapped around each other, bask in the beauty of this unforgettable moment.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaways in Vienna: A Whirlwind Waltz of Love in the Imperial City

placeMetadata.description: A popular escape from the city, this 1588 ft. hill offers a variety of walking trails & city views.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Kahlenberg, a 1588 ft. hill located just outside Vienna in the Vienna Woods, offers stunning city views and a peaceful retreat into nature. Visitors can explore walking trails through the surrounding forests and enjoy panoramic vistas of the city skyline and the Danube River. The hill is home to cozy cafes, restaurants, and the historic Kahlenberg Church, adding cultural appeal to its natural beauty.

reviews.reviewText: I went here on my last day. I almost didn’t go as it was the last thing on my agenda but I’m so glad I did! You take the 38A bus up - best bus journey of my life. It is the last stop and you are very much there. Great views from the top overlooking Vienna. Definitely bring a jacket / wrap up. I ordered a coffee at the local shop there and stayed to watch the sunset.
Very nice view, however the peak itself hasn't got any - maybe through the tower, but it is closed during the week. For the view you  have to go to the Kahlenberg restaurant nearby - can't miss it.
Beautiful view points ,rest diff trails are all for hiking .Nothing special ,busses were full.

Pretty hill just 30min from the center of Vienna by streetcar or bus. Perfect for escaping the city and enjoying nature. So popular that it's unfortunately hard to find a quiet spot!
